characters.name: Applejack
characters.description: Applejack is a female Earth pony and one of the main characters of My Little Pony Friendship is Magic. She lives and works at Sweet Apple Acres with her grandmother Granny Smith, her older brother Big McIntosh, her younger sister Apple Bloom, and her dog Winona. She represents the element of honesty.

characters.name: Pinkie Pie
characters.description: Pinkie Pie, full name Pinkamena Diane Pie, is a female Earth pony and one of the main characters of My Little Pony Friendship is Magic. She is an energetic and sociable baker at Sugarcube Corner, where she lives on the second floor with her toothless pet alligator Gummy, and she represents the element of laughter. Pinkie writes and performs many songs, and she is the source of many of the show's comical and cartoonish gags. She is called Ponka Po in some merchandise.

characters.name: Aloe
characters.description: The spa ponies, Lotus Blossom and Aloe, are two female Earth ponies who work at their co-owned[4][5] Ponyville Day Spa. In some credits and different merchandise, Lotus Blossom is called Lotus Bloom or simply Lotus, and Aloe is called Aloe Vera.

characters.name: Blue Bobbin
characters.description: A Rarity For You salespony in The Saddle Row Review and Fake It 'Til You Make It. She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game, and acts as a helper during the "Fake It 'Til You Make It" boss battle event. Her bio states, "This 'Rarity for You' shop-pony knows WAY more about organza than Rainbow Dash. Granted, that's a pretty low bar." Her cutie mark is a spool of blue thread. Voiced by Caitlyn Bairstow.

characters.name: Butternut
characters.description: An acorn farmer who appears in My Little Pony Best Gift Ever as Oak Nut's wife and Pistachio's mother. She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game; her bio states, "The proud proprietress of Sweet Acorn Orchard -- along with her husband -- Butternut is always thankful to meet someone who can help inspire her son." Voiced by Ingrid Nilson.

characters.name: Charity Kindheart
characters.description: A Bridleway costume designer and founder of the Midsummer Theatre Revival in Made in Manehattan. Her cutie mark is a heart-shaped pincushion. She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of her states, "Watch as she whips up her costumes with flair, restoring the theater so that art can be shared."

characters.name: Cheerilee
characters.description: Cheerilee is a female Earth pony in Ponyville and supporting character in the show. She is a teacher at the Ponyville Schoolhouse.

characters.name: Cherry Jubilee
characters.description: Cherry Jubilee is a female Earth pony who first appears in the season two episode The Last Roundup. She is the owner and boss of Cherry Hill Ranch in Dodge Junction. She is called Cherries Jubilant in some merchandise.

characters.name: Coco Pommel
characters.description: Coco Pommel, or Miss Pommel, is a female Earth pony and supporting character who first appears in the season four episode Rarity Takes Manehattan. She is a Bridleway dressmaker and Suri Polomare's former assistant.

characters.name: Coloratura
characters.description: Coloratura, nicknamed Rara and stage-named Countess Coloratura, is a female Earth pony and supporting character who appears in the season five episode The Mane Attraction and the season nine episode The Last Problem. She is a famous pop singer in Equestria and a childhood friend of Applejack's.

characters.name: Dr. Fauna
characters.description: Dr. Fauna, also called Mane Goodall and Mane Cureall, is a female Earth pony veterinarian who first appears in the season two episode Secret of My Excess. She has a light yellow coat, two-tone blue mane and tail, brown eyes, and a cutie mark of a dog's head, cat's head, and white bird. She is named "Dr. Fauna" in the show and "Mane Goodall" and "Mane Cureall" in merchandise.

characters.name: The Headless Horse
characters.description: The Headless Horse is a horse-like creature and the eponymous character of the ghost story The Legend of The Headless Horse. It is alluded to in the episodes Look Before You Sleep, Sleepless in Ponyville, and Scare Master and other media.

characters.name: Aunt Holiday
characters.description: Aunt Holiday and Auntie Lofty are an Earth pony and Pegasus romantic couple and the aunts of Scootaloo. They first appear in the chapter book Ponyville Mysteries: Riddle of the Rusty Horseshoe, and they make physical appearances in My Little Pony: Ponyville Mysteries Issue #3 and the season nine episode The Last Crusade.

characters.name: Hoofer Steps
characters.description: A Russian-accented dance instructor in On Your Marks. Partly resembles "Stardom" and S08E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #1. Her cutie mark is an array of dance steps. Voiced by Tabitha St. Germain. She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Junebug
characters.description: Junebug is a female Earth pony who first appears in the season two episode Secret of My Excess. She has a dark chartreuse coat, a two-toned orange mane, and mint green eyes. Her cutie mark is of three leaf sprigs in the show and a bumblebee in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Lighthoof
characters.description: A student/cheerleader at the School of Friendship in 2, 4, 6, Greaaat. Her cutie mark is a horseshoe and two pompoms. Voiced by Kelli Ogmundson.

characters.name: Lotus Blossom
characters.description: The spa ponies, Lotus Blossom and Aloe, are two female Earth ponies who work at their co-owned[4][5] Ponyville Day Spa. In some credits and different merchandise, Lotus Blossom is called Lotus Bloom or simply Lotus, and Aloe is called Aloe Vera.

characters.name: Mage Meadowbrook
characters.description: Mage Meadowbrook, or simply Meadowbrook, is a female Earth pony and figure of Equestrian legend first mentioned in season five's The Cutie Map - Part 1. She makes her first physical appearance in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #58 and her first in-show appearance in the season seven episode A Health of Information.

characters.name: Mane-iac
characters.description: The Mane-iac is a female Earth pony super-villain from Maretropolis who first appears in the season four episode Power Ponies. She is the archenemy of the comic book superhero team, the Power Ponies. She is called Mane-iac Mayhem in some merchandise.

characters.name: Mare Do Well
characters.description: Mare Do Well, also called the Mysterious Mare Do Well, is a superhero alter ego created by Twilight Sparkle, Applejack, Fluttershy, Rarity, and Pinkie Pie. She first appears in the season two episode The Mysterious Mare Do Well, and she is alluded to in other media and merchandise.

characters.name:
Pinkie's sister
Maud Pie
characters.description: Doctor Maud Pie, full name Maudileena[note 1] Daisy Pie, is a female Earth pony and Pinkie Pie's older sister. She is first seen as a filly in a portrait in Pinkie Pride, before first appearing in person as a grown mare in the season four episode of the same name, and her human counterpart appears in the My Little Pony Equestria Girls franchise; both counterparts also appear in IDW comics. She is called Maud Rock Pie in some merchandise.

characters.name: Mayor Mare
characters.description: Mayor Mare is a female Earth pony and the mayor of Ponyville who first appears in Friendship is Magic, part 1. She is frequently depicted giving speeches.

characters.name: Mrs. Cup Cake
characters.description: Mr. Carrot Cake and Mrs. Cup Cake (née Chiffon Swirl) are two Earth ponies who are the owners of Sugarcube Corner and Pinkie Pie's employers and landlords, as they rent the loft above the shop to her.[5] In the season two episode Baby Cakes, they become parents to twin foals Pound Cake and Pumpkin Cake. Mrs. Cake is called Mrs. Dazzle Cake and Mrs. Pink in some different merchandise.

characters.name: Ms. Harshwhinny
characters.description: Ms. Harshwhinny is a female Earth pony who is mentioned by title in the season three episode Just for Sidekicks and first appears in Games Ponies Play. She is the real Equestria Games inspector whom Ms. Peachbottom is mistaken for.

characters.name: Ms. Peachbottom
characters.description: Ms. Peachbottom is a female Earth pony who appears in Games Ponies Play and makes cameo appearances in Rarity Takes Manehattan, Equestria Games, and Uncommon Bond. She is mistaken for the Equestria Games Inspector by Rainbow Dash and her friends as they take her on an in-depth tour of the Crystal Empire over the course of the episode. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in home media closed captioning and other depictions.

characters.name: Nurse Redheart
characters.description: Nurse Redheart is a female Earth pony who works as a nurse at Ponyville Hospital. She has a white coat, pink mane and tail, blue eyes, and a varying cutie mark at least of a medical cross with a heart in each corner. She wears a nurse's cap that bears an emblem with the same design as her cutie mark.

characters.name: Orange Slice
characters.description: A Whinnyapolis tourist and Chargrill Breadwinner's wife in Spice Up Your Life. Also appears in Viva Las Pegasus, Once Upon a Zeppelin, and Grannies Gone Wild. Her cutie mark is an orange slice. Voiced by Enid-Raye Adams.

characters.name: Photo Finish
characters.description: Photo Finish is a female Earth pony and famous fashion photographer in Equestria who first appears in the season one episode Green Isn't Your Color.

characters.name: Prim Hemline
characters.description: Prim Hemline is a female Earth pony who appears in the season four episodes Rarity Takes Manehattan and Equestria Games. She is a fashion critic and judge for Manehattan's Fashion Week.

characters.name: Professor Fossil
characters.description: Appears in Shadow Play - Part 1 and A Rockhoof and a Hard Place as the professor of an archaeological dig at Rockhoof's island home. Shares her body design with Prim Hemline, Stormy Flare, "Greenhoof Hooffield", "Betsey Trotson", "Clarity Cut", "Candy Curls", "Lilac Meadow", Old Money, S09E19 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1, and partly S08E01 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1. Her cutie mark is a pickaxe and rock. She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game. Enterplay collectible card game Friends Forever #19 C lists her name with a trademark symbol and states, "A more cautious archeologist than some others, Professor Fossil still has strong opinions about what belongs in a museum." Voiced by Kelli Ogmundson.

characters.name: Roma
characters.description: Roma is the placeholder name of a female Earth pony with a cream-yellow coat, two-tone brown mane, blue-green eyes, and a cutie mark of three tomatoes. She is unnamed in the show, credited only as "Vendor" in the closing credits of One Bad Apple and referred to as "MARKET SALESPONY" in the My Little Pony guidebook The Elements of Harmony.

characters.name: Sapphire Shores
characters.description: Sapphire Shores is a famous female Earth pony pop star singer from Canterlot, whom Rarity addresses as "The Pony of Pop". She first appears in the episode A Dog and Pony Show.

characters.name: Shimmy Shake
characters.description: A student/cheerleader at the School of Friendship in 2, 4, 6, Greaaat. Her cutie mark is a gust of wind and two pompoms. Voiced by Diana Kaarina. Shares her name with Twist's mother in the original version of Smile Song.

characters.name: Spoiled Rich
characters.description: Spoiled Rich (née Spoiled Milk) is a female Earth pony and Diamond Tiara's manipulative and overbearing mother. She is first mentioned indirectly by Babs Seed in One Bad Apple, and she makes her series debut in Crusaders of the Lost Mark.

characters.name: Suri Polomare
characters.description: Suri Polomare is a female Earth pony and the antagonist in the season four episode Rarity Takes Manehattan, appearing alongside her assistant Coco Pommel. She is named Buttonbelle in some merchandise.

characters.name:
Daring Do Collector
Teddie Safari
characters.description: Teddie Safari is the placeholder name of a female pony who first appears in Trade Ya! She has a very light yellow coat, brilliant gamboge and light amber mane and tail, moderate harlequin eyes, and a cutie mark of three teddy bears. She is unnamed in the show, only being referred to as "Daring Do Collector" in the credits of Trade Ya! and in The Journal of the Two Sisters, and as "Receptionist Pony" in the credits of The Point of No Return.

characters.name: Torch Song
characters.description: The Pony Tones, or Ponytones, are a vocal quintet who appear in Filli Vanilli. The group is initially a quartet consisting of Rarity (soprano), Big McIntosh (bass), Toe-Tapper (tenor), and Torch Song (alto); Fluttershy later joins the group as a part-time fifth member.

characters.name: Trapeze Star
characters.description: Appears in Viva Las Pegasus as a trapeze/magic artist in Ponet Fantastique. Also appears in Rarity's Peek Behind the Boutique episode 1. Her cutie mark is a trapeze bar and several blue stars. Voiced by Zara Durrani. Enterplay collectible card game Defenders of Equestria #54 C Trapeze Star, Acrobatic Magic quotes, "Acrobats and magicians are a dime a dozen... But have you ever seen an acrobat pull a rabbit out of a hat?! I don’t think so!"

characters.name: Tree Hugger
characters.description: Tree Hugger is a female Earth pony who first appears in the season five episode Make New Friends but Keep Discord. She is Fluttershy's friend and guest to the Grand Galloping Gala. Her demeanor and affectations are reminiscent of the hippie subculture of the 1960s.

characters.name: Mrs. Trotsworth
characters.description: Appears in Daring Done?, Road to Friendship, and Daring Do and the Marked Thief of Marapore as the owner and caretaker of the Get On Inn. In The Marked Thief of Marapore, she is described as a unicorn. She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game. Voiced by Janyse Jaud.

characters.name: Wrangler
characters.description: Appears in Fluttershy Leans In as an expert animal herder. Shares her design with "Yuma Spurs", S05E06 Unnamed Earth Mare #9, and S05E06 Unnamed Earth Mare #14. Her cutie mark is a lasso. Voiced by Kazumi Evans. Also mentioned on My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #54 page 2. She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name:
Conductor
All Aboard
characters.description: All Aboard and Steamer are the placeholder names of two male Earth ponies who work as Friendship Express train conductors. They are officially unnamed, being referred to simply by their titles: "All Aboard" is Conductor in some episode credits, Gameloft's mobile game, and some episode scripts, is Conductor Pony in short credits, some episode scripts, and short script(s), is Ticket Agent in some episode credits and some episode scripts, and is Porter Pony in some episode credits and some episode script(s); "Steamer" is Train Conductor in credits and scripts.

characters.name: Big Bucks
characters.description: Appears in Grannies Gone Wild as one of a pair of Las Pegasus magicians, with Jack Pot. Also appears in Between Dark and Dawn. His cutie mark is a white star and black top hat. Voiced by Tariq Leslie.

characters.name: Big Daddy McColt
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts and Fluttershy Leans In as the patriarch of the McColt family. Shares his structure and eye color with S05E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #11, S05E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #14, and Short Fuse. Voiced by Peter Kelamis. He is a character in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Big McIntosh
characters.description: Big McIntosh is a male Earth pony, the older brother of Applejack and Apple Bloom, Sugar Belle's husband, and a member of the Apple family. He makes his debut in the first episode, during which he idly walks in Ponyville the moment Twilight Sparkle first arrives. Later, Applejack introduces him during the Apple family reunion, although he has no speaking roles until the fourth episode, Applebuck Season. He is soft-spoken and laconic, and often replies with a simple "eeyup" or "nnope." He is first called by the nickname Big Mac in The Cutie Pox. Later episodes refer to him with this nickname more often than with his real name, even in the credits.

characters.name: Braeburn
characters.description: Braeburn is a male Earth pony and Applejack, Big McIntosh, and Apple Bloom's cousin from Appleloosa. He first appears in the season one episode Over a Barrel. Like most of the other named Apple family members, his name is apple-related, being the name of an apple cultivar.

characters.name: Buried Lede
characters.description: A Manehattan newspaper columnist in The Saddle Row Review. Listed by name within "More Manehattan Ponies" in the Ultimate Guide published by Orchard Books in the United Kingdom. Shares his chin style and mustache style with Whiplash. Shares his coat and mane colors and somewhat design with "Heisenbuck". His cutie mark is a pencil and pad. Resembles J. Jonah Jameson from the Spider-Man comics. Voiced by Alan Marriot.

characters.name: Burnt Oak
characters.description: A firewood salespony and an old friend of Bright Mac's in The Perfect Pear. Also appears in It Isn't the Mane Thing About You, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, The Big Mac Question, and The Last Problem. Somewhat similar to the Stranger. Burnt Oak and Young Burnt Oak are characters in Gameloft's mobile game, with Young Burnt Oak serving as a boss battle helper during "The Pinkie Parents Problem." Young Burnt Oak's bio states, "Back in his younger days, this aspiring firewood salespony used to hang out with Bright Mac all the time" His cutie mark is a burnt oak branch. Voiced by Bill Mondy.

characters.name: Cattail
characters.description: Appears in A Health of Information and My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #58 as a descendant of Mage Meadowbrook. Also appears in Shadow Play - Part 1, A Rockhoof and a Hard Place, and The Last Problem. He is a character in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of him states, "This descendant of the famous Mage Meadowbrook may not have the reputation of his legendary ancestor, but he does have the accent." Shares his body design with Claude, S05E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #21, Stinky Bottom, "Leadnail McColt", S06E03 Unnamed Earth Stallion #4, "Port Wine", Coriander Cumin, and "Mint Condition". His cutie mark is a sun spiral and two crossed cattail stalks. Voiced by Doron Bell.

characters.name: Chargrill Breadwinner
characters.description: A Whinnyapolis tourist and Orange Slice's husband in Spice Up Your Life. Also appears in Viva Las Pegasus, Once Upon a Zeppelin, and Grannies Gone Wild. His cutie mark is a grill. Voiced by Jim Miller.

characters.name: Cheese Sandwich
characters.description: Cheese Sandwich is a male Earth pony and the self-titled "super duper party pony" who first appears in the season four episode Pinkie Pride. He has since appeared in later episodes, IDW comics, and other media. In the series finale The Last Problem, he is Pinkie Pie's husband years in the future.

characters.name: Code Red
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony The Movie; voiced by Adam Bengis, thanks to Beth Gowers at the Make-A-Wish Foundation of New Jersey. See also Stellar Eclipse, Angel Wings, and S07E14 Unnamed Unicorn Stallion #1.

characters.name: Double Diamond
characters.description: Double Diamond is a male Earth pony who first appears in the season five premiere. He is one of the residents of the equality village founded by Starlight Glimmer.

characters.name: Dr. Caballeron
characters.description: Dr. Caballeron is a male Earth pony who first appears as an antagonist in the season four episode Daring Don't. He also appears in the chapter book Daring Do and the Eternal Flower and the IDW comics. He is an enemy of Daring Do and a collaborator with fellow villain Ahuizotl.

characters.name: Dr. Horse
characters.description: Dr. Horse, or Doc Top, is a male Earth pony pediatrician who first appears in the season two episode Secret of My Excess. He has a light brown coat, orange mane and tail, gold eyes, and a cutie mark of a stethoscope and varying first aid kit. He is named "Dr. Horse" in the show and "Doc Top" in merchandise.

characters.name: Feather Bangs
characters.description: Feather Bangs is a male Earth pony who appears in the season seven episode Hard to Say Anything and the season nine episode The Last Crusade. He is a flirtatious singer with a romantic interest in Sugar Belle.

characters.name: Filthy Rich
characters.description: Filthy Rich is a male Earth pony and Diamond Tiara's father. He is introduced in the season two episode Family Appreciation Day. He is called Berry Rich in some merchandise. His names are based on the phrases filthy rich and very rich, meaning "very wealthy".

characters.name: Gizmo
characters.description: Gizmo, Poindexter, or Gyro is a male Earth pony who appears in the episodes Putting Your Hoof Down, Just for Sidekicks, and Trade Ya! and in the IDW comics. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named "Gizmo" with a trademark symbol and "Gyro" in different versions of merchandise and named "Poindexter" in the comics.

characters.name: Gladmane
characters.description: Gladmane is a male Earth pony and the antagonist of the season six episode Viva Las Pegasus. He is the former owner of a luxury resort hotel in Las Pegasus and Flim and Flam's former employer.

characters.name: Grub Hooffield
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as the founding member of the Hooffield family.

characters.name: Hard Hat
characters.description: Appears in Fluttershy Leans In as a construction pony for Fluttershy's sanctuary project. Also appears in Honest Apple. Mentioned on My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #54 page 2 and Issue #73 page 3. He is a character in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of him states, "When it comes to construction, his skills are the pinnacle -- though his designs can be just a bit clinical." Shares his design, eye color, and construction equipment with "Rivet" and his body type, mane and tail style, eye color, and construction equipment design with S05E10 Unnamed Unicorn Stallion #4. His cutie mark is a yellow hard hat. Voiced by Mark Gibbon.

characters.name: Hoity Toity
characters.description: Hoity Toity is a fancy Earth pony and a major representative of the fashion world from Canterlot. The term "hoity toity" means "self-important, haughty, or pompous". Hoity Toity's character design is strongly reminiscent of the late German fashion designer Karl Lagerfeld, the same basis as "Stärke Kragen", in the style of his mane and clothing. His accent is a stereotypical upper class American one.

characters.name:
Mayor of Baltimare
Mayor Baltimare
characters.description: Appears in A Royal Problem as the mayor of Baltimare arguing with the mayor of Fillydelphia. Somewhat resembles "Wacky Hair Day and Spray". His cutie mark is a gray-feathered bird. Voiced by Scott Underwood. He is listed sometimes by name in A Royal Problem's broadcast script, but he is otherwise listed simply as "Mayor of Baltimare" rather than by name; his name follows the same pattern as Queen Trottingham.

characters.name:
Mayor of Fillydelphia
Mayor Cream Cheese
characters.description: Appears in A Royal Problem as the mayor of Fillydelphia arguing with the mayor of Baltimare. His cutie mark is a Philadelphia cheesesteak. Voiced by Tony Alcantar. The mayor of Baltimare addresses him by name in A Royal Problem and its locked script, but he is otherwise listed simply as "Mayor of Fillydelphia" rather than by name; his name references Philadelphia cream cheese.

characters.name: Mr. Carrot Cake
characters.description: Mr. Carrot Cake and Mrs. Cup Cake (née Chiffon Swirl) are two Earth ponies who are the owners of Sugarcube Corner and Pinkie Pie's employers and landlords, as they rent the loft above the shop to her.[5] In the season two episode Baby Cakes, they become parents to twin foals Pound Cake and Pumpkin Cake. Mrs. Cake is called Mrs. Dazzle Cake and Mrs. Pink in some different merchandise.

characters.name: Mr. Stripes
characters.description: Mr. Stripes and Plaid Stripes are a father and daughter pair of Earth ponies who appear in the season six episode The Saddle Row Review. Mr. Stripes is the landlord for the building where Rarity's Manehattan boutique Rarity For You is located, and Plaid Stripes is a young salespony that works in the boutique.

characters.name: Mudbriar
characters.description: Mudbriar is a male Earth pony and Maud Pie's boyfriend who first appears in the season eight episode The Maud Couple.

characters.name: Oak Nut
characters.description: An acorn farmer who appears in My Little Pony Best Gift Ever as Butternut's husband and Pistachio's father. He is a character in Gameloft's mobile game; his bio states, "The proud proprietor of Sweet Acorn Orchard -- along with his wife -- Oak Nut is always happy to welcome new guests from out of town." His cutie mark is an acorn plant. Voiced by Garry Chalk.

characters.name: Piles McColt
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as the founding member of the McColt family. Shares his tail style and beard style with Ginger Beard.

characters.name: Quibble Pants
characters.description: Quibble Pants is a male Earth pony and Daring Do fan who appears in the season six episode Stranger Than Fan Fiction and the season nine episodes Common Ground and The Last Problem.

characters.name: Rockhoof
characters.description: Rockhoof is a male Earth pony and figure of Equestrian legend first mentioned in season six's The Crystalling - Part 2. He makes his first physical appearance in My Little Pony: Legends of Magic Issue #2 and his first in-show appearance in the season seven episode Campfire Tales.

characters.name: Earth pony royal guards
characters.description: royal guards, some also referred to as the E.U.P. (Earth, Unicorn, Pegasus) Guard of the Protective Pony Platoons, are various groups of armored ponies, griffons, Hippogriffs, or gargoyles that serve various members of royalty. They act as bodyguards, ceremonial guards in festivities, soldiers, and chauffeurs on several occasions. The guards are generally shown wearing extremely serious expressions and usually don't speak, but when they do, their voice is provided by Jayson Thiessen, Andrew Francis, Peter New, Ian Hanlin, Brian Drummond, Jason Simpson and/or Scott Underwood. Their cutie marks are obscured by their uniforms.

characters.name: Rusty Bucket
characters.description: Appears in Frenemies as the guardian of Mt. Everhoof. Voiced by Scott Underwood.

characters.name: Sans Smirk
characters.description: Appears in The Last Laugh as the vice-president (later manager) of Cheese Sandwich's Amusement Factory. His cutie mark is a wet blanket. Voiced by Jesse Inocalla.

characters.name: Sheriff Silverstar
characters.description: Sheriff Silverstar is a male Earth pony who first appears in the season one episode Over a Barrel. He serves as the sheriff of Appleloosa.

characters.name: Silver Shill
characters.description: Silver Shill is a male Earth pony who first appears in the episode Leap of Faith as an employee of Flim and Flam who helps endorse, and later sell, their fraudulent products. He also appears in the episodes Equestria Games and Twilight's Kingdom - Part 2.

characters.name: Snap Shutter
characters.description: Snap Shutter and Mane Allgood are an Earth pony/Pegasus duo of world travelers/adventurers and the married parents of Scootaloo. They are first mentioned in the chapter book Ponyville Mysteries: Riddle of the Rusty Horseshoe, and they make their physical debut in the season nine episode The Last Crusade.

characters.name: Starstreak
characters.description: Lily Lace, Starstreak, and Inky Rose are three fashion designer ponies who appear in the season seven episode Honest Apple as contestants in Rarity's Carousel Boutique Couture du Future Fashion Contest.

characters.name:
Train Conductor
Steamer
characters.description: All Aboard and Steamer are the placeholder names of two male Earth ponies who work as Friendship Express train conductors. They are officially unnamed, being referred to simply by their titles: "All Aboard" is Conductor in some episode credits, Gameloft's mobile game, and some episode scripts, is Conductor Pony in short credits, some episode scripts, and short script(s), is Ticket Agent in some episode credits and some episode scripts, and is Porter Pony in some episode credits and some episode script(s); "Steamer" is Train Conductor in credits and scripts.

characters.name:
Street Merchant
Stinky Bottom
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan in Made in Manehattan as a hat merchant. Mentioned in The Saddle Row Review and Rollercoaster of Friendship. Listed as "Hat Merchant" within "More Manehattan Ponies" in the Ultimate Guide published by Orchard Books in the United Kingdom. Shares his body type with Claude, S05E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #21, "Leadnail McColt", S06E03 Unnamed Earth Stallion #4, "Port Wine", Coriander Cumin, "Mint Condition", and Cattail. He is a character in Gameloft's mobile game. His in-game description states "A bratty Manehattan hatter who's a real hater of nattier hats than his. (Try saying THAT three times fast!)" His cutie mark is a top hat. Voiced by Mark Oliver.

characters.name: Svengallop
characters.description: Svengallop is a male Earth pony and the antagonist of the season five episode The Mane Attraction. He is Coloratura's bossy and flamboyant former manager who exploits her for personal gain.

characters.name: Toe-Tapper
characters.description: The Pony Tones, or Ponytones, are a vocal quintet who appear in Filli Vanilli. The group is initially a quartet consisting of Rarity (soprano), Big McIntosh (bass), Toe-Tapper (tenor), and Torch Song (alto); Fluttershy later joins the group as a part-time fifth member.

characters.name: Trouble Shoes
characters.description: Trouble Shoes is a male Earth pony who first appears as a supporting character in the season five episode Appleoosa's Most Wanted. He is an Appleloosa rodeo clown and former outlaw. He is called Troubleshoes Clyde in some promotional material.

characters.name: Twisty Pop
characters.description: Appears in Forever Filly and Yakity-Sax as a balloon animal maker. His cutie mark is two balloons.

characters.name:
Pinkie's mom
Cloudy Quartz
characters.description: Igneous Rock Pie and Cloudy Quartz, also called Pa Pie and Ma Pie respectively, are two married Earth ponies and members of the Pie family who live on a rock farm in Equestria. They are the parents of Limestone Pie, Maud Pie, Pinkie Pie, and Marble Pie.

characters.name:
Pinkie's sister
Limestone Pie
characters.description: Limestone Pie and Marble Pie are female Earth ponies and members of the Pie family. They are Pinkie Pie's oldest and youngest sisters respectively. They first appear as fillies in a flashback in The Cutie Mark Chronicles before debuting as fully grown mares in present day in the chapter book Pinkie Pie and the Rockin' Ponypalooza Party! and the season five episode Hearthbreakers.

characters.name:
Pinkie's sister
Marble Pie
characters.description: Limestone Pie and Marble Pie are female Earth ponies and members of the Pie family. They are Pinkie Pie's oldest and youngest sisters respectively. They first appear as fillies in a flashback in The Cutie Mark Chronicles before debuting as fully grown mares in present day in the chapter book Pinkie Pie and the Rockin' Ponypalooza Party! and the season five episode Hearthbreakers.

characters.name:
Applejack's mother
Pear Butter
characters.description: Bright Mac, full name Bright Macintosh,[note 1] and Pear Butter are the married Earth pony parents of Applejack, Apple Bloom, and Big McIntosh. They physically appear in flashback in the season seven episode The Perfect Pear, and they are alluded to in other episodes and media.

characters.name:
Granny Smith's mother
Sew 'n Sow
characters.description: Granny Smith's mother, seen in a flashback in Family Appreciation Day, looking perturbed when her husband kisses Princess Celestia's hoof; in photos and a flashback in Apple Family Reunion; in a flashback in Bats!; and in a photo on the IDW comics' Micro-Series Issue #6 page 5. Her cutie mark is a sewing machine.

characters.name: Apple Brown Betty
characters.description: Apple Brown Betty is a background Earth pony and a member of the Apple family. She has a brown coat, a two-tone green mane, green eyes, and a cutie mark of an apple Brown Betty. She is named but unidentified in the show, and she is both named and identified in merchandise.

characters.name: Apple Bumpkin
characters.description: Apple Bumpkin is a female background Earth pony and a member of the Apple family who appears commonly throughout the show, often alongside other members of the Apple family. She has a light yellow coat, a bright red mane, light orange eyes, and a cutie mark of three caramel apples. She is called Apple Dazzle in some merchandise.

characters.name: Apple Cider
characters.description: Apple Cider is a female Earth pony and member of the Apple family. She has a light blue coat, gold mane and tail, blue eyes, and a cutie mark of three apple cores. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Apple Cobbler
characters.description: Apple Cobbler is a background Earth pony and a member of the Apple family who appears commonly throughout the series, often alongside other members of the Apple family. She has a toffee colored coat, a yellow mane (with an extra shade of yellow in her tail), and light blue eyes. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise and other media. She shares her design with Red Gala, "Magdalena", and "Sundowner", and shares her design and eye color with S06E04 Unnamed Earth Mare #2.

characters.name: Apple Dumpling
characters.description: Apple Dumpling is a female Earth pony and member of the Apple family. She has a pale green coat, two-tone red mane and tail, teal eyes, and a cutie mark of a dumpling and two apple slices. She has a minor speaking role in Apple Family Reunion.

characters.name: Apple Fritter
characters.description: Apple Fritter is a female Earth pony member of the Apple family who appears throughout the series, often accompanied by other members of the Apple family. She has a light yellow coat and green mane and tail and eyes.

characters.name: Apple Honey
characters.description: Apple Honey is a female Earth pony in the Apple family. She has a light sap green coat, pale goldenrod mane and tail, violet eyes, and a cutie mark of three green-iced cupcakes. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Apple Leaves
characters.description: Apple Leaves is a female Earth pony and member of the Apple family. She has a deep orange coat, green and white mane and tail, grayish purple eyes, and a cutie mark of an apple and five leaves. She has a minor speaking role in Apple Family Reunion.

characters.name: Apple Munchies
characters.description: Apple Munchies is a female Earth pony and member of the Apple family. She has a light green coat, gold mane and tail, reddish-orange eyes, and a cutie mark of three apple cores. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Apple Top
characters.description: An Apple family member who briefly appears in Apple Family Reunion. Shares the design of Caramel Apple, Golden Harvest, and Daisy, the coat and eye colors of Apple Brown Betty and "Apple Crumble", and the coat and mane colors of "Dosie Dough".

characters.name: Aunt Orange
characters.description: Aunt and Uncle Orange are the married Earth pony aunt and uncle of Applejack in the Apple family. They are simply called by their titles-and-shared-name Aunt Orange and Uncle Orange both in The Cutie Mark Chronicles and in Gameloft's mobile game, while the latter Orange is called by that as well as his individual name Mosely Orange in various merchandise.

characters.name: Candy Apples
characters.description: Candy Apples is a background Earth pony and a member of the Apple family. She has a pale green coat, a two-tone red mane, orange eyes, and a cutie mark of a candy apple and caramel apple. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Caramel Apple
characters.description: Caramel Apple is a female Earth pony in the Apple family. She has a pale yellow coat, orange mane and tail, bright green eyes, and a cutie mark of three caramel apples.

characters.name: Florina Tart
characters.description: Florina Tart is a female Earth pony and a member of the Apple family. She has a pale green coat, a two-tone pink mane, deep cerise eyes, and a cutie mark of an apple and three apple blossoms. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Gala Appleby
characters.description: Gala Appleby is a female Earth pony and a member of the Apple family. She has a yellow coat, salmon pink mane and tail, green eyes, and a cutie mark of three apple slices. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise and other media. She has a speaking role in Green Isn't Your Color.

characters.name: Jonagold
characters.description: Jonagold is a background Earth pony and a member of the Apple family. She has a pale yellow coat, a two-tone orange mane, purple eyes, and a cutie mark of three green apples. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise.

characters.name: Lavender Fritter
characters.description: Lavender Fritter is a female Earth pony and member of the Apple family. She has a light yellow coat, two-tone purple mane and tail, green eyes, and a cutie mark of three apple fritters. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise.

characters.name: Magdalena
characters.description: Present at the Apple family reunion in Friendship is Magic, part 1 and also appears in Green Isn't Your Color, The Mysterious Mare Do Well, and Apple Family Reunion. Seen with a light orange mane in Friendship is Magic, part 2. Identical to Red Gala in all but mane color, shares the same design, eye color, and cutie mark as "Sundowner", and shares the same design as Apple Cobbler and S06E04 Unnamed Earth Mare #2. Her cutie mark is three cupcakes with green frosting and apple slices.

characters.name: Peachy Sweet
characters.description: Peachy Sweet is a female Earth pony in the Apple family. She has a yellow-green coat, light red mane and tail, bright lime green eyes, and a cutie mark of a pie. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in another depiction and with a trademark symbol in merchandise.

characters.name: Perfect Pie
characters.description: Perfect Pie, or Apple Pie, is a female Earth pony in the Apple family. She has a cream caramel coat, two-toned green mane and tail, light caramel eyes, and a cutie mark of three apple pies. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Red Gala
characters.description: Red Gala is a background Earth pony and a member of the Apple family who appears commonly throughout the series, often alongside other members of the Apple family. She has a light pink coat, a bright green mane (with an extra shade of green in her tail), and light green eyes. She shares her design with Apple Cobbler, shares her design, eye color, and cutie mark with "Sundowner", is identical to "Magdalena" in all but mane color, and also shares her design with S06E04 Unnamed Earth Mare #2. She is called Crimson Gala in some merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Sundowner
characters.description: A member of the Apple family present at the reunion in Friendship is Magic, part 1. Also appears in Green Isn't Your Color, The Mysterious Mare Do Well, and Magical Mystery Cure. Shares the same design, cutie mark, and eye color as Red Gala and "Magdalena", and shares the same design as Apple Cobbler and S06E04 Unnamed Earth Mare #2. Her cutie mark is three cupcakes with green frosting and apple slices.

characters.name:
Applejack's father
Bright Mac
characters.description: Bright Mac, full name Bright Macintosh,[note 1] and Pear Butter are the married Earth pony parents of Applejack, Apple Bloom, and Big McIntosh. They physically appear in flashback in the season seven episode The Perfect Pear, and they are alluded to in other episodes and media.

characters.name:
Pinkie Pie's father
Igneous Rock Pie
characters.description: Igneous Rock Pie and Cloudy Quartz, also called Pa Pie and Ma Pie respectively, are two married Earth ponies and members of the Pie family who live on a rock farm in Equestria. They are the parents of Limestone Pie, Maud Pie, Pinkie Pie, and Marble Pie.

characters.name:
Granny Smith's father
Pokey Oaks
characters.description: Granny Smith's father, seen in Family Appreciation Day in a flashback, kissing Princess Celestia's hoof in front of his wife; in Apple Family Reunion in photos; in Bats! in a flashback; and—with the top of his head bandaged and his hoof in a sling—in Leap of Faith in the present, in Twilight's Kingdom - Part 1 in a flashback to Leap of Faith, and in Where the Apple Lies. His cutie mark is an acorn and four other seeds.

characters.name: Stinkin' Rich
characters.description: Diamond Tiara's great-grandfather pony, instrumental in the founding of Ponyville. Appears in a sepia flashback in Family Appreciation Day; mentioned in Where the Apple Lies and on the IDW comics' My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #30 pages 4 and 15 and Issue #31 pages 10, 15, and 19; and featured with Granny Smith on Enterplay trading card series 2 #26. His cutie mark is a cent sign.

characters.name: Apple Cinnamon
characters.description: Apple Cinnamon is a background Earth pony and a member of the Apple family. He has a reddish brown coat, a bright green mane, green eyes, and a cutie mark of an apple and two cinnamon sticks. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Apple Core
characters.description: Appears in flashback in The Perfect Pear as a member of the Apple family. Shares his design with "Happy Trails" and S04E07 Unnamed Earth Stallion #2 and his cutie mark with Apple Munchies and Apple Cider. His cutie mark is three apple cores.

characters.name: Apple Split
characters.description: Apple Split, or Apple Bottoms, is a background Earth pony and a member of the Apple family. He has a blue coat, a red mane, reddish brown eyes, and a cutie mark of three bottom halves of apples. He is not named in the show, but he is named "Apple Split" with a trademark symbol in first-party merchandise and named "Apple Bottoms" in second-party other media.

characters.name: Bushel
characters.description: Bushel is the placeholder name of a male Earth pony and a member of the Apple family. He has a golden coat, a two-tone green mane, green eyes, and a cutie mark of a bucket of apples in water.

characters.name: Golden Delicious
characters.description: Golden Delicious is an Apple family pony with a yellow apple cutie mark. In My Little Pony Friendship is Magic, My Little Pony The Movie, Gameloft's mobile game, promotional material, and some merchandise, Golden Delicious is a male Earth pony, while in other merchandise, Golden Delicious is a female unicorn.

characters.name: Half Baked Apple
characters.description: Half Baked Apple is a background Earth pony and a member of the Apple family. He has a bright orange coat, a two-tone reddish brown mane, green eyes, and a cutie mark of a baked apple. He is referred to by name only in Apple Family Reunion's credits and in other media.

characters.name: Happy Trails
characters.description: A member of Granny Smith's family, seen in flashbacks in Family Appreciation Day, Apple Family Reunion, Leap of Faith, and No Second Prances, and in a photo on the IDW comics' Micro-Series Issue #6 page 5. Shares his design with S04E07 Unnamed Earth Stallion #2 and "Apple Core". His cutie mark is three horseshoes.

characters.name: Hayseed Turnip Truck
characters.description: Hayseed Turnip Truck is a male Earth pony in the Apple family who first appears in Sweet and Elite. He has a beige-colored coat, a two-tone brown mane and tail, brown eyes, and a cutie mark of three turnips.

characters.name: Prairie Tune
characters.description: A member of Granny Smith's family, seen in flashbacks in Family Appreciation Day, Apple Family Reunion, and Leap of Faith. His cutie mark is a banjo with two musical notes.

characters.name: Red Delicious
characters.description: Red Delicious is a background Earth pony and a member of the Apple family. He has a light yellow coat, a blue mane, blue eyes, and a cutie mark of a large red apple.

characters.name: Uncle Orange
characters.description: Aunt and Uncle Orange are the married Earth pony aunt and uncle of Applejack in the Apple family. They are simply called by their titles-and-shared-name Aunt Orange and Uncle Orange both in The Cutie Mark Chronicles and in Gameloft's mobile game, while the latter Orange is called by that as well as his individual name Mosely Orange in various merchandise.

characters.name: Wensley
characters.description: Wensley is a background Earth pony and a member of the Apple family. He has a green coat, a bright yellow mane, dark red eyes, and a cutie mark of two apples and a block of cheese. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Amaranthine
characters.description: Appears in Hearth's Warming Eve, both before and during the pageant performance. Also appears in flashback in Shadow Play - Part 2.

characters.name:
Builder Pony
Ambrosia
characters.description: Construction worker from The Mysterious Mare Do Well, Pinkie Pride, Fluttershy Leans In, Between Dark and Dawn, and 2, 4, 6, Greaaat. Shares her coat and eye colors and cutie mark with Gala Appleby. Her cutie mark is three apple slices. She is a character called "Builder Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of her states, "This hard-working mare is more chic than you'd think: When she wears a hard hat, it's ALWAYS pink."

characters.name:
Crystal Chalice Stand Pony
Amethyst Gleam
characters.description: Appears as a trader of crystal chalices at the Rainbow Falls Traders Exchange in Trade Ya!, voiced by Ashleigh Ball. Resembles "Cultivar" and Coco Pommel. Her cutie mark is a purple crystal formation. She is a character called "Crystal Chalice Trader" in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of her states, "This businesspony specializes in providing very expensive and incredibly delicate crystal chalices... in exchange for rusty old horseshoes. She has her reasons." She also appears in a promotional image posted by Hasbro's My Little Pony Facebook page.

characters.name:
Saddle Arabian Mare
Amira
characters.description: Haakim and Amira are the merchandise-used​[​specify​]​ placeholder​[​dubious – discuss‍​]​ names of two Earth ponies who appear in Magic Duel and Equestria Games. They are members of Saddle Arabian royalty or significant authority who appear as members of a delegation to Ponyville.

characters.name: Apple Bottom
characters.description: Appears during the song Raise This Barn in Apple Family Reunion, but is not included in any of the Apple family photos. Shares her design and eye color with S05E24 Unnamed Earth Mare #2, her design with S04E24 Unnamed Earth Mare #4, S02E03 Unnamed Earth Mare #2, and S06E14 Unnamed Earth Mare #2, her mane style and eye color with Apple Stars, Lemon Hearts, Lilac Hearts, and "Golden Glory", her mane style with Twinkleshine, her coat and mane colors and at least part of her cutie mark with Apple Cinnamon, and her coat and mane colors with "Red June".

characters.name:
Sunny Appleloosan
Apple Cherry
characters.description: Appears in Appleloosa in Twilight's Kingdom - Part 2. Shares her design and eye color with Berryshine and Berry Dreams, shares her design with Cherry Berry, shares her coat color and cutie mark with Apple Cobbler, and has a similar color scheme to Princess Glitter Punch. Her cutie mark is an apple brown betty. She is a character called "Sunny Appleloosan" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Apricot Bow
characters.description: Appears at the train station in Dodge Junction during The Last Roundup, being shown the picture of Applejack by Twilight Sparkle. Has the same design, cutie mark, and hat as Sweetie Drops, whose cutie mark is identified by Little, Brown's Mini Pony Collector's Guide and Gameloft's mobile game respectively as three candies and as three bows, the same design and cutie mark design as Grape Delight, and the same design as Shoeshine, Luckette, Lilac Links, and Sunny Smiles.

characters.name: Avalon
characters.description: One of Rarity's models in Rarity Takes Manehattan. In Simple Ways, the drawing of the fashion show seemingly depicts her along with the other models. Also appears in Rarity's Peek Behind the Boutique episode 2.

characters.name:
Hyped-Up Dancer
Azure Velour
characters.description: Appears in The Saddle Row Review as a dancer in DJ Pon-3's dance club. Also depicted on Enterplay collectible card game Defenders of Equestria card #32 R, Ravers, Glowsticks Optional. She is a character called "Hyped-Up Dancer" in Gameloft's mobile game, and she serves as an enemy minion during the Presentable in Periwinkle event. The game's description of her states, "A regular fixture at her preferred club, she likes all of her 'steps' to begin with a 'dub.'"

characters.name: Barbara Banter
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan in Made in Manehattan, Shadow Play - Part 2, Fake It 'Til You Make It, and Daring Doubt and in Las Pegasus in Viva Las Pegasus and Grannies Gone Wild. Her cutie mark is an open book.

characters.name: Beauty Brass
characters.description: Beauty Brass is a female background Earth pony who appears in The Best Night Ever, Equestria Games, and Gameloft's mobile game. She has a light blue coat, brown mane and tail, purple eyes, and a cutie mark of an F-clef. She is unnamed in the series, but she is named in other media.

characters.name: Bell Perin
characters.description: Appears in Winter Wrap Up and My Little Pony The Movie. Has the same tail style and coat and mane colors as Lemon Hearts.

characters.name: Bella Brella
characters.description: A spa pony who appears at Ponyville's Day Spa in Filli Vanilli. Also appears in No Second Prances, in Applejack's "Day" Off, and on My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #46 page 5. Her cutie mark is an umbrella.

characters.name: Belle Star
characters.description: Appears in Dodge Junction during The Last Roundup. Has the same design, eye and partly mane colors, and hat as Sweetie Drops. A similar pony appears without a hat on My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #1 page 3/Dynamic Forces exclusive Cover RE.

characters.name:
Chummy Friendship Student
Berry Bliss
characters.description: Appears in School Daze - Part 1, School Daze - Part 2, the seventh version of the remastered opening sequence, The Parent Map, Non-Compete Clause, Molt Down, Marks for Effort, A Matter of Principals, The Hearth's Warming Club, The End in Friend, Road to Friendship, The Washouts, A Rockhoof and a Hard Place, What Lies Beneath, School Raze - Part 1, School Raze - Part 2, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, She's All Yak, Student Counsel, 2, 4, 6, Greaaat, The Summer Sun Setback, A Horse Shoe-In, The Ending of the End - Part 2, The Last Problem, Teacher of the Month, Starlight the Hypnotist, the Signature My Little Pony magazine issue 102 comic Underwater memories, and MLP8_Promo_Image_with_Copyright as a student at the School of Friendship. Shares her design with S08E09 Unnamed Earth Mare #1. Her cutie mark is three berries. She is a character called "Chummy Friendship Student" in Gameloft's mobile game. Voiced by Kelly Sheridan in Marks for Effort and Cathy Weseluck in School Raze.

characters.name: Berry Dreams
characters.description: Berry Dreams, Charged Up, and Lucky Star are three female Earth ponies who appear once during the Iron Pony competition in Fall Weather Friends. They are unnamed in the show, but they are named in merchandise.

characters.name: Berry Frost
characters.description: Opens a window and joins the chorus of the Smile Song in A Friend in Deed. Shares the same design as "Mjölna" from the back and "Forest Spirit" and the same mane style as Rainbowshine, Orange Swirl, and Sugar Twist.

characters.name: Berry Icicle
characters.description: Is seen in Winter Wrap Up. Identical to Spring Forward in all but mane color. Her cutie mark is a few carrots.

characters.name: Berry Preppy
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan in Made in Manehattan, The Saddle Row Review, Shadow Play - Part 2, and She's All Yak. She is named with a trademark symbol in the twentieth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that she "& Neigh Sayer share the latest fashions." Her cutie mark is a strawberry and bunch of grapes.

characters.name: Berryshine
characters.description: Berryshine, or Berry Punch, is a female Earth pony with a web color plum coat, raspberry pink mane and tail, fandango eyes, and a cutie mark of a bunch of grapes and a strawberry. Lauren Faust privately named the character "Pinot Noir" after her favorite wine, but the character was later explicitly named "Berryshine" and "Berry Punch" in different merchandise and games. Berryshine shares her design with Cherry Berry. She has a speaking role in It Isn't the Mane Thing About You, the chapter book Rainbow Dash and the Daring Do Double Dare, and in the IDW comics' My Little Pony: Friends Forever Issue #23.

characters.name:
Cutting-Edge Shop-Pony
Betsey Trotson
characters.description: Appears in The Saddle Row Review and Fake It 'Til You Make It as a Rarity For You salespony. Shares her body design with Prim Hemline, Stormy Flare, "Greenhoof Hooffield", "Clarity Cut", "Candy Curls", "Lilac Meadow", Professor Fossil, Old Money, S09E19 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1, and partly S08E01 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1. She is a character named "Cutting-Edge Shop-Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game, and acts as a helper during the "Fake It 'Til You Make It" boss battle event. Her bio states, "It takes ages for this 'Rarity for You' staffer to do her eyeliners right--but it's SO worth it." Her cutie mark is a red heart dripping red paint. Resembles fashion designer Betsey Johnson.

characters.name: Betty Hoof
characters.description: Appears in Dungeons & Discords as a jazz club patron dancing with S06E17 Unnamed Earth Stallion #4. Also appears in Sparkle's Seven. Bears a resemblance to Betty Boop.

characters.name: Biddy Broomtail
characters.description: Appears as a rodeo school judge in Trouble Shoes' flashback and in the present in Appleoosa's Most Wanted. Also appears in Fame and Misfortune and Growing Up is Hard to Do.

characters.name:
Big-Haired Bowler
Big Wig
characters.description: One of the bowlers in The Cutie Pox. Later appears with her mane and tail covered in parasprites in Leap of Faith, in a flashback to Leap of Faith in Twilight's Kingdom - Part 1, and in Slice of Life. Her cutie mark appears to be three jacks. She is named with a trademark symbol in the eleventh wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that she "is always ready to play a game!" She is a character called "Big-Haired Bowler" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Bitta Blues
characters.description: Appears during The Super Duper Party Pony in Pinkie Pride. Shares her design with Berryshine, Cherry Berry, and Berry Dreams. Her cutie mark is a ladybug.

characters.name: Blue Bonnet
characters.description: Appears once during the parasprite infestation of Ponyville in Swarm of the Century, cowering with her eyes closed. Has the same coat color and cutie mark as Shoeshine, the same mane and tail as Noteworthy, and the same mane and tail style and cutie mark design as S06E09 Unnamed Earth Stallion #3. Her cutie mark is two linked horseshoes.

characters.name: Blue Bows
characters.description: Seen in Ponyville Urgent Care during a pan shot in Applebuck Season. Seen again in Leap of Faith. Shares her design and cutie mark with Sweetie Drops, whose cutie mark is identified by Little, Brown's Mini Pony Collector's Guide and Gameloft's mobile game respectively as three candies and as three bows, shares her design and cutie mark design with Grape Delight, shares her design with Shoeshine, Luckette, Lilac Links, and Sunny Smiles, and shares her color scheme with Diamond Mint.

characters.name: Blue Cutie
characters.description: One of Sapphire Shores' backup dancers in For Whom the Sweetie Belle Toils. Also appears in My Little Pony: Friends Forever Issue #37. A similar pony appears on the IDW comics' My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #22 page 1. Has a similar color scheme to Star Swirl and "Mystery Mint".

characters.name: Blue Nile
characters.description: One of the Fashion Week competitors in Rarity Takes Manehattan. Also appears in Equestria Games and She's All Yak. Her cutie mark is a vanity mirror.

characters.name: Blueberry Curls
characters.description: Blueberry Curls is a female background Earth pony with a pale yellow coat, blue mane and tail, turquoise eyes, and a cutie mark of two pink-petaled flowers. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise. She has two minor speaking roles in the season five episode Made in Manehattan and season eight episode Fake It 'Til You Make It.

characters.name: Bonnie
characters.description: A mare seen during Granny Smith's sepia memories respectively in Family Appreciation Day in Canterlot and in Leap of Faith. Shares her design and at least the design of her cutie mark with S04E07 Unnamed Earth Mare #2, shares at least the design of her cutie mark and mostly her color scheme with S05E06 Unnamed Earth Mare #8, and shares her color scheme with "Turf". Her cutie mark appears to be a key.

characters.name: Bottlecap
characters.description: Seen in the crowd at Applejack's prize pony ceremony in Applebuck Season, sometimes with a different eye color in The Show Stoppers, with a cutie mark of two green bottles during Flim and Flam's song in The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000, in Magic Duel, with a different cutie mark in Simple Ways, in Filli Vanilli, in It Ain't Easy Being Breezies, with a cutie mark of three gemstones in Leap of Faith, with a cutie mark that switches between a lyre and a laurel wreath in Trade Ya!, in Honest Apple, in Non-Compete Clause, and in the outro of the Adventures in Ponyville online game. Shares the same design as "Mango Juice" and "Tropical Spring" and the same mane style as Derpy, Sunshower Raindrops, "Blue October / Blueberry Muffin", High Spirits, and Tropical Storm.

characters.name: Britneigh Spurs
characters.description: Appears in Viva Las Pegasus depicted in poster at Gladmane's Las Pegasus resort. Bears a resemblance to Britney Spears.

characters.name: Bulk Shipment
characters.description: Appears in The Saddle Row Review as a mail courier. Also appears in A Matter of Principals.

characters.name: Burning passion[sic]
characters.description: Appears in Stranger Than Fan Fiction managing a booth at the Daring Do Convention. Also appears in Viva Las Pegasus, A Health of Information, Once Upon a Zeppelin, Grannies Gone Wild, and My Little Pony Best Gift Ever. Shares her design with S06E13 Unnamed Earth Mare #9 and S08E14 Unnamed Earth Mare #3 and sometimes her design and eye color with S06E13 Unnamed Earth Mare #1. Her cutie mark is a red flame.

characters.name: Butter Pop
characters.description: Appears at Rainbow Falls in Trade Ya! Shares her design with Apple Brown Betty, and resembles Fizzypop, G1 Caramel Crunch, and G3 Butter Pop. Her cutie mark is popcorn or a float.

characters.name: Buzzsaw McColt
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as a member of the McColt family. Her cutie mark is a circular saw.

characters.name: Candy Curls
characters.description: Appears in A Royal Problem as one of three delegate ponies at Princess Luna's luncheon. Shares her body design with Prim Hemline, Stormy Flare, "Greenhoof Hooffield", "Betsey Trotson", "Clarity Cut", "Lilac Meadow", Professor Fossil, Old Money, S09E19 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1, and partly S08E01 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1.

characters.name: Candy Mane
characters.description: Candy Mane is the placeholder name of a female Earth pony with an apricot color coat, light grayish-rose and moderate-cerise wavy-streaked mane, and moderate cerise eyes. She has a cutie mark of a pair of pony silhouettes, a row of pink bubbles, or a bunch of grapes and a strawberry, this however is absent in most of her appearances.

characters.name: Candy Twirl
characters.description: First appears in Family Appreciation Day, both in Granny Smith's sepia memory and queuing up in the present day for zap apple jam. Later appears several times in the line for the Apples' cider in The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000. Appears again in a flashback in Apple Family Reunion and in another flashback in Leap of Faith. Also appears in the IDW comics' My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #8 page 10. Shares her design with "Maribelle". Her cutie mark is three spools of red string.

characters.name: Carlotta
characters.description: Appears in The Best Night Ever, Sweet and Elite, Princess Twilight Sparkle - Part 1, and Make New Friends but Keep Discord.

characters.name: Cascada
characters.description: Appears in Stranger Than Fan Fiction managing a booth at the Daring Do Convention. Also appears in Viva Las Pegasus and Once Upon a Zeppelin. Her cutie mark is a waterfall.

characters.name:
Traveling Mare
Cathy O'Mara
characters.description: Neighl Page, Real Article, and Cathy O'Mara are three Earth ponies who first appear in Hearthbreakers. They are unnamed in the show, "Neighl Page", "Real Article", and "Cathy O'Mara" being placeholder names, and are called both by their collective title Homebound Ponies and by the individual titles "Traveling Gentlecolt", "Traveling Pony", and "Traveling Mare" in another depiction.

characters.name:
Magical Pony
Celena
characters.description: The Sailor Moon ponies[2][3] are ten background Pegasus and unicorn ponies designed to resemble the female protagonists of the anime/manga series Sailor Moon,[1] including Celena, Aqua Mist, Burning Heart, Juno, Love Melody, Natural Satellite, Charon, Umbriel, Larissa, and Saturnalia. They are gradually introduced in the IDW comics and in the series. They are all unnamed in the series with their names being placeholder names, but Celena is named "Magical Pony" in some media.

characters.name: Charcoal Bakes
characters.description: Appears in Hearth's Warming Eve, both during the pageant performance and backstage after it ends. Also appears in Shadow Play - Part 2 and the IDW comics' My Little Pony Micro-Series Issue #5 page 4. Her cutie mark is three cupcakes.

characters.name: Charged Up
characters.description: Berry Dreams, Charged Up, and Lucky Star are three female Earth ponies who appear once during the Iron Pony competition in Fall Weather Friends. They are unnamed in the show, but they are named in merchandise.

characters.name: Cherry Berry
characters.description: Cherry Berry is a female Earth pony with a hot pink coat, Naples yellow mane and tail, purple eyes, and a cutie mark of a pair of cherries. She is unnamed on the show, only being referred to as "Girl Pony" in the credits of the episode Princess Twilight Sparkle - Part 2, but she is named in merchandise and other media. She shares her design with Berryshine. She has speaking roles in Luna Eclipsed, The Mysterious Mare Do Well, The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000, Putting Your Hoof Down, and Princess Twilight Sparkle - Part 2. Her design is similar to the G1 pony Crunch Berry, named Cherry Berry in the United Kingdom.

characters.name: Cherry Jumble
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony Best Gift Ever selling jars of jelly at the Rainbow Falls Hearth's Warming Craft Fair.

characters.name: Cherry Punch
characters.description: Seen in Ponyville Urgent Care during two shots in Applebuck Season, sick and with her face hidden. Seen again in Leap of Faith, sick and with her eyes closed. Also appears on the IDW comics' My Little Pony: The Movie Prequel Issue #1 regular cover, well and with her eyes open. Resembles Cherry Berry and Berryshine. Her cutie mark is a pair of cherries. Unlike most mares, she appears to be eyelashless, though she had eyelashes in early concept art.

characters.name:
Runway Model
Chic Flower
characters.description: Appears in Fake It 'Til You Make It as Rarity's model at the Canterlot Royal Fashion Show. Resembles Issue 22 Unnamed Mare - Lightning Bolt and to a lesser extent Fluttershy. She is a character named "Runway Model" in Gameloft's mobile game. Her in-game bio states "One of Rarity's go-to clothesponies whenever the Canterlot Royal Fashion Show rolls around."

characters.name: Chilly Puddle
characters.description: Stands next to S01E03 Unnamed Earth Mare #3 during Applejack's fantasy in The Ticket Master, watches the talent show in The Show Stoppers, talks with S01E03 Unnamed Earth Mare #3 in The Cutie Mark Chronicles, and has her cutie mark visible in Simple Ways. Shares the same design as "Purple Haze", Green Jewel, "Welly", and S05E24 Unnamed Earth Mare #3 and the same mane style as Sassaflash, Parasol, Prim Posy, "Drizzle", "Graceful Falls", "Downdraft", and Honey Rays. Her cutie mark appears to be two dolphins. A November 6, 2013 "vorläufige Abbildung" image for mystery packs includes her, without her cutie mark.

characters.name: Chimney Dust
characters.description: Appears in A Hearth's Warming Tail as a character in the story "A Hearth's Warming Tail". Her cutie mark is a chimney and sweep.

characters.name:
Food Merchant
Chock-full Carafe
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan selling popcorn in Made in Manehattan and The Gift of the Maud Pie. Also appears in Viva Las Pegasus, Grannies Gone Wild, and The Last Problem. Her cutie mark is a coffee cup. Voiced by Andrea Libman.

characters.name: Cinnamon Pear
characters.description: Appears in flashback in The Perfect Pear as a member of the Pear family. Her cutie mark is half of a pear and a stick of cinnamon.

characters.name:
Jeweler Pony
Clarity Cut
characters.description: Appears in All Bottled Up and Dragon Dropped as a Ponyville jeweler. She shares her body design with Prim Hemline, Stormy Flare, "Greenhoof Hooffield", "Betsey Trotson", "Candy Curls", "Lilac Meadow", Professor Fossil, Old Money, S09E19 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1, and partly S08E01 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1 and her color scheme and occupation with Karat. Her cutie mark is two diamond earrings. Voiced by Tabitha St. Germain.

characters.name:
Well-Dressed Somnambulan
Cleo Saraj
characters.description: Appears in Daring Done? as a resident of Somnambula. Also appears in Road to Friendship and A Rockhoof and a Hard Place. She is a character called "Well-Dressed Somnambulan" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Cleopatra Jazz
characters.description: Appears in Dungeons & Discords as a jazz club patron or employee. Also appears in Sparkle's Seven. Her cutie mark is three bananas.

characters.name: Cobalt Shade
characters.description: A pony seen in top down shots during the first fashion show in Suited For Success, during the Smile Song in A Friend in Deed, and during The Super Duper Party Pony in Pinkie Pride.

characters.name: Coral Shine
characters.description: One of Suri Polomare's models in Rarity Takes Manehattan. Also appears in The Gift of the Maud Pie and on the IDW comics' Friends Forever Issue #18 Books-A-Million cover RE. In Simple Ways, the drawing of the fashion show seemingly depicts her along with the other models.

characters.name: Cornflower
characters.description: Appears at the train station in Dodge Junction during The Last Roundup, being shown the picture of Applejack by Twilight Sparkle. Has the same design, cutie mark, and hat as Daisy.

characters.name: Crescendo
characters.description: Appears four times at once during Behold, Princess Twilight Sparkle in Magical Mystery Cure. Has the same design as Issue 22 Unnamed Mare - Lightning Bolt, the same mane style as Fluttershy, "Parula", and Diamond Rose, and the same eye style as Rarity and Lotus Blossom.

characters.name: Creamcup
characters.description: Appears at Rainbow Falls in Trade Ya! Shares her design and eye color with Candy Apples, "Peach Melba", S04E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #11, and S04E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #23, and shares her design with "Jinx".

characters.name: Crimson Skate
characters.description: Appears in The Cart Before the Ponies participating in the Applewood Derby alongside "Train Tracks". Her cutie mark is a skateboard.

characters.name: Crosscut McColt
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as a member of the McColt family. Her cutie mark is a hand saw. Shares her color scheme with "Hacksaw McColt".

characters.name: Cultivar
characters.description: Appears in Leap of Faith covered in bandages, in Equestria Games, in a flashback to Leap of Faith in Twilight's Kingdom - Part 1, in Newbie Dash, in The Fault in Our Cutie Marks, in Where the Apple Lies, in The Perfect Pear, in It Isn't the Mane Thing About You, in The Beginning of the End - Part 2, in The Point of No Return, in My Little Pony Equestria Girls: Spring Breakdown, in She Talks to Angel, and in A Horse Shoe-In. A unicorn version with a different coat color appears in Princess Spike, The Fault in Our Cutie Marks, School Daze - Part 1, Yakity-Sax, A Rockhoof and a Hard Place, and The Point of No Return. Resembles Nurse Snowheart in color scheme and eye style, and shares her coat and eye colors with Sweetie Drops, Fine Line, Press Release, "Roma", "Paisley Pastel", S05E21 Unnamed Earth Mare #1, and "Hazel Harvest". Her cutie mark is a blue flower and two smaller red flowers.

characters.name: Daisy
characters.description: Daisy is a female Earth pony with a pale magenta coat, lime mane, emerald green eyes, and a cutie mark of two daisies. She is called Flower Wishes in some merchandise.

characters.name: Dane Tee Dove
characters.description: Dane Tee Dove is a female Earth pony with a white coat, two-tone golden mane and tail, green eyes, and a cutie mark of a pink and purple laurel wreath. She has a minor speaking role in the season one episode The Cutie Mark Chronicles. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise.

characters.name:
Police Pony
Deputy Copper
characters.description: Appears in The Gift of the Maud Pie as a Manehattan police officer. She is named in the twenty-fourth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards. The collector card states about Deputy Copper, "She helps her friends solve mysteries." Also appears in Rarity's Peek Behind the Boutique episode 1. Her cutie mark is a gold police badge. Voiced by Tabitha St. Germain.

characters.name: Doctor Pinkheart
characters.description: Appears in Where the Apple Lies as a doctor/surgeon at the Ponyville Hospital.

characters.name: Doseydotes
characters.description: Runs around in panic after Nightmare Moon leaves in Friendship is Magic, part 2. Later appears in the IDW comics' My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #8 page 13. Wears a peach-orange flower in her mane. Her design is the same as that of Roku-chan, her mane and tail style is the same as that of Rainbow Dash, Daring Do, Holly Dash, Skywishes, Sugar Grape, Lucky Dreams, Sweetsong, Breezie, Feathermay, "Ballad", Periwinkle, Star Dasher, Léon, and sometimes Ploomette and Banana Bliss, her mane style is the same as that of Andrea, her tail style is the same as that of "Sunstone" and WCE Unnamed Mare - Jouster, and her color scheme and flower are the same as those of Prim Posy. The included image is slightly dark.

characters.name: Dosie Dough
characters.description: Appears during the song Raise This Barn in Apple Family Reunion, but is not included in any of the Apple family photos. Resembles "Cinnabelle". Shares the coat and mane colors of "Apple Top".

characters.name: Dry Wheat
characters.description: Appears during the pageant performance in Hearth's Warming Eve, at the home of the Earth ponies and at the summit of the tribes.

characters.name: Eclair Crème
characters.description: Eclair Crème is a female background Earth pony with a blue coat, pale yellow mane and tail, magenta eyes, and a cutie mark of two linked horseshoes. She has a speaking role in the episode For Whom the Sweetie Belle Toils. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Elphaba Trot
characters.description: Opens a window and joins the chorus of the Smile Song in A Friend in Deed.

characters.name:
Sleek Pony
Ever Essence
characters.description: Appears in The Parent Map as a resident and perfume seller in Sire's Hollow. She is a character called "Essence Salespony" in Gameloft's mobile game. Not one of the Sailor Moon ponies, "just designed to look hip and modern" according to Jim Miller. Voiced by Jinjara Mitchell.

characters.name: Fiddly Twang
characters.description: Fiddly Twang, or Fiddly Faddle, is a female background Earth pony who first appears in the season two episode Luna Eclipsed. She has a yellow coat, a cobalt blue mane and tail, arctic blue eyes, and a cutie mark of a blue treble clef. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name:
Athletic Dancer
Flashdancer
characters.description: Appears in The Saddle Row Review as a dancer in DJ Pon-3's dance club. Also appears in My Little Pony Established 1983 "Pinkercise w/ Pinkie Pie!" Her cutie mark is a yellow star. Also depicted on Enterplay collectible card game Defenders of Equestria card #32 R, Ravers, Glowsticks Optional. She is a character called "Athletic Dancer" in Gameloft's mobile game, and she serves as an enemy minion during the Presentable in Periwinkle eventgame's description of her states, "Those sweatbands declare she's ready for action -- to dance the whole night is her main satisfaction!"-->

characters.name: Floral Pan
characters.description: Appears in Viva Las Pegasus at Gladmane's Las Pegasus resort. Also appears in Grannies Gone Wild, Friendship University, Common Ground, Between Dark and Dawn, 2, 4, 6, Greaaat, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Her cutie mark is a cooking pan with a floral pattern.

characters.name: Flounder
characters.description: Appears in Friendship is Magic, part 1, in Friendship is Magic, part 2, in Applebuck Season, in Boast Busters, in Winter Wrap Up, in The Show Stoppers, in The Mysterious Mare Do Well, in The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000, in A Friend in Deed, in The Crystal Empire - Part 1, in The Crystal Empire - Part 2, in Magic Duel, in Apple Family Reunion, with a cutie mark of two hearts in Simple Ways, in Filli Vanilli, with a cutie mark that switches between three raindrops and two flowers in It Ain't Easy Being Breezies, with a cutie mark of a horseshoe in Leap of Faith, with a cutie mark that switches between a leaf and an umbrella in Trade Ya!, with a cutie mark of a wand and a moon in Honest Apple, and in the outro of the Adventures in Ponyville online game. Shares her design with "Lavenderhoof" and her color scheme with Lemon Hearts. Tinted blue in the included image.

characters.name: Flurry
characters.description: Appears during the pageant performance in Hearth's Warming Eve, at the beginning of the play, at the home of the Earth ponies, and at the summit of the tribes. Also appears in flashback in Shadow Play - Part 2.

characters.name: Forest Spirit
characters.description: Appears in The Ticket Master, in The Show Stoppers, in The Cutie Mark Chronicles, in Simple Ways, with a visible cutie mark that switches between what appears to be a conifer and what appears to be an umbrella in It Ain't Easy Being Breezies, and with a visible cutie mark of two hearts in Honest Apple. Shares the same design as "Mjölna" from the back and "Berry Frost" and the same mane style as Rainbowshine, Orange Swirl, and Sugar Twist.

characters.name:
Nerdy Delegate
Frazzle Rock
characters.description: Appears as one of the Grand Equestria Pony Summit delegates in Princess Spike and again briefly in Canterlot Boutique. Shares her body model and eye color with S08E01 Unnamed Earth Mare #0 and her body model with "Feather Twirl" and S07E19 Unnamed Earth Mare #2. Her cutie mark is three sheets of paper. Voiced by Tabitha St. Germain. She is a character called "Studious Delegate" in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of her states, "This studious pony sure knows how to tally -- when it comes to academics, she does not dillydally."

characters.name: Frou Frou
characters.description: Her mane got ruined in The Show Stoppers, after the Cutie Mark Crusaders dye and style it like a clown's wig. Her cutie mark is a pink lotus blossom.

characters.name: Glitter Spritz
characters.description: Appears in Honest Apple as the model for Starstreak's fashions in the Carousel Boutique fashion contest. Her cutie mark is a blue hairbrush, red hair pick, and pink comb.

characters.name:
Demure Pony
Golden Harvest
characters.description: Golden Harvest, or Carrot Top, is a female Earth pony with a pale goldenrod coat, carrot orange mane and tail, dark olive green eyes, and a cutie mark of three carrots with greens. Her name is not mentioned on the show, but it appears varyingly in merchandise and other media. She has speaking roles in Boast Busters, Swarm of the Century, Green Isn't Your Color, A Friend in Deed, and It Isn't the Mane Thing About You.

characters.name: Gorgeous Glamour
characters.description: One of Rarity's models in Rarity Takes Manehattan. Also appears in The Gift of the Maud Pie and Rarity's Peek Behind the Boutique episode 2. In Simple Ways, the drawing of the fashion show seemingly depicts her along with the other models.

characters.name: Grape Delight
characters.description: Appears in Suited For Success, The Cutie Mark Chronicles, and Princess Twilight Sparkle - Part 2. Also appears in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 3. Identical to Lilac Links in all but eye color and cutie mark, shares her design and coat color with Luckette, shares her design and cutie mark design with Sweetie Drops, whose cutie mark is identified by Little, Brown's Mini Pony Collector's Guide and Gameloft's mobile game respectively as three candies and as three bows, and shares her design with Shoeshine and Sunny Smiles. A mini-figure toy and a collector card of her are packaged together as part of the ninth wave of mystery packs. According to the card, she "thinks fruity treats are delicious!" Her name comes both from the card and from the packaging of the wave, which each list the name as a trademark.

characters.name: Green Jewel
characters.description: Green Jewel is a female background Earth pony who appears in A Friend in Deed, Magical Mystery Cure, and Pinkie Pride. She has a lime green coat, deep sea green mane, orange eyes, and a cutie mark of two diamonds. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise and other depictions.

characters.name: Greenhoof Hooffield
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as a member of the Hooffield family.
