Shares her body design with Prim Hemline, Stormy Flare, "Betsey Trotson", "Clarity Cut", "Candy Curls", "Lilac Meadow", Professor Fossil, Old Money, S09E19 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1, and partly S08E01 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1.

characters.name: Hacksaw McColt
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as a member of the McColt family. Her cutie mark is a bow saw. Shares her color scheme with "Crosscut McColt". Voiced by Ellen Kennedy.

characters.name: Hazel Harvest
characters.description: Briefly appears in a hazmat suit during The Cutie Pox. Shares her design and mane color with Golden Harvest and Caramel Apple and her coat and eye colors with Sweetie Drops, Fine Line, Press Release, "Roma", "Paisley Pastel", "Cultivar", and S05E21 Unnamed Earth Mare #1.

characters.name:
Sandbar's Mom
High Tide
characters.description: Appears in The Hearth's Warming Club as Sandbar's mother in his story. Also appears in The Ending of the End - Part 2. Her cutie mark is a seashell. She is a character called "Sandbar's Mom" in Gameloft's mobile game. Her bio states, "Sandbar often talks about the time he almost spilled grape juice on her couch--but she's just relieved he didn't ACTUALLY do it."

characters.name: Hilly Hooffield
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as a member of the Hooffield family. Also appears in A Royal Problem. Shares her body type and coat color with Sapphire Shores and her body type with "Zen Moment".

characters.name: Hinny of the Hills
characters.description: The actress portraying Hinny in the Bridleway musical Hinny of the Hills in Rarity Takes Manehattan. Also appears on the season 4 poster. Voiced by Andrea Libman.

characters.name: Hoda Kotb
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan in an animated Today Show video. Represents Today Show anchor Hoda Kotb. Her cutie mark is a pink baby rattle.

characters.name: Honey Dew
characters.description: Appears at the twelfth annual Ponyville turkey call during Big McIntosh's flashback in Filli Vanilli. Resembles Peachy Pie in color scheme.

characters.name:
Registration Pony
Janine Manewitz
characters.description: Appears in Rarity Takes Manehattan as the Fashion Week receptionist. Later appears in Equestria Games and Made in Manehattan with her cutie mark visible. Also appears on the season 4 poster. Her cutie mark is a blue quill. Voiced by Tabitha St. Germain. Based on Grace from Ferris Bueller's Day Off and named after Janine Melnitz from Ghostbusters. She is named with a trademark symbol in the twentieth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that she "& Joan Pommelway share a hot chocolate."

characters.name:
Salespony
Jasmine Leaf
characters.description: Appears in Discordant Harmony as a tea shop owner in Ponyville. Also appears in Common Ground. Her cutie mark is three green tea leaves fanned over a white and lavender mug. She is a character called "Teashop Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of her states, "A true connoisseur when it comes to her teas -- even difficult customers are sure to be pleased!" Voiced by Kelly Sheridan.

characters.name: Jinx
characters.description: Appears in Leap of Faith with a bandaged head and in a wheelchair, in Equestria Games, in a flashback to Leap of Faith in Twilight's Kingdom - Part 1, in Parental Glideance, and on My Little Pony: Ponyville Mysteries Issue #5 page 7. Shares her design with Candy Apples, "Peach Melba", "Creamcup", S04E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #11, and S04E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #23. Her cutie mark is a horseshoe. Voiced by Ashleigh Ball.

characters.name: Joan Pommelway
characters.description: The Mad Men ponies[1] are six background Earth and/or unicorn ponies designed to resemble some of the cast of the AMC drama television series Mad Men, including Business Savvy, Pegasus Olsen, Joan Pommelway, Roger Silvermane, Pete Canterbell, and Bronco Benson. They are gradually introduced in the IDW comics' My Little Pony Micro-Series Issue #8 and in the episodes Rarity Takes Manehattan and Made in Manehattan, and most of them are often depicted in episodes taking place in Manehattan, where at least one or two of them live.[2][3][4][5]​[​dubious – discuss‍​]​ Most are unnamed in the series, "Pete Canterbell" and "Bronco Benson" being placeholder names, but Business Savvy, Pegasus Olsen, Joan Pommelway, and Roger Silvermane are named in merchandise.

characters.name: Jorunn
characters.description: Appears in Campfire Tales as a resident of Rockhoof's village in Applejack's story.

characters.name: Jubileena
characters.description: Appears during one shot in Too Many Pinkie Pies, standing near the sign outside the Golden Oak Library. Also appears on My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #7 page 2. Her design and eye color are the same as those of Cherry Berry, and her cutie mark, six cherries in pairs, is three of hers. She bears a resemblance to G1 Cherries Jubilee; see also Cherry Jubilee.

characters.name: Kathie Lee Gifford
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan in an animated Today Show video. Represents Today Show anchor Kathie Lee Gifford. Her cutie mark is the Today Show logo.

characters.name: Lady Beetle
characters.description: A mare who appears at a table with "Spring Green" in Somepony to Watch Over Me. Her color scheme is similar to those of Florina Tart and Minty.

characters.name: Lady Gaval
characters.description: Lady Gaval, or Lady Justice, is a female background Earth pony who first appears in The Cutie Mark Chronicles. She has a lime green coat, two-tone orange mane and tail, purple eyes, and a varying cutie mark either of a gavel or of an hourglass. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Lavender August
characters.description: Appears at Rainbow Falls in Trade Ya! Shares her design with Cherry Berry, Berryshine, and Berry Dreams.

characters.name: Lavender Bloom
characters.description: Lavender Bloom is a female Earth pony with a pale magenta coat, lime mane, emerald green eyes, and a cutie mark of two daisies. She is unnamed in the series, but she is credited as "Brunch Pony 2" in Fame and Misfortune and named in merchandise.

characters.name: Lavender Blush
characters.description: A pony seen in top down shots during the first fashion show in Suited For Success, during the Smile Song in A Friend in Deed, and during The Super Duper Party Pony in Pinkie Pride.

characters.name: Lavender Essence
characters.description: A spa pony who appears at Ponyville's Day Spa in No Second Prances and Applejack's "Day" Off. Also appears in She Talks to Angel. Her cutie mark is two candles. Voiced by Tabitha St. Germain.

characters.name: Lavenderhoof
characters.description: Appears in Applebuck Season, in Boast Busters, in Winter Wrap Up, in The Show Stoppers, in The Mysterious Mare Do Well, with a visible cutie mark in The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000, in A Friend in Deed, in Magic Duel, in Pinkie Pride, with a visible cutie mark of a wand and a moon in Simple Ways, with a visible cutie mark of two hearts in both It Ain't Easy Being Breezies and Leap of Faith, with a visible cutie mark of a scroll in Trade Ya!, with a visible cutie mark of a leaf in Honest Apple, and in the outro of the Adventures in Ponyville online game. Shares the same design as "Flounder".

characters.name: Lemon Chiffon
characters.description: A passenger of a carriage bus that is stopped from careening off a cliff by Mare Do Well in The Mysterious Mare Do Well. Later appears in Manehattan, including on a cruise ship, in Rarity Takes Manehattan. Also appears in Equestria Games, in Made in Manehattan, in Fame and Misfortune with a speaking role, in Shadow Play - Part 2, in Grannies Gone Wild, in Molt Down, in Between Dark and Dawn, in Growing Up is Hard to Do, and in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Her cutie mark is sometimes two hearts, other times a cup of water, and still other times two dolphins. Voiced by Tabitha St. Germain.

characters.name: Lilac Blossom
characters.description: Appears throughout crowds during A Canterlot Wedding - Part 2 and Magical Mystery Cure. Has the same design as Golden Harvest. Two promotional images from The Hub's Facebook page show her more clearly than the corresponding frames of the show do.

characters.name: Lilac Links
characters.description: Lilac Links is a female Earth pony who appears in Winter Wrap Up, The Show Stoppers, and My Little Pony: Friends Forever Issue #24. She has a purple coat, pale blue mane, cerise eyes, and a cutie mark of two linked horseshoes.

characters.name:
Meadowbrook's Mother
Lilac Meadow
characters.description: Appears in A Health of Information as Mage Meadowbrook's mother. Shares her body design with Prim Hemline, Stormy Flare, "Greenhoof Hooffield", "Betsey Trotson", "Clarity Cut", "Candy Curls", Professor Fossil, Old Money, S09E19 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1, and partly S08E01 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1. She is a character named "Mage Meadowbrook's Mom" in Gameloft's mobile game. Her in-game bio states "Even Pillars of Old Equestria love their mamas--and that definitely includes Hayseed Swamp's finest healer!" Voiced by Brenda Crichlow.

characters.name: Lily Valley
characters.description: Lily Valley, called simply Lily in the show and some other materials, is a female Earth pony with a grayish raspberry coat, light amber mane with pale amber highlights, grayish gold eyes, and a cutie mark of three lilies. She is almost always seen with a lily in her mane. She has speaking roles in Applebuck Season, Bridle Gossip, The Cutie Pox, A Friend in Deed, Slice of Life, and It Isn't the Mane Thing About You.

characters.name: Linked Hearts
characters.description: She is shown chasing after Twilight Sparkle's doll, Smarty Pants, in Lesson Zero. Has the same design and cutie mark as Shoeshine, Lilac Links, and Sunny Smiles and a similar color scheme to White Lightning. Her cutie mark is two linked horseshoes.

characters.name: Little Po
characters.description: Found behind Spike in Rarity's fashion show in Suited For Success, with a flower in her mane. Shares her mane style and flower design with Virgo.

characters.name: Long Shot
characters.description: Several paparazzi ponies appear in various episodes in the series, including Earth ponies Long Shot and Snappy Scoop, unicorn Press Release, and Pegasi Big Shot, Eff Stop, and Tracy Flash. They are unnamed in the show, "Tracy Flash" being a placeholder name, but some are named varyingly in merchandise and other depictions.

characters.name: Luckette
characters.description: Luckette is a female Earth pony with a light purple coat, pale yellow mane and tail, gold eyes, and a cutie mark of two interlocking horseshoes. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise. She has speaking roles in the season five episode Made in Manehattan and the season eight episode Fake It 'Til You Make It.

characters.name: Lucky Star
characters.description: Berry Dreams, Charged Up, and Lucky Star are three female Earth ponies who appear once during the Iron Pony competition in Fall Weather Friends. They are unnamed in the show, but they are named in merchandise.

characters.name: Lyrica Lilac
characters.description: Lyrica Lilac, or simply Lyrica, is a female Earth pony with a pale lavender coat, a light yellow mane, purple eyes, and a lyre cutie mark. The parts of her name were given by fans before they were adopted officially by Hasbro. She has speaking roles in Green Isn't Your Color and The Best Night Ever.

characters.name: Magenta Surf
characters.description: One of Sapphire Shores' backup dancers in For Whom the Sweetie Belle Toils. Also appears in My Little Pony: Friends Forever Issue #37, and in a photograph in Rarity's Peek Behind the Boutique episode 1. Has a similar color scheme to "Surf" and S09E23 Unnamed Earth Mare #1.

characters.name: Majesty
characters.description: Appears in The Best Night Ever. On My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #5 page 8 and Issue #6 page 14, she appears in nightmares that Pinkie Pie has. Shares the same design as Lyrica Lilac and Purple Wave. Her cutie mark is a lyre.

characters.name: Manely Gold
characters.description: Tends to a garden patch that gets eaten by the parasprites in Swarm of the Century, with a darker coat than in later episodes. Operates a news stand in Green Isn't Your Color. Also appears in Trade Ya! She is named with a trademark symbol in the nineteenth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that she "& Lyra Heartstrings enjoy time at the spa." Her cutie mark is a flower.

characters.name: Mango Juice
characters.description: Appears in Friendship is Magic, part 2, in Boast Busters, with her cutie mark visible in Simple Ways, in Filli Vanilli, in Trade Ya!, and in Saved by My Friends. Her cutie mark is a pair of cherries. Shares the same design as "Bottlecap" and "Tropical Spring" and the same mane style as Derpy, Sunshower Raindrops, "Blue October / Blueberry Muffin", High Spirits, and Tropical Storm. Tinted yellow.

characters.name:
Whinnyapolis Delegate
March Gustysnows
characters.description: Appears as the Whinnyapolis delegate for the Grand Equestria Pony Summit delegates in Princess Spike. Also appears in a photograph in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 3. Her cutie mark is a cup of coffee. Voiced by Tabitha St. Germain. She is a character called "Whinnyapolis Delegate" in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of her states, "Whinnyapolis gets really cold in the snow -- but this pony still loves her home, don'tcha know!" Fluffy Clouds' Enterplay collectible card game High Magic expansion set card #26 R attributes to Manehattan Delegate and Whinnyapolis Delegate the respective quotes "What city is he even representing?" and "Gosh, I don't think even HE knows that."

characters.name: Mare E. Belle
characters.description: Appears at Rainbow Falls in Trade Ya!, at the Crystal Empire in Equestria Games, with a different cutie mark at Our Town in The Cutie Map - Part 2, in Canterlot in Canterlot Boutique, and in Manehattan in Made in Manehattan, The Gift of the Maud Pie, The Saddle Row Review, Shadow Play - Part 2, Fake It 'Til You Make It, She's All Yak, and Growing Up is Hard to Do. Shares her design with Silver Berry, Berryshine, Berry Dreams, and Cherry Berry. Her cutie mark usually is three bows and rarely is a drum set. She is named with a trademark symbol in the twentieth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that she "& Mare E. Lynn love beautiful accessories."

characters.name: Mare E. Lynn
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan in Rarity Takes Manehattan, behind Photo Finish and Sapphire Shores. Also appears at the Crystal Empire in Equestria Games, with a different design at Our Town in The Cutie Map - Part 2, in Made in Manehattan, in The Gift of the Maud Pie, in The Saddle Row Review, in Fake It 'Til You Make It, and in an animated Today Show video. Her cutie mark is a pink horseshoe and another horseshoe interlocked. She is named with a trademark symbol in the twentieth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that she "& Silver Berry wear super-cute hats and bows."

characters.name: Maribelle
characters.description: Appears in a flashback in Bats!, as one of the actresses in the Bridleway musical Hinny of the Hills in Rarity Takes Manehattan, in Granny Smith's flashback in Leap of Faith, and in a flashback in No Second Prances. Shares her design with "Candy Twirl". Her cutie mark is three spools of orange thread.

characters.name: Maroon Carrot
characters.description: Shares her design with Golden Harvest. Her cutie mark is a few carrots.

characters.name: Masquerade
characters.description: Masquerade is the placeholder name of a female background Earth pony with a light yellow coat, royal blue mane and tail, green eyes, and a cutie mark of a pink six-pointed star surrounded by five smaller white stars.

characters.name: Maybelline
characters.description: A passenger of a carriage bus that is stopped from careening off a cliff by Mare Do Well in The Mysterious Mare Do Well. Later appears in Manehattan, including on a cruise ship, in Rarity Takes Manehattan. Also appears in Equestria Games, Made in Manehattan, The Crystalling - Part 1, Growing Up is Hard to Do, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8.

characters.name: Meadowluck
characters.description: Appears in The Saddle Row Review at Rarity For You's grand opening. Her cutie mark is a silver horseshoe.

characters.name: Midnight Fun
characters.description: One of Photo Finish's assistants in Green Isn't Your Color. Also appears in Sweet and Elite, Rarity Takes Manehattan, Equestria Games, Honest Apple, Fake It 'Til You Make It, and She's All Yak. She is named with a trademark symbol in the nineteenth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that she "& Vidala Swoon always look their best." Named after an original character of "Madmax". Listed under "Fashion Ponies" within "More Manehattan Ponies" in the Ultimate Guide published by Orchard Books in the United Kingdom.

characters.name: Millie
characters.description: Appears in The Mysterious Mare Do Well, emitting the same scream as Rarity and later receiving the rescued Cream Puff from Rainbow Dash. Also appears with "Dinky Doo" and Cotton Cloudy in Spike at Your Service. Appears again in Pinkie Pride, Flutter Brutter, The Fault in Our Cutie Marks, Where the Apple Lies, The Perfect Pear, Triple Threat, It Isn't the Mane Thing About You, The Maud Couple, Horse Play, Non-Compete Clause, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, The Beginning of the End - Part 2, Common Ground, Between Dark and Dawn, The Summer Sun Setback, Dragon Dropped, A Horse Shoe-In, Growing Up is Hard to Do, and The Big Mac Question. Shares her mane and tail with S06E19 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1. Her cutie mark is three fans.

characters.name: Mint Swirl
characters.description: Appears throughout crowds during A Canterlot Wedding - Part 2 and Magical Mystery Cure. Has the same design as Golden Harvest and a similar color scheme to S04E14 Unnamed Earth Mare #4 and S06E07 Unnamed Earth Mare #2. Two promotional images from The Hub's Facebook page show her more clearly than the corresponding frames of the show do.

characters.name: Minty
characters.description: Minty is a female Earth pony who first appears in the chapter book Applejack and the Honest-to-Goodness Switcheroo. She makes her animated debut in the Friendship is Magic animated short Sundae, Sundae, Sundae. She has a mint green coat, pink and white mane, pink or dark green eyes, and a cutie mark of three swirled mint candies. She first appears in merchandise.

characters.name:
Bookstore Pony 2
Minty Mocha
characters.description: Appears in The Parent Map as a resident and bookstore owner in Sire's Hollow. Voiced by Jennifer Copping.

characters.name: Mixed Berry
characters.description: Appears in The Parent Map as a resident of Sire's Hollow.

characters.name: Mjölna
characters.description: Mjölna is the placeholder name of a female background Earth pony who appears in multiple episodes throughout the series. She has a tan brown coat, light yellow mane and tail, light gold eyes, and a cutie mark of a hammer and lightning bolt, a sandwich, a golden or green laurel wreath, three aquamarine raindrops, or a rainbow.

characters.name: Morning Glory
characters.description: Appears in Honest Apple as the model for Lily Lace's fashions in the Carousel Boutique fashion contest. Has a similar color scheme to Tealove.

characters.name:
Mother Pony
Mrs. Paleo
characters.description: A family of Earth ponies consisting of patriarch Mr. Paleo, matriarch Mrs. Paleo, and filly Petunia Paleo appears in the season six episode The Fault in Our Cutie Marks. Mr. and Mrs. Paleo are unnamed in the series, credited only as "Father Pony" and "Mother Pony" respectively in The Fault in Our Cutie Marks, but they are named in other media.

characters.name:
Executive Producer/Story Editor
Nicole Dubuc
characters.description: Appears in Between Dark and Dawn. An original character of Nicole Dubuc's.

characters.name: Nurse Magenta Heart
characters.description: Appears in Where the Apple Lies as a nurse pony at the Ponyville Hospital.

characters.name: Nurse Snowheart
characters.description: Nurse ponies are ponies who work as nurses at Ponyville Hospital and appear in Applebuck Season, Read It and Weep, Where the Apple Lies, and other episodes. Most are unnamed in the show, "Nurse Sweetheart", "Nurse Tenderheart", and "Nursery Rhyme" being placeholder names, but Nurse Snowheart is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Nurse Sweetheart
characters.description: Nurse ponies are ponies who work as nurses at Ponyville Hospital and appear in Applebuck Season, Read It and Weep, Where the Apple Lies, and other episodes. Most are unnamed in the show, "Nurse Sweetheart", "Nurse Tenderheart", and "Nursery Rhyme" being placeholder names, but Nurse Snowheart is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Nurse Tenderheart
characters.description: Nurse ponies are ponies who work as nurses at Ponyville Hospital and appear in Applebuck Season, Read It and Weep, Where the Apple Lies, and other episodes. Most are unnamed in the show, "Nurse Sweetheart", "Nurse Tenderheart", and "Nursery Rhyme" being placeholder names, but Nurse Snowheart is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Oakey Doke
characters.description: Seen in Friendship is Magic, part 1, Applebuck Season, Boast Busters, Winter Wrap Up, Suited For Success, The Show Stoppers, The Cutie Mark Chronicles, The Mysterious Mare Do Well, The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000, Hearts and Hooves Day, A Friend in Deed, A Canterlot Wedding - Part 2, The Crystal Empire - Part 1, The Crystal Empire - Part 2, Magic Duel, Princess Twilight Sparkle - Part 2, Pinkie Pride, Simple Ways, Filli Vanilli, It Ain't Easy Being Breezies, Leap of Faith, Trade Ya!, Equestria Games, Twilight's Kingdom - Part 2, Honest Apple, and the outro of the Adventures in Ponyville online game, always from behind except for some shots during The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000, Equestria Games, and Twilight's Kingdom - Part 2. She shares her design with Berryshine and Cherry Berry. Her cutie mark is three ferns.

characters.name: Obscurity
characters.description: A pony seen in the crowd during the first fashion show in Suited For Success.

characters.name: Ocean Dream
characters.description: Seen at the Ponyville Day Spa in Filli Vanilli, Applejack's "Day" Off, and All Bottled Up. Her cutie mark is sometimes a palm tree and other times a strawberry and bunch of grapes.

characters.name: Ocean Spray
characters.description: Appears in Stranger Than Fan Fiction as an attendee of the Daring Do Convention. Also appears in Viva Las Pegasus, Grannies Gone Wild, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8.

characters.name: Octavia Melody
characters.description: Octavia Melody is a background Earth pony who first appears in the season one finale episode The Best Night Ever. She has a dark gray mane and tail, a light gray coat and light purple eyes, and she wears a pink bow-tie with a white collar. Her cutie mark is a violet treble clef. She is simply called Octavia in some merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Offbeat
characters.description: Appears, at least sometimes cutie unmarked, in The Cutie Map - Part 1, The Cutie Map - Part 2, Rock Solid Friendship, and a European magazine comic whose French title is Une leçon d'amitié. Her cutie mark appears to be partly shown in the comic.​[​specify​]​ A similar pony appears on Friendship is Magic Issue #48 page 15.

characters.name: Orange Sherbet
characters.description: One of Suri Polomare's models in Rarity Takes Manehattan. Also appears in Equestria Games and on a friendly blind date with S05E16 Unnamed Earth Stallion #7 in The Gift of the Maud Pie. In Simple Ways, the drawing of the fashion show seemingly depicts her along with the other models. Shares her mane style and color with S05E14 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #6.

characters.name:
Ecstatic Dancer
Pacific Glow
characters.description: Appears in The Saddle Row Review as a dancer in DJ Pon-3's dance club. Her cutie mark is three glow sticks. She is named on Enterplay collectible card game Defenders of Equestria card #32 R, Ravers, Glowsticks Optional, which attributes to her the quote "But PLUR is never optional!" She is a character called "Ecstatic Dancer" in Gameloft's mobile game, and she serves as an enemy minion during the Presentable in Periwinkle event. The game's description of her states, "This mare is a maniac out on the floor -- it's a wonder she doesn't dance right out the door!"

characters.name: Paisley Pastel
characters.description: Appears in Granny Smith's sepia memory during Family Appreciation Day, departs the Friendship Express train from Manehattan to Ponyville at the beginning of One Bad Apple, appears in Granny Smith's flashback in Leap of Faith, appears with a different design in Trouble Shoes' flashback in Appleoosa's Most Wanted, and appears in a flashback in No Second Prances. Shares her design with S04E07 Unnamed Earth Mare #3, and shares her coat and eye colors with Sweetie Drops, Fine Line, Press Release, "Roma", "Cultivar", S05E21 Unnamed Earth Mare #1, and "Hazel Harvest". Her cutie mark is three paisley designs.

characters.name: Pampered Pearl
characters.description: Appears throughout crowds during A Canterlot Wedding - Part 2 and Magical Mystery Cure. Has the same design as Lyrica Lilac and Purple Wave. Two promotional images from The Hub's Facebook page show her more clearly than the corresponding frames of the show do.

characters.name: Peach Melba
characters.description: Appears at Rainbow Falls in Trade Ya! Shares her design and eye color with Candy Apples, "Creamcup", S04E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #11, and S04E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #23, and shares her design with "Jinx".

characters.name: Peachy Cream
characters.description: Appears in The Last Roundup at the arena, shaking her head when asked about Applejack's whereabouts. In the IDW comics, she appears on My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #12's Hot Topic cover.

characters.name: Peachy Plume
characters.description: Appears in Where the Apple Lies as a front desk receptionist at the Ponyville Hospital.

characters.name:
Pony Shopper
Pearmain Worcester
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan in Made in Manehattan, The Saddle Row Review, and Daring Doubt and in Las Pegasus in Viva Las Pegasus. Also appears in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Her cutie mark is a heart-shaped apple. Voiced by Ashleigh Ball.

characters.name: Pegasus Olsen
characters.description: The Mad Men ponies[1] are six background Earth and/or unicorn ponies designed to resemble some of the cast of the AMC drama television series Mad Men, including Business Savvy, Pegasus Olsen, Joan Pommelway, Roger Silvermane, Pete Canterbell, and Bronco Benson. They are gradually introduced in the IDW comics' My Little Pony Micro-Series Issue #8 and in the episodes Rarity Takes Manehattan and Made in Manehattan, and most of them are often depicted in episodes taking place in Manehattan, where at least one or two of them live.[2][3][4][5]​[​dubious – discuss‍​]​ Most are unnamed in the series, "Pete Canterbell" and "Bronco Benson" being placeholder names, but Business Savvy, Pegasus Olsen, Joan Pommelway, and Roger Silvermane are named in merchandise.

characters.name: Penny Ante
characters.description: Appears as a spectator at the Appleloosa rodeo in Appleoosa's Most Wanted. Shares her design with S05E06 Unnamed Earth Mare #3 and S05E06 Unnamed Earth Mare #12. Her cutie mark is three aces.

characters.name: Perfume Hearts
characters.description: One of Suri Polomare's models in Rarity Takes Manehattan. Also appears in Equestria Games, in Made in Manehattan, in The Gift of the Maud Pie, and on the IDW comics' Friends Forever Issue #18 Books-A-Million cover RE. In Simple Ways, the drawing of the fashion show seemingly depicts her along with the other models.

characters.name: Picture Frame
characters.description: Appears in Green Isn't Your Color, Sweet and Elite, Rarity Takes Manehattan, Honest Apple, Fake It 'Til You Make It, and She's All Yak. She is named with a trademark symbol in the nineteenth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that she "& Powder Rouge are always in style." Listed under "Fashion Ponies" within "More Manehattan Ponies" in the Ultimate Guide published by Orchard Books in the United Kingdom.

characters.name: Pitch Perfect
characters.description: A harmonica player from Luna Eclipsed, Apple Family Reunion, a picture in Pinkie Apple Pie, and A Hearth's Warming Tail. Also appears in an October 31, 2013 promotional image. Shares the same design as Beauty Brass. Strongly resembles "Honey Drop".

characters.name: Play Write
characters.description: A teacher at the Ponyville Schoolhouse in Rarity's flashback in The Cutie Mark Chronicles, with a speaking role. She later appears in Trade Ya! and Equestria Games. Her cutie mark is three pencils.

characters.name: Posey Petals
characters.description: Appears at Rainbow Falls in Trade Ya! Shares her design and mane and eye colors with Apple Bumpkin, shares her design, eye color, and cutie mark with S04E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #12, shares her design, eye color, and cutie mark design with S04E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #4, shares her design and eye color with Perfect Pie and "Sun Streak", and shares her design with "Sunfire". Her cutie mark is two flowers.

characters.name: Powder Rouge
characters.description: One of the ponies who readies Fluttershy for the fashion show under Photo Finish's command in Green Isn't Your Color. Later appears in Equestria Games. Her narrow eyes widen right before Fluttershy sneezes in the former episode. She is named with a trademark symbol in the nineteenth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that she "& Lyrica Lilac like pretty jewelry."

characters.name: Power Chord
characters.description: Appears in Once Upon a Zeppelin as a passenger on Iron Will's Cruise of the Princesses Experience. Also appears in Grannies Gone Wild and The Washouts. Shares her design and eye color with S07E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #1 and her mane and tail style and eye color with "Soaring Virtue", and resembles S05E25 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #3. Her cutie mark is a guitar.

characters.name: Pretty Vision
characters.description: A pony in a green suit who is part of Photo Finish's entourage in Green Isn't Your Color. She excitedly cheers for Fluttershy at her fashion show. Also appears in Sweet and Elite, Rarity Takes Manehattan, Honest Apple, Fake It 'Til You Make It, and She's All Yak. She is named with a trademark symbol in the nineteenth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that she "& Roxie Rave offer to help on the runway."

characters.name: Purple Haze
characters.description: Appears during Applejack's fantasy in The Ticket Master and has her varying cutie mark visible in Simple Ways. Shares the same design as "Chilly Puddle", Green Jewel, "Welly", and S05E24 Unnamed Earth Mare #3 and the same mane style as Sassaflash, Parasol, Prim Posy, "Drizzle", "Graceful Falls", "Downdraft", and Honey Rays. Her cutie mark is sometimes what appears to be a pair of cherries.

characters.name: Purple Wave
characters.description: Purple Wave is a female background Earth pony who appears in The Ticket Master. She has a pink coat, violet mane, tail, and eyes, and a cutie mark of three brilliant-cut diamonds. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Pursey Pink
characters.description: Pursey Pink is a female Earth pony who appears in Rarity Takes Manehattan, Equestria Games, Made in Manehattan, The Gift of the Maud Pie, and Fake It 'Til You Make It. She has a light yellow coat, hot pink mane and tail, cerise eyes, and a cutie mark of a handbag. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise and other media. She has a minor speaking role in the season eight episode Fake It 'Til You Make It.

characters.name:
Masseuse Pony
Quake
characters.description: Works as a masseuse at Ponyville's Day Spa in Green Isn't Your Color and Ponyville Confidential. A unicorn version, male according to Rebecca Dart, gives Spike a massage in Princess Spike. Her/his cutie mark is two hearts - one pink, one red. She is a playable character called "Masseuse Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game, which depicts her as an Earth pony and gives her the description "A competent masseuse from the spa; hard-working and confident."

characters.name:
Method Mare 2
Raspberry Beret
characters.description: The Method Mares are a Manehattan theater troupe who appear in Made in Manehattan, consisting of Earth ponies On Stage, Raspberry Beret, Late Show, and Stardom. On Stage and Raspberry Beret are named in Horse Play, but "Late Show" and "Stardom" are unnamed, having placeholder names. They are credited in Made in Manehattan as "Method Mare 1", "Method Mare 2", "Method Mare 3", and "Method Mare 4" respectively.

characters.name: Raspberry Glaze
characters.description: Appears as a competitor in the Appleloosa rodeo in Appleoosa's Most Wanted. She shares her design with Apple Fritter, Jonagold, Lavender Fritter, S04E26 Unnamed Earth Mare #1, S05E06 Unnamed Earth Mare #10, and S05E06 Unnamed Earth Mare #15. Her cutie mark is two donuts.

characters.name:
Clerk
Raspberry Vinaigrette
characters.description: Appears in The Gift of the Maud Pie as a passenger on the Friendship Express. Also appears in Buckball Season, with a speaking role as a store clerk in Discordant Harmony, in The Parent Map, and in A Rockhoof and a Hard Place. Shares her design with S08E14 Unnamed Earth Mare #1 and her body design with S09E26 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #3. She is a character called "Judgy Clerk Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves as an enemy minion during the "Rarity's Retro Revolution" event. The game's description of her states, "Though her customers put her aplomb to the test -- despite her annoyance, she's doing her best!" Her cutie mark is a bottle and bowl. Voiced by Nicole Oliver.

characters.name: Raven Inkwell
characters.description: Raven Inkwell, or simply Raven, is a female pony who appears as both an Earth pony and a unicorn. She has a white coat, a dark brown mane, lighter brown eyes, and a cutie mark of an ink pen and inkwell. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Reflective Rock
characters.description: Stands at a table in the VIP section in The Best Night Ever. Shares the same design as Lyrica Lilac and Purple Wave. Her cutie mark is a lyre.

characters.name: Regal Candent
characters.description: Member of Photo Finish's crew, stands in the audience at Fluttershy's first fashion show in Green Isn't Your Color. Also appears in Sweet and Elite, at Fashion Week in Rarity Takes Manehattan, in Equestria Games, and in She's All Yak. In Fake It 'Til You Make It, her silhouettes appear in a shot visually re-used from Green Isn't Your Color. Her cutie mark appears to be two linked horseshoes.

characters.name: Rogue Ruby
characters.description: Appears in Stranger Than Fan Fiction as an attendee of the Daring Do Convention cosplaying as Dr. Caballeron.

characters.name: Rose
characters.description: Rose, or Roseluck, is a female Earth pony with a pale yellow coat, raspberry mane with light raspberry streaks, chartreuse green eyes, and a cutie mark of a rose. She has speaking roles in several episodes and other media.

characters.name: Rosemary
characters.description: Appears, cutie unmarked, in The Cutie Map - Part 1 and The Cutie Map - Part 2.

characters.name: Rosetta
characters.description: Appears in Brotherhooves Social as one of the Sisterhooves Social judges. Also appears in Rarity's flashback in The Cart Before the Ponies and at the Ponyville Hospital in Where the Apple Lies. Her cutie mark is a flower and two leaves.

characters.name: Rosy Riveter
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as a member of the McColt family. Her cutie mark is three bolts. Voiced by Andrea Libman.

characters.name: Roxie Rave
characters.description: Wardrobe pony that is part of Photo Finish's entourage. She also appears in A Friend in Deed behind the counter of the Ponyville Day Spa. She later appears in Equestria Games and on My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #46 page 5. Has a similar color scheme to Autumn Gem and "Aqua Blossom", and shares her cutie mark with Sweetie Drops, whose cutie mark is identified by Little, Brown's Mini Pony Collector's Guide and Gameloft's mobile game respectively as three candies and as three bows. She is named with a trademark symbol in the nineteenth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that she "& Stella Lashes have fun with makeup."

characters.name: Ruby Splash
characters.description: Ruby Splash is a female background Earth pony who first appears in the season four episode Rarity Takes Manehattan. She has a light blue coat, deep cerise mane, tail, and eyes, and a cutie mark of a strawberry and a bunch of green grapes. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise.

characters.name: Salt Water
characters.description: Appears at Rainbow Falls in Trade Ya!, at Canterlot in Amending Fences and Canterlot Boutique, and at Ponyville in Fame and Misfortune. Shares her design and eye color with Gala Appleby and S04E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #18, shares her design with Apple Honey and S04E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #20, and shares her mane style with S01E16 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #1. Her cutie mark is three drops of water.

characters.name: Savannah Guthrie
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan in an animated Today Show video. Represents Today Show anchor Savannah Guthrie. Her cutie mark is a microphone.

characters.name: Screwball
characters.description: Screwball is a female Earth pony with a pink coat, violet mane and tail with white highlights, dark violet eyes with pink swirls, and a cutie mark of a screw and a baseball. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise.

characters.name: Screwy
characters.description: Screwy is a female background Earth pony with a light blue coat, bluish gray mane and tail, cerise eyes, and a cutie mark usually of a screw and once of three baby bottles. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise. Her dialogue consists entirely of dog noises.

characters.name: Seasong
characters.description: A pony seen in top down shots during the first fashion show in Suited For Success, during the Smile Song in A Friend in Deed, and during The Super Duper Party Pony in Pinkie Pride.

characters.name: Serena
characters.description: Serena is the placeholder name of a female background Earth pony with a blue coat, white mane and tail, amber eyes, and a cutie mark usually of three carrots and rarely of a pineapple.

characters.name: Shoeshine
characters.description: Shoeshine is a female Earth pony with a light blue coat, periwinkle mane, fandango eyes, and a cutie mark of two interlocking horseshoes; one gold and one silver. She does not have a name given in the show, but she is named in merchandise. She is identical to Lilac Links apart from her coat color, shares her design with Sweetie Drops, has a similar color scheme to Screwy, S01E14 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #3, and "Bloo". Shoeshine makes her first spoken appearance in the season one episode The Ticket Master.

characters.name: Silver Berry
characters.description: Silver Berry is a female Earth pony with a bluish gray coat, purple mane and tail, cerise eyes, and a cutie mark of a strawberry and a bunch of grapes. She is unnamed in the show, only credited as "Customer" in Fake It 'Til You Make It, but she is named in merchandise. She has a speaking role in Fake It 'Til You Make It.

characters.name: Silver Frames
characters.description: Swan Song, Golden Gavel, and Silver Frames are three ponies who first appear in Sweet and Elite. They are unnamed in the show, but they are named in merchandise, and Swan Song is also named in another depiction.

characters.name: Sky View
characters.description: A pony seen in top down shots during the first fashion show in Suited For Success and during the Smile Song in A Friend in Deed.

characters.name:
Reporter Pony
Snappy Scoop
characters.description: Several paparazzi ponies appear in various episodes in the series, including Earth ponies Long Shot and Snappy Scoop, unicorn Press Release, and Pegasi Big Shot, Eff Stop, and Tracy Flash. They are unnamed in the show, "Tracy Flash" being a placeholder name, but some are named varyingly in merchandise and other depictions.

characters.name: Soft Spot
characters.description: Appears in Equestria Games, next to "Princess Erroria", whose ears she covers. Shares her design and outfit design with Lavender Bloom and S04E24 Unnamed Earth Mare #1, shares her mane and tail style with "Ivy Vine", and shares her tail style with Golden Harvest. Her cutie mark is of at least two hearts.

characters.name: Soigne Folio
characters.description: One of Photo Finish's helpers in Green Isn't Your Color. Also appears in Sweet and Elite. Later appears in Rarity Takes Manehattan, Equestria Games, Honest Apple, and She's All Yak. In Fake It 'Til You Make It, her silhouette appears in a shot visually re-used from Green Isn't Your Color. Resembles Violet Blurr, one of the humans associated with human Photo Finish. She is named with a trademark symbol in the nineteenth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that she "& Midnight Fun style each other's hair." Listed under "Fashion Ponies" within "More Manehattan Ponies" in the Ultimate Guide published by Orchard Books in the United Kingdom.

characters.name: Soot Stain
characters.description: Appears during the pageant performance in Hearth's Warming Eve, with magenta eyes at the home of the Earth ponies and with violet eyes at the summit of the tribes.

characters.name: Spaceage Sparkle
characters.description: One of the Fashion Week competitors in Rarity Takes Manehattan. Also appears in Equestria Games and She's All Yak. Her cutie mark is a pincushion.

characters.name: Spring Forward
characters.description: Spring Forward is a female background Earth pony with a pink coat, pale yellow mane and tail, green eyes, and a cutie mark of sometimes carrots and other times an hourglass. She is not named in the show, but she is named in merchandise.

characters.name:
Customer Pony
Spring Green
characters.description: A mare who appears at a table with "Lady Beetle" in Somepony to Watch Over Me. Also appears in Fame and Misfortune, It Isn't the Mane Thing About You, and Growing Up is Hard to Do. Voiced by Kazumi Evans in It Isn't the Mane Thing About You.

characters.name: Spring Harvest
characters.description: Appears in flashback in The Perfect Pear. Shares her design with Octavia Melody and Fiddly Twang and her cutie mark with "Dirtbound". Her cutie mark is a carrot.

characters.name: Spring Water
characters.description: Sings in Winter Wrap Up. Shares her design and cutie mark with Sweetie Drops, whose cutie mark is identified by Little, Brown's Mini Pony Collector's Guide and Gameloft's mobile game respectively as three candies and as three bows, shares her design and cutie mark design with Grape Delight, and shares her design with Shoeshine, Luckette, Lilac Links, and Sunny Smiles.

characters.name:
Method Mare 4
Stardom
characters.description: The Method Mares are a Manehattan theater troupe who appear in Made in Manehattan, consisting of Earth ponies On Stage, Raspberry Beret, Late Show, and Stardom. On Stage and Raspberry Beret are named in Horse Play, but "Late Show" and "Stardom" are unnamed, having placeholder names. They are credited in Made in Manehattan as "Method Mare 1", "Method Mare 2", "Method Mare 3", and "Method Mare 4" respectively.

characters.name: Stella Lashes
characters.description: Part of Photo Finish's entourage from Green Isn't Your Color. Also appears at the gallery in Sweet and Elite, at Fashion Week in Rarity Takes Manehattan, in Equestria Games, in Honest Apple, in Fake It 'Til You Make It, in She's All Yak, and on the IDW comics' Micro-Series Issue #4 page 8. She is named with a trademark symbol in the nineteenth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that she "& Pretty Vision like new hairstyles." Listed under "Fashion Ponies" within "More Manehattan Ponies" in the Ultimate Guide published by Orchard Books in the United Kingdom.

characters.name: Strawberry Ice
characters.description: Strawberry Ice is a female Earth pony with a light blue coat, two-tone pink mane and tail, light pink eyes, and a cutie mark of two yellow bows. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise. She has speaking roles in Made in Manehattan and Fake It 'Til You Make It.

characters.name:
Fancy Friendship Student
Strawberry Scoop
characters.description: Appears in School Daze - Part 1, School Daze - Part 2, the seventh version of the remastered opening sequence, Grannies Gone Wild, The Parent Map, Non-Compete Clause, Molt Down, Marks for Effort, A Matter of Principals, The End in Friend, The Washouts, A Rockhoof and a Hard Place, What Lies Beneath, School Raze - Part 1, School Raze - Part 2, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, The Beginning of the End - Part 2, Sparkle's Seven, She's All Yak, 2, 4, 6, Greaaat, A Horse Shoe-In, The Last Problem, and MLP8_Promo_Image_with_Copyright as a student at the School of Friendship. Shares her mane and tail style with "Sunshine Smiles" and S09E26 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1. Her cutie mark is an ice cream cone. She is a character called "Fancy Friendship Student" in Gameloft's mobile game. Her in-game description states, "This pony's mane may have natural highlights, but she's not self-possessed about it -- or much else, really. It's a good attitude to have going into the school year!"

characters.name:
Cruise Pony 3
Forceful Parent Pony
Sun Cloche
characters.description: Appears in Once Upon a Zeppelin as a passenger on Iron Will's Cruise of the Princesses Experience wearing a Princess Cadance shirt. Has two lines of dialogue, one by Cathy Weseluck and one by Tabitha St. Germain. Also appears in Grannies Gone Wild. Her cutie mark is a sun hat.

characters.name:
Mighty Helm Guardspony
Sun Cross
characters.description: Appears in Campfire Tales as a member of the Mighty Helm in Applejack's story. She is a character called "Mighty Helm Guardspony" in Gameloft's mobile game. Her cutie mark is a blue shield knot.

characters.name: Sun Streak
characters.description: Assists in Winter Wrap Up. Shares her design, eye color, and neckerchief with Apple Bumpkin, shares her design, eye color, and neckerchief design with Perfect Pie, shares her design and eye color with S04E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #4, "Posey Petals", and S04E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #12, and shares her design and neckerchief design with "Sunfire". Her cutie mark is a piece of apple fritter.

characters.name: Sunfire
characters.description: Appears at the party at the end of Friendship is Magic, part 2 and is appearing in My Little Pony The Movie. Shares her design, coat color, and neckerchief with Perfect Pie, her design, cutie mark, and neckerchief design with Apple Bumpkin, her design and neckerchief design with "Sun Streak", and her design with S04E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #4, "Posey Petals", and S04E22 Unnamed Earth Mare #12. Her cutie mark is three caramel apples.

characters.name:
Cruise Pony 2
Pony in Window
Sunny Side
characters.description: Appears in Once Upon a Zeppelin as a passenger on Iron Will's Cruise of the Princesses Experience wearing a Princess Cadance shirt. Has two lines of dialogue, one by Patricia Drake and one by Cathy Weseluck. Also appears in Grannies Gone Wild. Her cutie mark is a fried egg.

characters.name: Sunny Smiles
characters.description: Opens a window and joins the chorus of the Smile Song in A Friend in Deed. Identical to Shoeshine and Lilac Links in all but coat and mane colors, identical to Luckette in all but coat, eye, and cutie mark colors, shares her design with Sweetie Drops and Grape Delight, and shares her mane and eye colors and cutie mark with Eclair Crème. Her cutie mark is two interlocking horseshoes. She is named on her Enterplay collectible card game card α #34 R, which lists the quote "Just point me at the problem and I'll be there. I'm not afraid to get my hooves dirty!"

characters.name:
Random Pony
Sunset Bliss
characters.description: Appears with "Plumberry" in Sundae, Sundae, Sundae. She and/or hornless Amethyst Star appear(s) during At the Gala in The Best Night Ever, during the Smile Song in A Friend in Deed, during A True, True Friend in Magical Mystery Cure, and during the Pinkie the Party Planner reprise within Cheese Confesses in Pinkie Pride. She resembles Amethyst Star, shares her design with Rose and S04E24 Unnamed Earth Mare #6, and shares her mane and tail style with Lyra Heartstrings, Diamond Mint, Lemony Gem, Silverspeed, and Banana Fluff. Her cutie mark appears to be two flowers inside a laurel wreath. Voiced by Tabitha St. Germain.

characters.name: Surf
characters.description: She tells Fluttershy to "get a life" in Putting Your Hoof Down, speaking with a stereotypical Valley Girl accent. Also appears in The Saddle Row Review and My Little Pony Established 1983 "Pinkercise w/ Pinkie Pie!" and on the Season 2 poster/DVD set packaging/T-shirt front/iPhone case. Shares her color scheme with S09E23 Unnamed Earth Mare #1. Her cutie mark is a surfboard.

characters.name: Sweetberry
characters.description: Seen singing in Winter Wrap Up. Similar to Cherry Berry.

characters.name: Sweetie Drops
characters.description: Sweetie Drops, or Bon Bon, is a female Earth pony with a beige coat, pigment blue mane with a rose pink streak, cerulean eyes, and a cutie mark of three objects which are identified by Little, Brown's Mini Pony Collector's Guide and Gameloft's mobile game respectively as three candies and as three bows. She has speaking roles in Call of the Cutie, Green Isn't Your Color, Lesson Zero, The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000, Putting Your Hoof Down, Slice of Life, It Isn't the Mane Thing About You, and Marks for Effort. The name Bon Bon comes from "bonbon", which is French for "candy", and originates from Sweetie Drops' cutie mark's resemblance to wrapped sweets.

characters.name: Swirly Cotton
characters.description: Seen singing in Winter Wrap Up. Shares her design and eye color with Golden Harvest, shares her design with Daisy, and has a similar color scheme to Rainbowshine, S01E14 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #5, "Rainbow Drop", "Northern Lights", "Amethyst Beat", S04E20 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #3, Sweetsong, Star Dasher, and Bright Bridle.

characters.name:
Swooning Pony 1
Swoon Song
characters.description: Appears in Hard to Say Anything as one of three ponies swooning over Feather Bangs. Her cutie mark is a loaf of bread and a piece of toast with butter and jelly. She is a character called "Enraptured Fanfilly" in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of her states, "The only reason this pony hasn't asked Feather Bangs out yet is because she respects her friends too much to ask him first! ...She still really wants to, though." Voiced by Claire Corlett.

characters.name:
Violinist Pony
Symphony Song
characters.description: A pony playing a violin in Sweet and Elite next to Octavia Melody. Her cutie mark is a mirrored eighth note. She is named in the twenty-second wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards. The collector card states about Symphony Song, "She attends concerts with friends." She is a character called "Violinist Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves as a boss battle helper during the "Rarity's Retro Revolution" event.

characters.name: Tangerine Tassels
characters.description: One of Rarity's models in Rarity Takes Manehattan. Also appears in Rarity's Peek Behind the Boutique episode 2. In Simple Ways, the drawing of the fashion show seemingly depicts her along with the other models.

characters.name: Tarantella
characters.description: One of Sapphire Shores' backup dancers in For Whom the Sweetie Belle Toils. Also appears in My Little Pony: Friends Forever Issue #37. Shares her mane colors and tail with Sea Swirl.

characters.name: Toffee
characters.description: Appears in Appleloosa in Over a Barrel. Shares Caramel's mane style, color scheme, and cutie mark, and Twilight Sparkle's eye style. Her cutie mark is three blue horseshoes.

characters.name:
Housekeeper Pony
Tote Bag
characters.description: Appears in Crusaders of the Lost Mark as one of the Rich family maids. She is a character called "Housekeeper Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of her states, "Maintains a whole closet of dusters and mops -- if the Riches weren't paying, she MIGHT call them 'fops.'"

characters.name: Tough Love
characters.description: Appears in Applejack's "Day" Off as a patron at the Ponyville Day Spa. Her cutie mark is two hearts - one purple, one pink.

characters.name: Tree H. Hooffield
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as a member of the Hooffield family. Also appears in Growing Up is Hard to Do. Her cutie mark is a barrel.

characters.name: Tree Sap
characters.description: Sings in Winter Wrap Up. Shares her design and cutie mark with Sweetie Drops, whose cutie mark is identified by Little, Brown's Mini Pony Collector's Guide and Gameloft's mobile game respectively as three candies and as three bows, shares her design and cutie mark design with Grape Delight, and shares her design with Shoeshine, Luckette, Lilac Links, and Sunny Smiles.

characters.name: Tropical Spring
characters.description: Briefly appears during the Smile Song in A Friend in Deed, with her eyes closed. Later appears in Magical Mystery Cure, with her eyes open. Also appears during the Cheese Confesses flashback in Pinkie Pride, with her eyes closed. Her cutie mark is two flowers. Shares the same design as "Bottlecap" and "Mango Juice" and the same mane style as Derpy, Sunshower Raindrops, "Blue October / Blueberry Muffin", High Spirits, and Tropical Storm.

characters.name: Trowel Hooffield
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as a member of the Hooffield family. Her cutie mark is a digging trowel.

characters.name:
Pushy Pony
Turf
characters.description: She chides Fluttershy for invading her "personal space" in Putting Your Hoof Down, speaking with a stereotypical Valley Girl accent. Also appears in The Saddle Row Review and My Little Pony Established 1983 "Pinkercise w/ Pinkie Pie!" and on the Season 2 poster/DVD set packaging/T-shirt front/iPhone case. Has a similar color scheme to "Bonnie" and S05E06 Unnamed Earth Mare #8. Her cutie mark is a purple palm tree. She is a character called "Pushy Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves as a boss battle helper during the "Rarity's Retro Revolution" event.

characters.name:
Personal Shopper Pony
Twinkleworks
characters.description: Appears in Crusaders of the Lost Mark as one of the Rich family maids. She is a character called "Personal Shopper Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Vanilla Sweets
characters.description: Earth pony singing in Winter Wrap Up. Shares her design and cutie mark with Sweetie Drops, whose cutie mark is identified by Little, Brown's Mini Pony Collector's Guide and Gameloft's mobile game respectively as three candies and as three bows, shares her design and cutie mark design with Grape Delight, and shares her design with Shoeshine, Luckette, Lilac Links, and Sunny Smiles.

characters.name: Vidala Swoon
characters.description: Vidala Swoon is a female Earth pony hairstylist who first appears in Green Isn't Your Color. She has a pink coat, two-tone hot pink mane, greenish-blue eyes, and a varying cutie mark of at least a comb. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise.

characters.name: Viola
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan in Made in Manehattan, The Gift of the Maud Pie, and an animated Today Show video. Listed under "Fashion Ponies" within "More Manehattan Ponies" in the Ultimate Guide published by Orchard Books in the United Kingdom. Voiced by Ashleigh Ball.

characters.name: Welly
characters.description: Briefly appears during the Smile Song in A Friend in Deed, with her eyes closed. Later appears in Magical Mystery Cure, with her eyes open. Also appears during the Cheese Confesses flashback in Pinkie Pride, with her eyes closed. Her cutie mark is a blue rubber boot, the same as that of S04E20 Unnamed Earth Stallion #6. Shares the same design as "Chilly Puddle", "Purple Haze", Green Jewel, and S05E24 Unnamed Earth Mare #3 and the same mane style as Sassaflash, Parasol, Prim Posy, "Drizzle", "Graceful Falls", "Downdraft", and Honey Rays.

characters.name: Wildwood Flower
characters.description: A pony seen in The Last Roundup. She directs Twilight and the gang to Dodge Junction, where Applejack is staying. Her cutie mark is a guitar.

characters.name: Winter Lotus
characters.description: Appears in Brotherhooves Social as one of the competitors in the Sisterhooves Social. Also appears in The Mane Attraction, No Second Prances, Applejack's "Day" Off, The Cart Before the Ponies, The Fault in Our Cutie Marks, The Perfect Pear, School Daze - Part 1, The Maud Couple, The Parent Map, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, The Beginning of the End - Part 2, The Point of No Return, Between Dark and Dawn, The Summer Sun Setback, Dragon Dropped, A Horse Shoe-In, Growing Up is Hard to Do, The Ending of the End - Part 2, and The Last Problem. Her cutie mark is a hairbrush. Voiced by Andrea Libman in The Ending of the End - Part 2.

characters.name: Winter Withers
characters.description: Makes an appearance as a spectator in Sisterhooves Social and Brotherhooves Social. Shares the same design and mane as Shoeshine and the same coat, eyes, and thunderstorm cutie mark as White Lightning.

characters.name: Yuma Spurs
characters.description: Appears as a spectator at the Appleloosa rodeo in Appleoosa's Most Wanted. Also appears in Princess Spike, Buckball Season, Fame and Misfortune, The End in Friend, Sparkle's Seven, and Growing Up is Hard to Do. Shares her design with S05E06 Unnamed Earth Mare #9, S05E06 Unnamed Earth Mare #14, and Wrangler. Her cutie mark is a spur. She has been included in the Gameloft mobile game's files.​[​dubious – discuss‍​]​

characters.name: Zen Moment
characters.description: Appears in Viva Las Pegasus at Gladmane's Las Pegasus resort. Also appears in Grannies Gone Wild, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Shares her body type with Sapphire Shores and "Hilly Hooffield".

characters.name: Ace Point
characters.description: Ace Point, or simply Ace, is a male Earth pony introduced in Call of the Cutie who has been identified as the fourth best tennis player in Equestria. He has a light tan coat, brown mane and tail, dark blue eyes, and a cutie mark of a tennis racket. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Adante
characters.description: Appears at Rainbow Falls in Trade Ya!, twice at once with different coat colors, cutie marks, and accessory presence, in Ponyville in Triple Threat, and in The Washouts. Shares his design, eye color, and accessory with Apple Cinnamon, shares his design and mane and tail color with Felix and S06E09 Unnamed Earth Stallion #3, shares his design and, in one instance, cutie mark with Noteworthy, shares his design and, in one instance, cutie mark design with "Baritone", shares his design and accessory design with S07E13 Unnamed Earth Stallion #7, shares his design with Goldengrape and Crusoe Palm, shares his mane and tail with M2 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1, and shares his color scheme with Golden Delicious. One of his cutie marks is a wing, and the other of his cutie marks is two pairs of backwards-facing eighth notes.

characters.name: Affero
characters.description: Appears briefly in the VIP section at the Grand Galloping Gala. Partially obscured by an orange tuft hanging from a banner. Shares his design with Sealed Scroll. His cutie mark is a scroll.

characters.name: Al Roker
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan in an animated Today Show video. Represents Today Show anchor Al Roker. His cutie mark is a sun and two white clouds.

characters.name: Ancient Artifact
characters.description: Appears in Stranger Than Fan Fiction as an attendee of the Daring Do Convention cosplaying as Dr. Caballeron.

characters.name:
Pop Art Pony
Andy Warhoof
characters.description: Appears in On Your Marks painting a portrait of Tree Hugger. Resembles Andy Warhol. His cutie mark is a soup can. He is a character called "Pop Art Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Apple Bread
characters.description: Briefly seen in a photograph in both Apple Family Reunion and Bloom & Gloom.

characters.name: Apple Slice
characters.description: Appears during the song Raise This Barn in Apple Family Reunion, but is not included in any of the Apple family photos. Shares his design and eye color with "Bushel" and S04E22 Unnamed Earth Stallion #5 and his design with S04E22 Unnamed Earth Stallion #6. His cutie mark shows three sliced apples.

characters.name: Autumn Leaf
characters.description: Appears in A Hearth's Warming Tail receiving a kiss on the cheek from Lemon Hearts. Also appears in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 7, and My Little Pony Best Gift Ever. His cutie mark is a yellow leaf.

characters.name: B. Sharp
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan in Made in Manehattan, The Gift of the Maud Pie, and The Saddle Row Review. Shares his design with "Sunny Song". His cutie mark is two pairs of beamed musical notes, one pair golden and the other pair blue. He is named with a trademark symbol in the twentieth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that he "& Prim Hemline help run the fashion show."

characters.name:
Stage Manager
Back Stage
characters.description: Appears in Viva Las Pegasus as a stage manager at Gladmane's Las Pegasus resort. Also appears in Grannies Gone Wild. Bears a resemblance to the Muppets character Scooter. Shares his design with S06E13 Unnamed Earth Stallion #10. His cutie mark is a curtain cord. Voiced by Peter Kelamis.

characters.name: Barber Groomsby
characters.description: Barber Groomsby is a male Earth pony barber who appears in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #10 and On Your Marks. He has a white coat, brown mane, tail, and mustache, blue eyes, and a cutie mark of a pair of scissors and comb, and he wears a blue, white, and red-striped bow tie. He first appeared in merchandise.

characters.name: Baritone
characters.description: Pulls two different plows in Winter Wrap Up, during the musical number and in Twilight's come-to-life spell scene. Also appears in the IDW comics' Friendship is Magic Issue #8 page 1. Same design as Noteworthy. His cutie mark is two music quavers.

characters.name: BeauDe Mane
characters.description: Appears in Maretropolis in Power Ponies, in Manehattan in Rarity Takes Manehattan, in Sweetie Belle's dream in For Whom the Sweetie Belle Toils, at Rainbow Falls in Trade Ya!, at the Crystal Empire in Equestria Games, at Manehattan again in Twilight's Kingdom - Part 1, at Our Town in The Cutie Map - Part 2, in Manehattan again in Made in Manehattan, The Gift of the Maud Pie, The Saddle Row Review, Fame and Misfortune, Shadow Play - Part 2, Daring Doubt, an animated Today Show video, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8, and in Canterlot with a different coat color in Sparkle's Seven. Shares his design, eye color, and cutie mark design with Caramel, Upper East Stride, "Strawberry Cream", S05E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #8, and S05E10 Unnamed Earth Stallion #4, shares his design with Cherry Fizzy, Royal Riff, and S01E02 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1, and resembles S04E07 Unnamed Earth Stallion #2. He is named with a trademark symbol in the twentieth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that he "& Don Neigh like fashion shows." His cutie mark is three white horseshoes. Voiced by Brian Drummond.

characters.name: Beuford
characters.description: Appears as a spectator at the Appleloosa rodeo in Appleoosa's Most Wanted. Also appears in Buckball Season, Fame and Misfortune, Sparkle's Seven, The Summer Sun Setback, and Growing Up is Hard to Do. Shares his design with S05E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #24. His cutie mark is three gold lbits.

characters.name:
Caballeron's Bandolero
Biff
characters.description: Biff, Rogue, Withers, Pickpocket, and Rosy Thorn are five ponies who appear as henchponies to Dr. Caballeron. The former three first appear in Daring Don't, "Pickpocket" first appears in Stranger Than Fan Fiction, and Rosy Thorn appears in chapter books. "Pickpocket" is unnamed in the series, his name being a placeholder name, but Biff, Rogue, and Withers are named in Daring Doubt, chapter books, and Tails of Equestria, and Biff and Rogue are also named in merchandise.

characters.name: Big Top
characters.description: Appears in Hearts and Hooves Day during the song The Perfect Stallion while the Cutie Mark Crusaders are looking for a special somepony for Cheerilee. Apple Bloom sings that he's "too silly." His cutie mark is a clown horn. He is named on his Enterplay collectible card game card α #38 F, which lists the quote "I am quite serious about my craft. Once the makeup is on, my vocabulary is reduced to but a single phrase: Honk Honk!"

characters.name:
Professor
Bill Neigh
characters.description: Bill Neigh is a male Earth pony professor with a gray coat, white mane and tail, and blue eyes. He appears in the episodes The Crystal Empire - Part 1, Trade Ya!, and Spice Up Your Life and in the IDW comics' Micro-Series Issue #7. He is unnamed in the show and other media, being called simply "Professor" in the credits and in Gameloft's mobile game, but he is named in merchandise.

characters.name: Black Stone
characters.description: A resident of Appleloosa who appears multiple times in Over a Barrel. During one scene he pulls a carriage, in one shot saying the line "Okay, you pull now" to passenger Noteworthy and in another shot being sketched by Lucky Clover. Identical to Cherry Fizzy in all but coat color and sometimes eye color, shares his design, eye color, and cutie mark with "Cormano" and S05E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #7, and has similar coat and mane colors to S04E20 Unnamed Earth Stallion #8. His cutie mark is two cherries. He is voiced by Scott McNeil.

characters.name:
Captain
Blow Dry
characters.description: Neon Brush, Quick Trim, Comb Over, The Unconditioner, and Blow Dry are the placeholder names of five male Earth ponies, at least twenty-two of whom serve as henchponies to the Mane-iac in the comic-book universe of Maretropolis. They appear in Power Ponies and its adaptation(s) Power Ponies to the Rescue! and Power Ponies Go! They are unnamed in the show and in other depictions, one of which internally identifies Neon Brush as soldier, Quick Trim as officer, and Blow Dry as captain.

characters.name: Mr. Breezy
characters.description: Mr. Breezy is a male Earth pony who appears in the episodes The Show Stoppers and It Isn't the Mane Thing About You. He has a light brown coat, orange mane and tail, light blue eyes, and a cutie mark of an electric fan, and he wears a green tam o' shanter and vest.

characters.name: Brindle Young
characters.description: A pony sporting a handlebar mustache, seen in Granny Smith's flashbacks in Family Appreciation Day and Leap of Faith. Resembles Tall Order, "Steel Wright", "All Aboard", Karat, and S05E12 Unnamed Unicorn Stallion #1.

characters.name: Burdock Hooffield
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as a member of the Hooffield family. His cutie mark is a prickly bush. Shares his body model with Gizmo, "Street Rat", "Spiral Notepad", "Ginger Locks", and S09E22 Unnamed Earth Stallion #2.

characters.name:
Shopkeeper
Burlap
characters.description: A cutie unmarked shopkeeper who sells cloaks in Our Town in The Cutie Map - Part 1. Shares his body style and eye color with Gladmane, "Joe Pescolt", S04E04 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1, S04E04 Unnamed Earth Stallion #6, S04E04 Unnamed Earth Stallion #13, and S06E17 Unnamed Earth Stallion #7. Voiced by Sam Vincent.

characters.name: Bush League
characters.description: Appears, sometimes with a white mane, as a spectator at the Appleloosa rodeo in Appleoosa's Most Wanted. Also appears in Buckball Season, as a member of the Appleloosa buckball team in The End in Friend, in The Summer Sun Setback, in Growing Up is Hard to Do.

characters.name: Business Savvy
characters.description: The Mad Men ponies[1] are six background Earth and/or unicorn ponies designed to resemble some of the cast of the AMC drama television series Mad Men, including Business Savvy, Pegasus Olsen, Joan Pommelway, Roger Silvermane, Pete Canterbell, and Bronco Benson. They are gradually introduced in the IDW comics' My Little Pony Micro-Series Issue #8 and in the episodes Rarity Takes Manehattan and Made in Manehattan, and most of them are often depicted in episodes taking place in Manehattan, where at least one or two of them live.[2][3][4][5]​[​dubious – discuss‍​]​ Most are unnamed in the series, "Pete Canterbell" and "Bronco Benson" being placeholder names, but Business Savvy, Pegasus Olsen, Joan Pommelway, and Roger Silvermane are named in merchandise.

characters.name: Caboose
characters.description: Appears in Over a Barrel as either the last or second front-most of the four engineer ponies depending on the shot, in The Last Roundup as one of Applejack's stagecoach pullers, in Putting Your Hoof Down as an asparagus merchant, in Rarity Takes Manehattan as a cabbie, in Party Pooped as one of Cherry Jubilee's stagecoach pullers, and in Made in Manehattan, The Gift of the Maud Pie, The Perfect Pear, Fame and Misfortune, Shadow Play - Part 2, an animated Today Show video, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8 as a cabbie again.

characters.name:
Dancing Clownspony
Caramel
characters.description: Caramel is a background male Earth pony in My Little Pony Friendship is Magic. He has a light brown coat with a darker brown mane. He shares his mane and tail style and his color scheme with Doctor Horse, and shares his design with Cherry Fizzy, Royal Riff, and S01E02 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1. He is called Chance-A-Lot in some merchandise.

characters.name: Charlie Coal
characters.description: Appears throughout crowds during A Canterlot Wedding - Part 2 and Magical Mystery Cure. Has the same design as Sealed Scroll. Two promotional images from The Hub's Facebook page show him more clearly than the corresponding frames of the show do.

characters.name: Cheese Curls
characters.description: One of three Cheese Sandwich lookalikes shown during The Super Duper Party Pony in Pinkie Pride, the last lookalike in the lineup but the second lookalike to appear on screen. He gets offered mayonnaise.

characters.name: Cherry Fizzy
characters.description: Cherry Fizzy, or simply Cherry Fizz, is a male background Earth pony with a brown coat, black mane, light green (sometimes blue) eyes, and a cutie mark of two cherries. He is not named in the show, but he is named in merchandise. He shares his design with Caramel, Golden Delicious, Royal Riff, "Black Stone," S01E02 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1, and "Cormano."

characters.name: Cherry Gold
characters.description: Cherry Gold is the placeholder name of a male background Earth pony who appears in the season four episode Equestria Games. He has a yellow coat, brown mane, green eyes, and his cutie mark is a pair of cherries on their stems. He is unnamed in the series.

characters.name: Cherry Strudel
characters.description: Appears once during the stockpiling in Over a Barrel. Has the same coat color, cutie mark, and sometimes eye color as Cherry Fizzy and the same mane style, mane color, and hat as Goldengrape. His cutie mark is two cherries.

characters.name: Chocolate Haze
characters.description: Queues up in Applejack's fantasy in The Ticket Master, watches Trixie's magic show in Boast Busters, and has his cutie mark visible in Simple Ways. Shares his design with "Klein" and Emerald Green and his mane style with "Written Script", Comet Tail, Rare Find, Stormfeather, "Silver Script", Bright Bulb, and S04E22 Unnamed Unicorn Stallion #3. Appears to have a carrot cutie mark.

characters.name: Classy Clover
characters.description: Appears throughout crowds during A Canterlot Wedding - Part 2 and Magical Mystery Cure. Has the same design as Count Caesar. Two promotional images from The Hub's Facebook page show him more clearly than the corresponding frames of the show do.

characters.name:
Janitor Pony
Clean Sweep
characters.description: Appears in Sweetie Belle's dream in Bloom & Gloom. Also appeaars in The Last Problem. He is a character called "Janitor Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of him states, "This stallion's skills with a mop are sublime. He'll get your floor sparkling -- and in record time!" His cutie mark is a broom. Voiced by Peter New in The Last Problem.

characters.name: Cobalt
characters.description: Appears throughout crowds during A Canterlot Wedding - Part 2 and Magical Mystery Cure. Has the same design as Sealed Scroll. Two promotional images from The Hub's Facebook page show him more clearly than the corresponding frames of the show do.

characters.name: Comb Over
characters.description: Neon Brush, Quick Trim, Comb Over, The Unconditioner, and Blow Dry are the placeholder names of five male Earth ponies, at least twenty-two of whom serve as henchponies to the Mane-iac in the comic-book universe of Maretropolis. They appear in Power Ponies and its adaptation(s) Power Ponies to the Rescue! and Power Ponies Go! They are unnamed in the show and in other depictions, one of which internally identifies Neon Brush as soldier, Quick Trim as officer, and Blow Dry as captain.

characters.name: Cormano
characters.description: Lugs a cart of hay in Over a Barrel and The Last Roundup, wearing a pink cowpony hat. Resembles S05E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #7, has the same design, eye color, and cutie mark as "Black Stone", has the same design, cutie mark, and sometimes eye color as Cherry Fizzy, and has the same coat and mane colors and pink hat as Shoeshine. His cutie mark is two cherries.

characters.name: Count Caesar
characters.description: Count Caesar is a male Earth pony and one of the four most frequently appearing high society ponies, along with Sealed Scroll, Lyrica Lilac, and Royal Ribbon. He has a light gray coat, a bluish silver mane, gold eyes, and a golden laurel wreath cutie mark. He shares his design with "Classy Clover" and "Lincoln", and has vocal roles in The Cutie Mark Chronicles and The Best Night Ever. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named in merchandise.

characters.name:
Organic Baker
Cracked Wheat
characters.description: Appears in The Parent Map as a resident and baker in Sire's Hollow. His cutie mark is a jug, mixing bowl, and two eggs. He is a character called "Heritage Baker Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game; his bio states, "This gallant stallion bakes old-timey breads that work more as conversation pieces than as food. The conversation is usually 'this bread isn't very edible.'" Voiced by Andrew McNee.

characters.name:
Ancient Beast Dealer
Cratus
characters.description: Appears as a handler and trader of ancient beasts, such as an orthros, at the Rainbow Falls Traders Exchange in Trade Ya!, voiced by Michael Daingerfield. Shares his tail style with Walter, "Lockdown", "Duce Switchell", and Nightjar. Has no visible cutie mark. He is named on his Enterplay collectible card game Equestrian Odysseys expansion set card #106 R, which lists the quote "Come on down to Cratus' Crazy Critters for crazy low prices! Who else would go into the Scariest Cave in Equestria to capture these creatures? No one! I'm that crazy!" He is a character in Gameloft's mobile game. Based on Kratos.​[​specify​]​

characters.name: Creme Brulee
characters.description: Seen in the original opening sequence, Green Isn't Your Color, Lesson Zero, Putting Your Hoof Down, Magical Mystery Cure, Pinkie Pride, Trade Ya!, The One Where Pinkie Pie Knows, and The Fault in Our Cutie Marks. Shares Caramel/Chance-A-Lot's coat color and cutie mark, along with Caramel's mane color and Chance-A-Lot's design. Has the same design and eye color as Big McIntosh, whom his place is swapped out for in the remastered opening. Shares his design and eye color with Magazine Unnamed Stallion - Newspaper Reporter, his design with Emerald Ray and Magazine Unnamed Stallion - Yoke, his body type and mane style with S04E07 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1, and his body type and tail style with the watchpony. His cutie mark is three horseshoes.

characters.name: Crest Crown
characters.description: A pony seen in the background of the first fashion show in Suited For Success, behind Spike.

characters.name: Crusoe Palm
characters.description: Crusoe Palm, also called Coco Crusoe or Coconut, is a male background Earth pony who appears in multiple episodes throughout the show. He has a brown coat, light yellow mane, purple eyes, and a cutie mark of a coconut or palm tree on a desert island. He is not named in the show, but he is named "Crusoe Palm" directly with a trademark symbol in first-party merchandise, "Coco Crusoe" directly sometimes with a trademark symbol in second-party merchandise and other media, and "Coconut" indirectly in another depiction.

characters.name:
Flashy Pony
Dance Fever
characters.description: Dance Fever is a male background Earth pony who appears in Hearts and Hooves Day and Slice of Life. He has a tan coat, two-tone brown mane, light blue eyes, and a cutie mark of a disco ball. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named in merchandise.

characters.name: Davenport
characters.description: Davenport is a male Earth pony and the owner of Quills and Sofas, a store in Ponyville that sells quills and sofas. He is named directly in It Isn't the Mane Thing About You and merchandise and indirectly in some other media.

characters.name: Diamond Cutter
characters.description: Appears at Rainbow Falls in Trade Ya!, at Our Town in The Cutie Map - Part 2, in Manehattan in Made in Manehattan saying "Move it!", The Gift of the Maud Pie, The Saddle Row Review, with a speaking role in Fame and Misfortune, and She's All Yak. Shares his coat and eye colors, one of his designs, and one of his cutie marks with Royal Riff, and shares one of his designs with Caramel, Cherry Fizzy, and S01E02 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1. He is named in the twenty-first wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards. The collector card states about Diamond Cutter, "He loves showing friends Manehattan style." His cutie mark usually is a gem and sometimes is two G-clefs. Voiced by Peter New in Fame and Misfortune.

characters.name: Dirtbound
characters.description: Appears with a face covered in bandages in Leap of Faith, in a flashback to Leap of Faith in Twilight's Kingdom - Part 1, and in Where the Apple Lies. Shares his body type and coat and eye colors with Jesús Pezuña and his cutie mark with "Spring Harvest". His cutie mark, only sometimes visible, is a carrot.

characters.name:
Masked Pony 2
