Doctor Spring Bud
characters.description: Appears in Where the Apple Lies as a doctor/surgeon at the Ponyville Hospital. Voiced by Brian Drummond.

characters.name: Don Neigh
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan in Rarity Takes Manehattan, sometimes with different eyes at the Crystal Empire in Equestria Games, and in She's All Yak. Shares his design, coat color, and cutie mark with Goldengrape, shares his design, cutie mark, and partly name with Neigh Sayer, shares his design and cutie mark with S05E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #16 and S05E09 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1, shares his design, usually eyes, and accessory design with S06E09 Unnamed Earth Stallion #3, shares his design with Noteworthy and Crusoe Palm, and has a similar color scheme to Strawberry Sunrise and Bright Mac. His cutie mark is two bunches of green grapes. He is named with a trademark symbol in the twentieth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that he "& Pursey Pink have cool city style."

characters.name: Dr. Hooves
characters.description: Dr. Hooves, or Whooves, also known as Dr. Whooves or Time Turner, is a background male Earth pony with an hourglass cutie mark. He shares his design with Meadow Song and Lucky Clover. Hasbro acknowledged the character's popularity in the Comic Con 2011 promotional poster, where he is explicitly posed in a way that his cutie mark is clearly visible.

characters.name: Duce Switchell
characters.description: A bearded stallion who appears with a speaking role in Somepony to Watch Over Me. Also appears in A Rockhoof and a Hard Place and on the season 4 poster. Shares his tail style and beard style with Walter and Nightjar, and shares his tail style with Cratus and "Lockdown". Mama is S04E17 Unnamed Earth Mare #3. The episode's credits list "Cajun Swamp Pony" as being voiced by Peter New. Mentioned online months prior to the episode premiere, in the October 28, 2013 post "There will be an ice archer, and a cajun swamp pony, and a crystal pony security guard and they will ALL share one something in common."

characters.name: Eiffel
characters.description: Eiffel is the placeholder name of a male Earth pony with a dark blue coat, light blue mane and tail, blue eyes, and a cutie mark either of two bongo drums, of a scroll, of an airstream cutting through two clouds, of two objects which are identified indirectly by Little, Brown's Mini Pony Collector's Guide and Gameloft's mobile game respectively as candies and as bows, of a strawberry and a bunch of green grapes, or of a guitar.

characters.name: Emerald Beacon
characters.description: Appears in crowds shown from the front during A Canterlot Wedding - Part 2, Magical Mystery Cure, Princess Twilight Sparkle - Part 1, and the Equestrivia Challenge online game. Has the same design, eye color, and accessory design as Perfect Pace and the same mane style, eye color, cutie mark, and accessory design as "Infinity".

characters.name: Emerald Green
characters.description: Emerald Green is a background pony with an orange coat, white mane and tail, blue eyes, and a cutie mark of four green gemstones. He is an Earth pony both in few in-show appearances and in all merchandise and other media, while he is a Pegasus in most in-show appearances. He is not named in the show, but he is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: End Zone
characters.description: Appears in School Daze - Part 1, School Daze - Part 2, Non-Compete Clause, Molt Down, Marks for Effort, A Matter of Principals, The End in Friend, A Rockhoof and a Hard Place, School Raze - Part 2, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, The Beginning of the End - Part 2 (sometimes with a different coat color), She's All Yak, and A Horse Shoe-In as a student at the School of Friendship. Shares his design with "Desert Wind", S07E22 Unnamed Pegasus Stallion #3, and S08E14 Unnamed Unicorn Stallion #1 and his color scheme nearly with "High Roller" and S07E13 Unnamed Earth Stallion #7. His cutie mark is an American football.

characters.name: Evening Star
characters.description: Appears in Over a Barrel as either the third front-most or the last of the four engineer ponies depending on the shot, in The Last Roundup as one of Applejack's stagecoach pullers, in Rarity Takes Manehattan as a cabbie, in Party Pooped as one of Cherry Jubilee's stagecoach pullers, and in Made in Manehattan, The Gift of the Maud Pie, Fame and Misfortune, Shadow Play - Part 2, Fake It 'Til You Make It, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8 as a cabbie again. Shares his design with S05E16 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1, S06E23 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1, S07E26 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1, and S07E26 Unnamed Earth Stallion #2 and his cutie mark with Big McIntosh. His cutie mark, only sometimes visible, is a green apple sliced in half.

characters.name: Fahal Alkhayl
characters.description: Appears in Daring Done? as a resident of Somnambula. Also appears in Shadow Play - Part 1 with a speaking role, in Road to Friendship, and in A Rockhoof and a Hard Place. Voiced by Vincent Tong.

characters.name: Felix
characters.description: Felix, or Lucky Streak, is a male background Earth pony with a bluish gray coat, dark gray mane and tail, gold eyes, and a cutie mark of three four-leaf clovers. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named "Felix" with a trademark symbol and "Lucky Streak" in merchandise.

characters.name:
Newspaper Pony
Fine Print
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan in Made in Manehattan as a newspaper vendor. His cutie mark is a newsboy cap and rolled-up newspaper. Modeled after Jack Kelly from the film Newsies. Voiced by Colin Murdock.

characters.name: Frederick Horseshoepin
characters.description: Plays the piano at the Grand Galloping Gala in The Best Night Ever and later appears in Equestria Games and My Little Pony The Movie. He is named in Gameloft's mobile game, where he has the description "Part of a four-pony musical ensemble, Frederick Horseshoepin is a talented piano player that can be seen performing in Equestria's most sophisticated celebrations." Usually shares the same tail style, cutie mark design, and stool design as "Ragtime". His cutie mark in Friendship is Magic and the mobile game is sometimes-reversed musical notes, two beamed white ones and two beamed black ones; his cutie mark in The Movie is a trumpet and black musical notes. He is named after the Polish composer Frédéric Chopin.

characters.name: Free Throw
characters.description: Appears as one of the Grand Equestria Pony Summit delegates in Princess Spike. Has the same body type and eye color as Trenderhoof, "Uptown Clover", and S06E17 Unnamed Earth Stallion #6, the same body type as "Natural Deduction" and "Mustafa Combe", and a similar body type to "Sprig Hooffield", "Vermilion Spring", and Chancellor Neighsay. His cutie mark is a basketball and hoop. Resembles Will Smith from The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air.

characters.name: Funnel Web
characters.description: Appears in Honest Apple as the model for Inky Rose's fashions in the Carousel Boutique fashion contest. His cutie mark is a black spider.

characters.name: Full Steam
characters.description: Appears in Over a Barrel as the front-most engineer pony who hits back at a buffalo at full force and stuns him while still keeping pace on his running, in The Last Roundup as one of Applejack's stagecoach pullers, in Apple Family Reunion as one of the hayride pullers, in Rarity Takes Manehattan as a cabbie, in Pinkie Pride, in Party Pooped, and in Made in Manehattan, The Gift of the Maud Pie, and The Saddle Row Review as a cabbie again. He is named on his Enterplay collectible card game card α #31 R, which gives him the description "Full Steam is famous for leading the first train team on a non-stop trip from Vanhoover to Manehattan."

characters.name: Fuzzy Slippers
characters.description: The pony occupying Rainbow Dash's previous hospital bed during her infiltration in Read It and Weep, voiced by Brian Drummond. In Three's A Crowd, an otherwise unidentified stallion whose muzzle shape and coat and eye colors match Red Delicious, Goldengrape, "Fuzzy Slippers", S01E21 Unnamed Earth Stallion #10, S05E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #9, and "Harry Trotter" equally makes a brief appearance as a security team member during Glass of Water. "Fuzzy Slippers" has coat and eye colors the same as those of Red Delicious, Goldengrape, "Wisp", S01E21 Unnamed Earth Stallion #10, S05E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #9, "Harry Trotter", and Strike.

characters.name:
Bassist Pony
George Horrsen
characters.description: Appears in five photographs and at the friendship party in Party Pooped. Also appears in a photograph in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Resembles George Harrison of the Beatles. His cutie mark is three smiling jelly beans. He is a character called "Bassist Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name:
Bearded Hollowvian
Ginger Beard
characters.description: Appears with Fluttershy and Discord in Fluttershy's Cottage in a re-edited Make New Friends but Keep Discord shot pictured in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook Ep. 3 All About Alicorns. Also appears in The Parent Map. Shares his tail style and beard style with Piles McColt and his mane style and sometimes glasses design with Bill Neigh. His cutie mark is an Omega symbol with wings. He is a character called "Bearded Hollowvian" in Gameloft's mobile game, and acts as an enemy minion in the "Fake It 'Til You Make It"" event. Name stated by "Mjátt the Rëdd"; resembles Matt Riordan—"There are instances where we develop things in house, like we have a coworker, and he had a pony to added to the Heartfelt Shorts, and then the studio added it."—"This is based on one of the Toy designers at Hasbro brand. They asked us to drop his pony in somewhere. But the resemblance is uncanny!"—"I don’t even know! We just received the design and was asked to incorporate it somewhere."—"When Hasbro asks you to put their staffer’s oc in the show, you just do it."—"There’s no sneaking involved in this case."—"Nope. It was based on one of Hasbro’s toy designers. They requested we drop him in."​[​specify​]​

characters.name:
Attendant Pony
Ginger Locks
characters.description: Appears in All Bottled Up as the attendant for "Manehattan Escapes". Also appears in Grannies Gone Wild, The Last Crusade, and Growing Up is Hard to Do. He shares his body model with Gizmo, "Burdock Hooffield", "Street Rat", "Spiral Notepad", and S09E22 Unnamed Earth Stallion #2. His cutie mark is a padlock. Voiced by Riley Murdock.

characters.name: Gingerbread
characters.description: Appears during the song Raise This Barn in Apple Family Reunion, but is not included in any of the Apple family photos. Resembles Starburst.

characters.name: Globe Trotter
characters.description: Globe Trotter is a male background Earth pony with a brown coat, two-tone brown mane and tail, blue eyes, and a cutie mark sometimes of a green leaf and sometimes of a palm tree on an island. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named in merchandise.

characters.name: Goldengrape
characters.description: Goldengrape is a male background Earth pony with a light yellow coat, blue mane and eyes, and a cutie mark of two bunches of green grapes. His name is not mentioned in the show, and it first appeared in the accompanying pamphlet of a mystery pack toy released in January 2012. He is identical to Red Delicious apart from his cutie mark, and shares his design with Noteworthy and Coco Crusoe.

characters.name: Grape Crush
characters.description: Appears once during one shot in Magical Mystery Cure. Also appears on My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #10 page 6. Has the same design as Noteworthy, "Welch", Crusoe Palm, and Goldengrape. His cutie mark is two sets of two bridged eighth notes.

characters.name: Gravedigger Hooffield
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as a member of the Hooffield family. His cutie mark is a shovel in the dirt.

characters.name:
Saddle Arabian Stallion
Haakim
characters.description: Haakim and Amira are the merchandise-used​[​specify​]​ placeholder​[​dubious – discuss‍​]​ names of two Earth ponies who appear in Magic Duel and Equestria Games. They are members of Saddle Arabian royalty or significant authority who appear as members of a delegation to Ponyville.

characters.name: Hammerhead McColt
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as a member of the McColt family. His cutie mark is a bag of hammers. Shares his body design with Trouble Shoes.

characters.name: Hammerstrike
characters.description: Appears in Campfire Tales as a member of the Mighty Helm in Applejack's story. His cutie mark is a Viking hammer.

characters.name: Harry Trotter
characters.description: Appears briefly in the crowd during the final wedding ceremony in A Canterlot Wedding - Part 2, bespectacled and also wearing a red-and-yellow scarf; see also Harriet Pinto and Micro 08 Unnamed Colt - Harry Potter. Also appears in My Little Pony Established 1983 "Bling is the thing!" In Three's A Crowd, an otherwise unidentified stallion whose muzzle shape and coat and eye colors match Red Delicious, Goldengrape, "Fuzzy Slippers", S01E21 Unnamed Earth Stallion #10, S05E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #9, and "Harry Trotter" equally makes a brief appearance as a security team member during Glass of Water. "Harry Trotter" has the same design and coat and eye colors as Red Delicious and Goldengrape and the same coat and eye colors as "Wisp", "Fuzzy Slippers", S01E21 Unnamed Earth Stallion #10, S05E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #9, and Strike.

characters.name: Hay Fever
characters.description: Appears in Hearts and Hooves Day during the song The Perfect Stallion while the Cutie Mark Crusaders are looking for a special somepony for Cheerilee. Sweetie Belle sings that he "clearly has a terrible cold." Also appears in Leap of Faith, and on Micro-Series Issue #7 page 18. Only a small portion of his cutie mark is shown.

characters.name: Heisenbuck
characters.description: Appears in Grannies Gone Wild at Flim and Flam's Las Pegasus resort. Resembles Walter White from Breaking Bad. Shares his coat and mane colors and somewhat design with Buried Lede. His cutie mark is two blue diamonds.

characters.name: Hercules
characters.description: A guest at the Grand Galloping Gala in The Best Night Ever. Shares his design with Sealed Scroll. His cutie mark is a scroll.

characters.name:
EMT Pony
Hermes
characters.description: Appears in Rainbow Falls as a medic pony pulling a stretcher for Soarin. Appears as a Pegasus in Secrets and Pies. His cutie mark is crossed adhesive bandaging. Voiced by Scott Underwood.

characters.name:
Sousaphonist Pony
Hill Song
characters.description: A sousaphone pony who plays at a hilly area in Three's A Crowd. He is a character called "Sousaphonist Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Horseshoe Comet
characters.description: Appears in Viva Las Pegasus at Gladmane's Las Pegasus resort. Also appears in Grannies Gone Wild, Friendship University, Common Ground, Between Dark and Dawn, The Last Problem, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. His cutie mark is a shooting horseshoe.

characters.name: Hughbert Jellius
characters.description: Hughbert Jellius is a male background Earth pony who appears in Hearts and Hooves Day and Slice of Life. He has a gray coat, light yellow mane, light blue eyes, and a cutie mark of three strawberries. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named in merchandise.

characters.name: Icy Drop
characters.description: Appears in The Ticket Master. Resembles Eff Stop. Has no cutie mark. Slightly tinted picture with rain.

characters.name:
Bold Archaeologist
Indiana Pones
characters.description: Appears in Shadow Play - Part 1 and A Rockhoof and a Hard Place on an archaeological dig at Rockhoof's island home. Resembles Indiana Jones; see also Friends Forever 23 Unnamed Stallion - Indiana Jones. His cutie mark is a whip. He is a character called "Bold Archaeologist" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Iron Bark
characters.description: Appears in Campfire Tales as a member of the Mighty Helm in Applejack's story. His cutie mark is a tree.

characters.name: Jeff Letrotski
characters.description: Jeff Letrotski, also known as Lebowski Pony, Richard (the) Hoovenheart, Jeff Letroski, Jeff "The Dude" Letrotski, or simply Letrotski, is a male Earth pony who first appears in the season two episode The Cutie Pox. He is dressed differently in most episodes and in the IDW comics, with a speaking role in Ponyville Days. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named variously in episode credits, merchandise, and other media.

characters.name: Jeff Trotsworthy
characters.description: A stallion who appears at a table with Jeff Letrotski in Somepony to Watch Over Me. Also appears in Fame and Misfortune and A Rockhoof and a Hard Place. Resembles Compass Star.

characters.name: Jesús Pezuña
characters.description: Appears at the bowling alley in The Cutie Pox. Also appears on the Season 2 poster and is shown on Acidfree's first art print. Shares his body type and coat and eye colors with "Dirtbound". Resembles the character Jesus Quintana from the movie The Big Lebowski. His name and cutie mark are shown in Gameloft's mobile game, which gives him the description "This highly competitive pony loves to bowl against his rival Jeff Letrotski… and does not like to lose." Pezuña is Spanish for "hoof".

characters.name: Jim Beam
characters.description: A construction worker in The Mysterious Mare Do Well who ends up getting rescued by Rainbow Dash. He shares the same color scheme as "Rivet". His cutie mark is an I-beam.

characters.name:
Manehattan Delegate
Joe Pescolt
characters.description: Appears as the Manehattan delegate for the Grand Equestria Pony Summit delegates in Princess Spike. Also appears in a photograph in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 3. Shares his body style and eye color with Gladmane, "Burlap", S04E04 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1, S04E04 Unnamed Earth Stallion #6, S04E04 Unnamed Earth Stallion #13, and S06E17 Unnamed Earth Stallion #7. His cutie mark is a slice of pizza. Voiced by Jason Schombing. He is a character called "Manehattan Delegate" in Gameloft's mobile game. Fluffy Clouds' Enterplay collectible card game High Magic expansion set card #26 R attributes to Manehattan Delegate and Whinnyapolis Delegate the respective quotes "What city is he even representing?" and "Gosh, I don't think even HE knows that."

characters.name: John Bull
characters.description: Appears in Over a Barrel as either the second or third front-most of the four engineer ponies depending on the shot, in The Last Roundup as one of Applejack's stagecoach pullers, in Apple Family Reunion as one of the hayride pullers, in Rarity Takes Manehattan, in Party Pooped as one of Cherry Jubilee's stagecoach pullers, and in Made in Manehattan, Fame and Misfortune, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8 as a cabbie again.

characters.name: Josehoof Teller
characters.description: Appears in Viva Las Pegasus at Gladmane's Las Pegasus resort. Also appears in Grannies Gone Wild, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Bears a resemblance to Raymond Joseph Teller.

characters.name:
Eyeshade Pony
Karat
characters.description: The keeper of the jewelry shop that Apple Bloom and Scootaloo try to keep Big McIntosh in for an hour to stop his infatuation with Cheerilee in Hearts and Hooves Day. Also appears in Slice of Life (named in its locked script), Where the Apple Lies, and Dragon Dropped. He resembles Tall Order, "Steel Wright", "All Aboard", and "Brindle Young" and shares his color scheme and occupation with "Clarity Cut". He is a character called "Eyeshade Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game. His cutie mark is a diamond ring in Hearts and Hooves Day, Dragon Dropped, and the mobile game and is two white G-clefs in Slice of Life.

characters.name: Kazooie
characters.description: Plays the banjo in Luna Eclipsed, dressed as a rag doll or scarecrow. Appears wearing part of the same getup in Apple Family Reunion and in a picture in Bloom & Gloom. Appears with part of his mane visible in A Hearth's Warming Tail. Also appeared on Hasbro's former Pony Wedding microsite and appears in an October 31, 2013 promotional image. Shares the same tail style, cutie mark, and stool design as Parish Nandermane. His cutie mark appears to be a lyre.

characters.name: Klein
characters.description: Appears in Applejack's fantasy in The Ticket Master, in The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000, and with his cutie mark visible in Simple Ways. Shares his design with "Chocolate Haze" and Emerald Green and his mane style with "Written Script", Comet Tail, Rare Find, Stormfeather, "Silver Script", Bright Bulb, and S04E22 Unnamed Unicorn Stallion #3. His cutie mark appears to be a horseshoe.

characters.name:
Duke of Maretonia
Kyrippos II
characters.description: Appears with "Ice Mirror" in Equestria Games and Twilight's Kingdom - Part 1 and on the season 4 poster. Listed in the credits as "Dignitary" and voiced by Vincent Tong. Also mentioned in Princess Celestia and the Summer of Royal Waves.

characters.name: Lapis Hauyne
characters.description: Appears in Stranger Than Fan Fiction as an attendee of the Daring Do Convention. Shares his design and mane color with S06E13 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1.

characters.name:
Method Mare 3
Late Show
characters.description: The Method Mares are a Manehattan theater troupe who appear in Made in Manehattan, consisting of Earth ponies On Stage, Raspberry Beret, Late Show, and Stardom. On Stage and Raspberry Beret are named in Horse Play, but "Late Show" and "Stardom" are unnamed, having placeholder names. They are credited in Made in Manehattan as "Method Mare 1", "Method Mare 2", "Method Mare 3", and "Method Mare 4" respectively.

characters.name: Leadnail McColt
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as a member of the McColt family. Shares his body type with Claude, S05E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #21, Stinky Bottom, S06E03 Unnamed Earth Stallion #4, "Port Wine", Coriander Cumin, "Mint Condition", and Cattail.

characters.name: Leadwing
characters.description: Bittersweet[2] and Leadwing[3] are two background ponies, the former a female unicorn and the latter a male Earth pony, who appear in Princess Spike and the IDW comics. Bittersweet has a lime green coat, gold mane, blue-green eyes, and a cutie mark of a speech bubble with a heart inside. Leadwing has a blue coat, deep blue mane, dark blue eyes, and a cutie mark of a pencil with bat wings. They are the respective original characters of IDW Publishing writer Katie Cook and artist Andy Price.

characters.name: Levon Song
characters.description: Appears in Maretropolis in Power Ponies, in Manehattan in Rarity Takes Manehattan, Made in Manehattan, The Gift of the Maud Pie, The Saddle Row Review, Shadow Play - Part 2, and Daring Doubt, at Rainbow Falls in Trade Ya!, at the Crystal Empire in Equestria Games, in Canterlot in Princess Spike, in Las Pegasus in Viva Las Pegasus and Grannies Gone Wild, in Fake It 'Til You Make It, and in Appleloosa in Common Ground and Growing Up is Hard to Do. Also appears in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. His cutie mark is two pairs of beamed eighth notes. He is named with a trademark symbol in the twentieth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that he "& B. Sharp are big music fans."

characters.name:
Guitarist Pony
Liam T. Walrus
characters.description: Appears in five photographs in Party Pooped. Also appears in a photograph in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Resembles John Lennon of the Beatles. His cutie mark is a Peace sign. He is a character called "Guitarist Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name:
Coloratura's Stylist
Limelight
characters.description: Appears in The Mane Attraction as one of Coloratura's backup dancers. Also appears in My Little Pony Established 1983 "Pinkercise w/ Pinkie Pie!" His cutie mark is a spotlight. He is a character called "Coloratura's Stylist" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Lincoln
characters.description: A guest at the Grand Galloping Gala in The Best Night Ever. Has the same design as Count Caesar.

characters.name:
Security Guard
Lockdown
characters.description: A security guard who, with no mane, works for Sapphire Shores in For Whom the Sweetie Belle Toils (voiced by Brian Drummond) and, with a mane, works at the Crystal Empire in Equestria Games (voiced by Peter New), in the latter of which a version of him with a yellow tail and beard color also appears. He also appears in The Saddle Row Review, in Sparkle's Seven, and on the season 4 poster. His human counterpart appears in the Equestria Girls special Movie Magic. Shares his tail style with Cratus, Walter, "Duce Switchell", and Nightjar. His cutie mark is a padlock. He is a character called "Security Guard Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of him states, "This pony patrols in a grand coliseum -- if someone sneaks in, well, then he's bound to see 'em!"

characters.name: Locknut McColt
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as a member of the McColt family. His cutie mark is three hexagon nuts. Shares his color scheme with "Steel Bolts".

characters.name: Lucky Clover
characters.description: Lucky Clover, or Shamrock, is a male background Earth pony with a light gray coat, dark gray mane, and light blue eyes. His cutie mark, three four-leaf clovers, resembles that of a female G1 pony named Clover. He first appears in Winter Wrap Up, and has speaking roles in The Best Night Ever and A Canterlot Wedding - Part 1. The show does not name him, but he receives his name from merchandise, other media, and promotional material. Lucky Clover also shares his design with Dr. Hooves and Meadow Song, and shares his mane and tail style with Crescent Moon and Buddy.

characters.name:
Bellhop
Luggage Cart
characters.description: A hotel bellhop in Rarity Takes Manehattan who gets tipped handsomely by Rarity three times. Also appears in Viva Las Pegasus, Grannies Gone Wild, and on the season 4 poster. His cutie mark is three suitcases. Voiced by Trevor Devall in Rarity Takes Manehattan and Peter New in Grannies Gone Wild.

characters.name:
Antique Chicken Stand Pony
Match Game
characters.description: Appears as a trader of antique chicken statues at the Rainbow Falls Traders Exchange in Trade Ya!, voiced by Michael Daingerfield. His cutie mark is three white eggs. His appearance and voice are modeled after Charles Nelson Reilly.

characters.name: Matt Lauer
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan in an animated Today Show video. Represents Today Show anchor Matt Lauer. His cutie mark is the Today Show logo.

characters.name: McCree
characters.description: Appears as a spectator at the Appleloosa rodeo in Appleoosa's Most Wanted. Also appears in Buckball Season, Fame and Misfortune, Sparkle's Seven, Common Ground, The Summer Sun Setback, and Growing Up is Hard to Do.

characters.name:
Pony MC
Meadow Song
characters.description: Meadow Song is a male Earth pony who appears in several episodes throughout the series. He has a moderate brown coat, amber mane and apple green eyes. The show does not name him, only referring to him as "Working Pony" and "Pony MC" in the credits of the episodes Too Many Pinkie Pies and The Maud Couple respectively, but he receives his name from merchandise. He shares his design with Dr. Hooves and Lucky Clover, and shares his mane and tail style with Mane Moon and Buddy.

characters.name: Melilot
characters.description: Appears in Winter Wrap Up. Shares his design, eye color, and cutie mark design with Lucky Clover and S04E08 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1. His cutie mark is three brown clovers.

characters.name:
Doctor Pony
Modus Ponens
characters.description: Appears in Canterlot in Rarity Investigates! and with a mustache in A Hearth's Warming Tail. Resembles Dr. John Watson as portrayed by Martin Freeman. He is a character called "Doctor Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Moon Dust​
characters.description: Appears, sometimes cutie unmarked, in The Cutie Map - Part 1, The Cutie Map - Part 2, and a European magazine comic whose French title is Une leçon d'amitié. His cutie mark is shown in the comic.​[​specify​]​

characters.name: Morton Saltworthy
characters.description: Kicks Ol' Salt out of The Salt Block in Over a Barrel and appears again in Equestria Games. Looks very distinguished. His cutie mark is a white saltshaker with a few salt grains. The snapshot on the right features two animation errors: the floating chain that's supposed to be attached to the monocle, and the cutie mark is visible through the mustaches.

characters.name:
Father Pony
Mr. Paleo
characters.description: A family of Earth ponies consisting of patriarch Mr. Paleo, matriarch Mrs. Paleo, and filly Petunia Paleo appears in the season six episode The Fault in Our Cutie Marks. Mr. and Mrs. Paleo are unnamed in the series, credited only as "Father Pony" and "Mother Pony" respectively in The Fault in Our Cutie Marks, but they are named in other media.

characters.name: Mules Grassfield
characters.description: Appears in The Saddle Row Review as a patron in a Manehattan diner. Shares his body type with Cheese Sandwich, "Turner McColt", Dandy Grandeur, Mudbriar, "Snow Hope", S08E19 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1, and BGE Unnamed Earth Stallion #2. Resembles Samuel L. Jackson's character Jules Winnfield in the film Pulp Fiction; see also Whinnyfield. His cutie mark is a suitcase.

characters.name:
Delegate 1
Neigh Sayer
characters.description: Appears in Maretropolis in Power Ponies, in Manehattan in Rarity Takes Manehattan, Made in Manehattan, The Gift of the Maud Pie, The Saddle Row Review, Shadow Play - Part 2, Fake It 'Til You Make It, and Daring Doubt, at Rainbow Falls in Trade Ya!, at the Crystal Empire in Equestria Games, in Canterlot in Princess Spike, in Party Pooped, in Las Pegasus in Viva Las Pegasus and Grannies Gone Wild, in Ponyville in It Isn't the Mane Thing About You, in Appleloosa in Growing Up is Hard to Do, and on the season 4 poster. Also appears in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Shares his design, eye color, and cutie mark with Goldengrape and S05E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #16, shares his design, cutie mark, and partly name with Don Neigh, shares his design and cutie mark with S05E09 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1, shares his design with Noteworthy, Crusoe Palm, and Felix, and has a similar name to Chancellor Neighsay. He is a character in Gameloft's mobile game, and acts as an enemy minion during the "Fake It 'Til You Make It" boss battle event. His bio states, "This goth phase is relatively new for him: he actually looks really good in goldenrond!" His cutie mark is two bunches of green grapes. Voiced by Peter New. He is named with a trademark symbol in the twentieth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that he "& Levon Song love listening to music." Named almost the same as the song Neighsayer and as the term neighsayer.

characters.name:
Traveling Gentlecolt
Neighl Page
characters.description: Neighl Page, Real Article, and Cathy O'Mara are three Earth ponies who first appear in Hearthbreakers. They are unnamed in the show, "Neighl Page", "Real Article", and "Cathy O'Mara" being placeholder names, and are called both by their collective title Homebound Ponies and by the individual titles "Traveling Gentlecolt", "Traveling Pony", and "Traveling Mare" in another depiction.

characters.name:
Soldier
Neon Brush
characters.description: Neon Brush, Quick Trim, Comb Over, The Unconditioner, and Blow Dry are the placeholder names of five male Earth ponies, at least twenty-two of whom serve as henchponies to the Mane-iac in the comic-book universe of Maretropolis. They appear in Power Ponies and its adaptation(s) Power Ponies to the Rescue! and Power Ponies Go! They are unnamed in the show and in other depictions, one of which internally identifies Neon Brush as soldier, Quick Trim as officer, and Blow Dry as captain.

characters.name:
Astro Pony
Neptunio
characters.description: Appears in Simple Ways. Shares his color scheme with Noteworthy and S04E16 Unnamed Earth Stallion #2. His cutie mark is shown in Gameloft's mobile game, which refers to him as "Astro Pony" and gives him the in-game description "Armed with a telescope, Astro Pony's taking his love for all things in the night sky to astronomical heights!"

characters.name: Night Watch
characters.description: The Ponyville Hospital security guard pony from Read It and Weep. Also appears in Rarity's Fashion Police and on the Season 2 poster. Wears his mane in a mohawk. His cutie mark is a police badge. Voiced by Jayson Thiessen. He is named on his Enterplay collectible card game card α #35 R, which gives him the description "With all of his security experience, Night Watch could have taken a job anywhere, but he secretly loves hospital cafeteria food." He is a character in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves an an enemy minion during the "Rarity's Retro Revolution" event. The game's description of him states, "When shadows draw near, and you feel your heart race... well, this pony may well shine his light in your face."

characters.name: Noteworthy
characters.description: Noteworthy is an Earth background pony with a light blue coat, a darker blue mane, amber eyes, and a cutie mark of two pairs of sometimes-backwards-facing quavers (eighth notes). His name is not mentioned in the show, but he is named in merchandise and other media. He shares his design with Goldengrape and Crusoe Palm.

characters.name: Opulence
characters.description: Appears in Viva Las Pegasus at Gladmane's Las Pegasus resort. Also appears in Once Upon a Zeppelin, School Daze - Part 1, Grannies Gone Wild, Friendship University, Common Ground, Between Dark and Dawn, 2, 4, 6, Greaaat, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. His cutie mark is two shopping bags.

characters.name:
Method Mare 1
On Stage
characters.description: The Method Mares are a Manehattan theater troupe who appear in Made in Manehattan, consisting of Earth ponies On Stage, Raspberry Beret, Late Show, and Stardom. On Stage and Raspberry Beret are named in Horse Play, but "Late Show" and "Stardom" are unnamed, having placeholder names. They are credited in Made in Manehattan as "Method Mare 1", "Method Mare 2", "Method Mare 3", and "Method Mare 4" respectively.

characters.name: Oregon Trail
characters.description: A pony seen in Family Appreciation Day, both in Granny Smith's sepia memory and queuing up in the present day for zap apple jam. Also appears several times in the line for the Apples' cider in The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000 and in flashback in No Second Prances. Shares his body type, tail style, and cutie mark with S04E07 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1 and his color scheme and cutie mark with S05E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #13. His cutie mark is a wheel.

characters.name:
Cotton Candy Colt
Papa Beard
characters.description: Appears in Newbie Dash as a cotton candy vendor. His cutie mark is a stick of cotton candy. He is a character called "Cotton Candy Colt" in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of him states, "Happy to hand out sweet treats for any occasion."

characters.name: Parcel Post
characters.description: Parcel Post is a male Earth pony who appears in the series as a mail delivery pony and a beekeeper. He has a light brown coat, a moderate brown mane and tail, blue eyes, and a cutie mark of a stamp with a heart on it. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named in merchandise.

characters.name: Parish Nandermane
characters.description: Parish Nandermane is a male background Earth pony who appears in several episodes, Gameloft's mobile game, and the IDW comics. He has an indigo coat, bright blue mane and tail, green eyes, and a cutie mark of a lyre. He is not named in the series, but he is named in other media.

characters.name:
Lead Singer Pony
Paul McCartneigh
characters.description: Appears in five photographs and at the friendship party in Party Pooped. Also appears in a photograph in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Resembles Paul McCartney of the Beatles. His cutie mark is a yellow submarine. He is a character called "Lead Singer Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Perfect Pace
characters.description: Perfect Pace is a male background Earth pony with a blue coat, bright orange mane and tail, golden brown eyes, and a cutie mark of an hourglass. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Persnickety
characters.description: Appears in Hearts and Hooves Day during the song The Perfect Stallion while the Cutie Mark Crusaders are looking for a special somepony for Cheerilee. Apple Bloom sings that he's "way too uptight." Shares his coat and mane colors and tail with Prince Blueblood, and shares his cutie mark with "Chocolate Sun". He is voiced by Peter New.

characters.name:
Henchpony
Pickpocket
characters.description: Biff, Rogue, Withers, Pickpocket, and Rosy Thorn are five ponies who appear as henchponies to Dr. Caballeron. The former three first appear in Daring Don't, "Pickpocket" first appears in Stranger Than Fan Fiction, and Rosy Thorn appears in chapter books. "Pickpocket" is unnamed in the series, his name being a placeholder name, but Biff, Rogue, and Withers are named in Daring Doubt, chapter books, and Tails of Equestria, and Biff and Rogue are also named in merchandise.

characters.name:
Cubist Pony
Picture Pattern
characters.description: Appears in On Your Marks painting a portrait of Tree Hugger. Resembles Pablo Picasso, though Pinto-Picasso is earlier mentioned by Praiser Pan to be deceased in My Little Pony Micro-Series Issue #4; Picasso is mentioned by Timber Spruce in My Little Pony Equestria Girls: Legend of Everfree. His cutie mark is three blocks - one red, one green, and one blue. He is a character called "Cubist Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name:
Messy Stallion
Pigpen
characters.description: Appears in Hearts and Hooves Day during the song The Perfect Stallion while the Cutie Mark Crusaders are looking for a special somepony for Cheerilee. Scootaloo sings that he's "too smelly." His cutie mark is a trash can. He is a character called "Messy Stallion" in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of him states, "Just 'cause he's all covered in dirt, grime, and mud doesn't mean that his love life HAS to be a dud!"

characters.name: Pine Breeze
characters.description: Makes an appearance as a gardener in The Mysterious Mare Do Well and briefly addresses Rainbow Dash. His cutie mark is three conifers. Similar in design to "Shamrock".

characters.name: Pink Drink
characters.description: Appears with a light amaranth coat at the Crystal Empire in Equestria Games and with a light gray coat in Canterlot in Twilight's Kingdom - Part 2. Shares his design with Noteworthy, Goldengrape, Crusoe Palm, "Welch", Apple Cinnamon, Felix, Neigh Sayer, Red Delicious, and Don Neigh. His cutie mark is a teacup.

characters.name: Pokerhooves
characters.description: Appears as a spectator at the Appleloosa rodeo in Appleoosa's Most Wanted. Also appears in Buckball Season, Sparkle's Seven, The Summer Sun Setback, and Growing Up is Hard to Do. Resembles Issue 09 Unnamed Mare - Spade in coat color and cutie mark. His cutie mark is a black spade. Voiced by Michael Daingerfield.

characters.name: Potion Hiss
characters.description: Appears in A Rockhoof and a Hard Place buying potions from Mage Meadowbrook. His cutie mark is a snake.

characters.name: Prance Jillette
characters.description: Appears in Viva Las Pegasus at Gladmane's Las Pegasus resort. Also appears in Grannies Gone Wild, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Bears a resemblance to Penn Jillette.

characters.name: Prancent Pega
characters.description: Appears in The Saddle Row Review as a patron in a Manehattan diner. Resembles John Travolta's character Vincent Vega in the film Pulp Fiction; see also Vinny. His cutie mark is a hamburger.

characters.name:
Clumsy Clownspony
Pratfall
characters.description: One of the rodeo clowns in Appleoosa's Most Wanted. He is a character called "Clumsy Clownspony" in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of him states, "Clumsy Clownspony is a purple pony who is ready to be your pal!"

characters.name:
Cabbie
Pronto
characters.description: A taxi carriage puller in Maretropolis in Power Ponies and in Manehattan in Rarity Takes Manehattan who transports Rarity to Fashion Week after she fixes his carriage wheel in the latter episode. Also appears on the season 4 poster. Resembles Flash Sentry. His cutie mark is a checkerboard shield. Voiced by Brian Drummond.

characters.name: Quarter Hearts
characters.description: Appears in Flutter Brutter pulling a cart of gems through Ponyville. Resembles Link from The Legend of Zelda. His cutie mark is a three-quarters-full Heart Container.

characters.name:
Officer
Quick Trim
characters.description: Neon Brush, Quick Trim, Comb Over, The Unconditioner, and Blow Dry are the placeholder names of five male Earth ponies, at least twenty-two of whom serve as henchponies to the Mane-iac in the comic-book universe of Maretropolis. They appear in Power Ponies and its adaptation(s) Power Ponies to the Rescue! and Power Ponies Go! They are unnamed in the show and in other depictions, one of which internally identifies Neon Brush as soldier, Quick Trim as officer, and Blow Dry as captain.

characters.name: Raggedy Doctor
characters.description: Guest at the garden party in Sweet and Elite. His cutie mark is an hourglass. In early December 2011, Sabrina Alberghetti was asked "[link] Is this pony supposed to look like the 11th Doctor, or is it just a lucky coincidence of background ponies matching up?" and answered "it's just a re-use I'm sure. Like I said earlier, there's only so many designs and cutie marks to go around, so inevitably duplicates and combos will pop up." A WeLoveFine.com T-shirt titled "9 10 11" numbers him XI of "THE DOCTORS", with Dr. Hooves numbered X and another Earth pony stallion numbered IX. "Ponies Are Cool" companions him with Sea Swirl.

characters.name: Ragtime
characters.description: Plays the piano in Luna Eclipsed, dressed as a rag doll or scarecrow. Also appeared on Hasbro's former Pony Wedding microsite and appears in an October 31, 2013 promotional image. Usually shares the same tail style, cutie mark design, and stool design as Frederick Horseshoepin. His cutie mark is a pair of joined quavers (music notes).

characters.name:
Traveling Pony
Real Article
characters.description: Neighl Page, Real Article, and Cathy O'Mara are three Earth ponies who first appear in Hearthbreakers. They are unnamed in the show, "Neighl Page", "Real Article", and "Cathy O'Mara" being placeholder names, and are called both by their collective title Homebound Ponies and by the individual titles "Traveling Gentlecolt", "Traveling Pony", and "Traveling Mare" in another depiction.

characters.name: Rivet
characters.description: Rivet is the placeholder name of a male pony who appears usually as an Earth pony and occasionally as a Pegasus. He has a light brown coat, brown mane and tail, and blue eyes. His cutie mark is a hammer and two nails in most appearances, is a shield in two appearances, and is three raindrops in one appearance. He has a speaking role in the episodes The Mysterious Mare Do Well, Equestria Games, and Made in Manehattan.

characters.name: Roger Silvermane
characters.description: The Mad Men ponies[1] are six background Earth and/or unicorn ponies designed to resemble some of the cast of the AMC drama television series Mad Men, including Business Savvy, Pegasus Olsen, Joan Pommelway, Roger Silvermane, Pete Canterbell, and Bronco Benson. They are gradually introduced in the IDW comics' My Little Pony Micro-Series Issue #8 and in the episodes Rarity Takes Manehattan and Made in Manehattan, and most of them are often depicted in episodes taking place in Manehattan, where at least one or two of them live.[2][3][4][5]​[​dubious – discuss‍​]​ Most are unnamed in the series, "Pete Canterbell" and "Bronco Benson" being placeholder names, but Business Savvy, Pegasus Olsen, Joan Pommelway, and Roger Silvermane are named in merchandise.

characters.name:
Caballeron's Brigand
Rogue
characters.description: Biff, Rogue, Withers, Pickpocket, and Rosy Thorn are five ponies who appear as henchponies to Dr. Caballeron. The former three first appear in Daring Don't, "Pickpocket" first appears in Stranger Than Fan Fiction, and Rosy Thorn appears in chapter books. "Pickpocket" is unnamed in the series, his name being a placeholder name, but Biff, Rogue, and Withers are named in Daring Doubt, chapter books, and Tails of Equestria, and Biff and Rogue are also named in merchandise.

characters.name: Rough Tumble
characters.description: Rainbow Dash's 'roommate' in Read It and Weep. Practically mummified by his bandages. Shares his color scheme with Berryshine. He is featured on Enterplay collectible card game card α #148 U, Too Many Bandages, which attributes to Rough Tumble the quote "But it's just a scratch!"

characters.name: Royal Riff
characters.description: Royal Riff is a male Earth pony with a light purple coat, white mane and tail, orange eyes, and a cutie mark of two white G-clefs. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named in merchandise and other media. He has a speaking role in Putting Your Hoof Down.

characters.name:
Surrealist Pony
Saddledor Dali
characters.description: Appears in On Your Marks painting a portrait of Tree Hugger. Also appears in Friendship University. Resembles Salvador Dalí. His cutie mark is a melting clock. He is a character called "Surrealist Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Savoir Fare
characters.description: Savoir Fare, or Horte Cuisine, is a male Earth pony waiter with a pale cream coat, a two-tone blue mane and tail, brown eyes, and a cutie mark of a serving dish with a silver cover. He is not named in the show, being called simply "Waiter" in the credits of the season five episode Slice of Life, but he is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Sealed Scroll
characters.description: Sealed Scroll is one of the four most frequently appearing high society ponies, along with Lyrica Lilac, Count Caesar, and Royal Ribbon. He has a brown coat, a wheat-colored mane, gold eyes, and a scroll cutie mark. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named in merchandise. He shares his design with "Cobalt", "Charlie Coal", "Hercules", and "Affero", and he has a similar color scheme to "Dumb-Bell".

characters.name: Seedsman Hooffield
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as a member of the Hooffield family. His cutie mark is a watering can.

characters.name: Shamrock
characters.description: Lucky Clover, or Shamrock, is a male background Earth pony with a light gray coat, dark gray mane, and light blue eyes. His cutie mark, three four-leaf clovers, resembles that of a female G1 pony named Clover. He first appears in Winter Wrap Up, and has speaking roles in The Best Night Ever and A Canterlot Wedding - Part 1. The show does not name him, but he receives his name from merchandise, other media, and promotional material. Lucky Clover also shares his design with Dr. Hooves and Meadow Song, and shares his mane and tail style with Crescent Moon and Buddy.

characters.name: Shiny Pear
characters.description: Appears in flashback in The Perfect Pear as a member of the Pear family. His cutie mark is a shiny pear.

characters.name: Shooting Star
characters.description: Shooting Star is a male background pony with a white coat, light blue mane, tail, and eyes, and a cutie mark of a dark blue Orion constellation. He is an Earth pony both in some in-show appearances and in merchandise, while he is a unicorn both in some in-show appearances and in other media. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Shortround
characters.description: Appears in Hearts and Hooves Day during the song The Perfect Stallion while the Cutie Mark Crusaders are looking for a special somepony for Cheerilee. Apple Bloom sings that he's "too short." His cutie mark is a step ladder.

characters.name: Sir Pony Moore
characters.description: Sir Pony Moore is the placeholder name of a male background Earth pony with a bluish gray coat, dark gray mane and tail, blue eyes, and a cutie mark of three white stars.

characters.name: Slate Sentiments
characters.description: Appears in School Daze - Part 1, School Daze - Part 2, the seventh version of the remastered opening sequence, The Parent Map, Non-Compete Clause, Molt Down, Marks for Effort, A Matter of Principals, A Rockhoof and a Hard Place, What Lies Beneath, School Raze - Part 1, School Raze - Part 2, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, She's All Yak, 2, 4, 6, Greaaat, A Horse Shoe-In, Daring Doubt, The Ending of the End - Part 2, and MLP8_Promo_Image_with_Copyright as a student at the School of Friendship. Shares his design and eye color with S07E18 Unnamed Unicorn Stallion #2. His cutie mark is a scroll.

characters.name: Slate Stone
characters.description: Appears in The Cart Before the Ponies as an Applewood Derby spectator. His cutie mark appears to be a pickaxe.

characters.name: Slendermane
characters.description: A mysterious figure in the background for a few frames in Pinkie Apple Pie and on Enterplay collectible card game Absolute Discord expansion set cards #-3 U of him and #70 C of Flitter. He wears a dark suit with a tie. [1]​[​specify​]​

characters.name: Smokestack
characters.description: This stallion stands in front of and latched to a stagecoach in Over a Barrel. Also appears in Made in Manehattan and The Gift of the Maud Pie as a cabbie. His design resembles that of the train-and-carriage-pulling ponies from Over a Barrel, The Last Roundup, Party Pooped, etc.

characters.name:
Trendy Hype Pony
Smooth Vibes
characters.description: Appears in Hard to Say Anything as one of Feather Bangs' backup dancers during Battle for Sugar Belle. He is a character called "Trendy Hype Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game. His cutie mark is a gold eye and crown.

characters.name:
Goth Shopper
Snow Hope
characters.description: Appears in Fake It 'Til You Make It as a customer at Rarity For You. Shares his body type and eye color with "Turner McColt", Dandy Grandeur, S08E19 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1, and BGE Unnamed Earth Stallion #2 and his body type with Cheese Sandwich, "Mules Grassfield", and Mudbriar. He is a character named "Goth Shopper" in Gameloft's mobile game. His bio states, "Jet black is the only color that truly encapsulates the torment in his soul." His cutie mark is a snowflake. Voiced by Ian Hanlin.

characters.name: Sour Drops
characters.description: Appears as a spectator at the Appleloosa rodeo in Appleoosa's Most Wanted. Also appears in Buckball Season and Growing Up is Hard to Do. Shares his design, eye color, and cutie mark with Caramel, Upper East Stride, "Strawberry Cream", S05E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #8, and S05E10 Unnamed Earth Stallion #4. Has a similar color scheme to Sweetie Drops and Honeysparkle. His cutie mark is three blue horseshoes.

characters.name: Sourpuss
characters.description: Appears in Rarity Takes Manehattan and on the season 4 poster. Shares his design and eye color with S04E08 Unnamed Earth Stallion #3. His cutie mark is of Grumpy Cat. According to Jim Miller, Rebecca Dart designed this "as a joke thinking Hasbro would laugh but as[sic] us to change it. They didn't!"

characters.name: Sprig Hooffield
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as a member of the Hooffield family. Has the same body type and facial hair style as "Vermilion Spring", the same body type as Chancellor Neighsay, and a similar body type to Trenderhoof, "Free Throw", "Natural Deduction", "Uptown Clover", "Mustafa Combe", and S06E17 Unnamed Earth Stallion #6. His cutie mark is a leaf sprout.

characters.name: Squeaky Clean
characters.description: Appears in Hearts and Hooves Day during the song The Perfect Stallion while the Cutie Mark Crusaders are looking for a special somepony for Cheerilee. Apple Bloom sings that he's "too clean."

characters.name: Star Gazer
characters.description: Star Gazer is placeholder name of a male background Earth pony with a light gray coat, brown mane and tail, gold eyes, and a cutie mark of a blue telescope with a white star. He has a speaking role in the episode For Whom the Sweetie Belle Toils.

characters.name:
Junior Deputy
Star Spur
characters.description: Junior deputy Star Spur and senior deputy Fetter Keys are Sheriff Silverstar's deputy sheriffs in Appleoosa's Most Wanted. Star Spur has a bluish gray coat, two-tone black mane and tail, blue eyes, and a cutie mark of a blue star and white shooting star. Fetter Keys has a yellow coat, orange mane and tail, green eyes, and a cutie mark of a key ring. They are unnamed in the show, "Fetter Keys" being a placeholder name, but they are named varyingly in merchandise and other depictions.

characters.name: Steel Bolts
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as a member of the McColt family. His cutie mark is three bolts. Shares his color scheme with "Locknut McColt". Voiced by Ian Hanlin.

characters.name: Steel Wright
characters.description: Appears once during Applejack's flashback in The Cutie Mark Chronicles, walking along a Manehattan street at night. Resembles Tall Order, "Brindle Young", "All Aboard", Karat, and S05E12 Unnamed Unicorn Stallion #1.

characters.name:
Trendy Backup Dancer
Stereo Mix
characters.description: Appears in Hard to Say Anything as one of Feather Bangs' backup dancers during Battle for Sugar Belle. He is a character called "Trendy Backup Dancer" in Gameloft's mobile game. His cutie mark is a boombox.

characters.name: Strawberry Cream
characters.description: Stands underneath a parasol and across from Golden Harvest during the song The Perfect Stallion in Hearts and Hooves Day. Shares the design, eye color, and cutie mark of Caramel, Upper East Stride, S05E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #8, "Sour Drops", and S05E10 Unnamed Earth Stallion #4, the design and mane color of "Gingerbread", and the mane style and mane color of Starburst. His cutie mark is three blue horseshoes.

characters.name:
Pouch Pony
Street Rat
characters.description: Appears in The Gift of the Maud Pie trading a rock pouch for Pinkie Pie's party cannon. His cutie mark is six gold bits. Shares his body model with Gizmo, "Burdock Hooffield", "Spiral Notepad", "Ginger Locks", and S09E22 Unnamed Earth Stallion #2. Voiced by James Higuchi.

characters.name:
Expressive Townspony
Sunny Song
characters.description: Appears, sometimes cutie unmarked, in The Cutie Map - Part 1, The Cutie Map - Part 2, To Where and Back Again - Part 1, To Where and Back Again - Part 2, Hard to Say Anything, and a European magazine comic whose French title is Une leçon d'amitié. Shares his design with B. Sharp and his normal cutie mark with S05E12 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1. His cutie mark normally is a microphone and musical notes and abnormally is shown in the comic.​[​specify​]​ He is a character called "Expressive Townspony" in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of him states, "'Equal' no longer, this pony is free! To be who -- or whatever -- he wants to be!"

characters.name: Swanky Hank
characters.description: One of the Fashion Week competitors in Rarity Takes Manehattan. Also appears in Equestria Games, The Gift of the Maud Pie, She's All Yak, and My Little Pony: Ponyville Mysteries Issue #5 page 7. Shares his mane and tail style with "Sugar Maple". His cutie mark is three wire hangers. He is named with a trademark symbol in the eleventh wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that he "always tries to look his best!" A second mini-figure toy of him is included in the twentieth wave, Swanky Hank's collector card of which states that he "& Upper East Stride wear chic and classy fashions." Gillian M. Berrow joked in an August 25, 2017 Twitter conversation, "My next book is on Smanky[sic] Hank!"

characters.name: Tall Order
characters.description: Tall Order is a male background Earth pony with a gray (sometimes brown) coat, two-tone pale blue mane and tail, gold eyes, and a varyingly-colored cutie mark of a scroll. He has a speaking role in the season one episode The Cutie Mark Chronicles.

characters.name: Tall Tale
characters.description: Appears in Hearts and Hooves Day during the song The Perfect Stallion while the Cutie Mark Crusaders are looking for a special somepony for Cheerilee. Sweetie Belle sings that he's "too tall." Has a similar color scheme to Warm Front, S06E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1, Officer Hard Case, and Unnamed Boy #12. He is named on his Enterplay collectible card game The Crystal Games expansion set card #30 U, which identifies him as an Earth pony and lists the quote "After about the hundredth time somepony asks you what the weather is like up here, the joke kinda wears thin." Named the same as a town in northwest Equestria.

characters.name: Tatterdemalion Hooffield
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as a member of the Hooffield family. Also appears in Between Dark and Dawn. His cutie mark is a cloud.

characters.name: Temple Chant
characters.description: Appears at the Fortress of Talacon in Daring Don't, near the end of the episode. Shares his design, mane and eye colors, and cutie mark design with S04E04 Unnamed Earth Stallion #4, his design, eye color, and cutie mark with S04E04 Unnamed Earth Stallion #12 and S04E04 Unnamed Earth Stallion #3, his design, eye color, and cutie mark design with S04E04 Unnamed Earth Stallion #7, and his design and eye color with S04E04 Unnamed Earth Stallion #15.

characters.name: Theodore Donald "Donny" Kerabatsos
characters.description: Theodore Donald "Donny" Kerabatsos is the placeholder name of a male Earth pony who appears in the episodes The Cutie Pox, Leap of Faith, and Slice of Life, and in the IDW comics. He has a pale yellow coat, dark brown mane and tail, orange eyes, and a cutie mark of a bowling ball and two bowling pins.

characters.name:
Big Stallion
Tight End
characters.description: Appears in Grannies Gone Wild at Flim and Flam's Las Pegasus resort. His cutie mark is an American football with orange streak behind it and yellow star. Voiced by Peter New.

characters.name: Trendy Coiffure
characters.description: Appears in Stranger Than Fan Fiction managing a booth at the Daring Do Convention. Also appears in Once Upon a Zeppelin and Grannies Gone Wild. His cutie mark is two hearts and a comb.

characters.name: Turner McColt
characters.description: Appears in The Hooffields and McColts as a member of the McColt family. Shares his body type and eye color with Dandy Grandeur, "Snow Hope", S08E19 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1, and BGE Unnamed Earth Stallion #2 and his body type with Cheese Sandwich, "Mules Grassfield", and Mudbriar. His cutie mark is a tuning fork.

characters.name: Turquoise Harp
characters.description: Appears as a spectator at the Appleloosa rodeo in Appleoosa's Most Wanted. Also appears in Buckball Season and Growing Up is Hard to Do. Has a similar coat and mane color to Lyra Heartstrings and "Skyra".

characters.name: Twilight Sky
characters.description: Twilight Sky is a male background pony with a medium gray coat, light blue mane and tail, blue eyes, and a cutie mark of three white stars. He is an Earth pony both in few in-show appearances and in all merchandise, while he is a Pegasus in most in-show appearances. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named in merchandise.

characters.name: Two Ton
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan in The Gift of the Maud Pie. Shares his body design with Bulk Biceps, "Mama Biceps", and partly "Big Bell" and Issue 13 Unnamed Stallion - Arrowed Heart. His cutie mark is a chain and cinder block.

characters.name:
Curio Shopkeeper
Uncle Wing
characters.description: Shopkeeper of a Canterlot alley curio shop. At the beginning of Magic Duel, Trixie convinces him to sell her the Alicorn Amulet for a sack of bits. Voiced by Lee Tockar. He is a playable character in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves as a boss during the "Rarity's Retro Revolution" event. His bio states, "If it's odds and ends that you need, Curio Shopkeeper is your steed!"

characters.name: The Unconditioner
characters.description: Neon Brush, Quick Trim, Comb Over, The Unconditioner, and Blow Dry are the placeholder names of five male Earth ponies, at least twenty-two of whom serve as henchponies to the Mane-iac in the comic-book universe of Maretropolis. They appear in Power Ponies and its adaptation(s) Power Ponies to the Rescue! and Power Ponies Go! They are unnamed in the show and in other depictions, one of which internally identifies Neon Brush as soldier, Quick Trim as officer, and Blow Dry as captain.

characters.name: Upper East Stride
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan in Rarity Takes Manehattan, at the Crystal Empire in Equestria Games, and in Manehattan again in Made in Manehattan, The Gift of the Maud Pie, and The Saddle Row Review. Shares his design, eye color, and cutie mark with Caramel, "Strawberry Cream", S05E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #8, "Sour Drops", and S05E10 Unnamed Earth Stallion #4, shares his design and coat and eye colors with S05E12 Unnamed Earth Stallion #2, shares his design, eye color, and cutie mark design with BeauDe Mane, and shares his design with Cherry Fizzy, Royal Riff, S01E02 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1, and S01E26 Unnamed Earth Stallion #3. His cutie mark is three blue horseshoes. He is named with a trademark symbol in the twentieth wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which states that he "& BeauDe Mane wear fun and fancy ties."

characters.name:
Business Pony
Uptown Clover
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan in Made in Manehattan and The Gift of the Maud Pie. Also appears in A Royal Problem and Fake It 'Til You Make It. Has the same body type and eye color as Trenderhoof, "Free Throw", and S06E17 Unnamed Earth Stallion #6, the same body type as "Natural Deduction" and "Mustafa Combe", and a similar body type to "Sprig Hooffield", "Vermilion Spring", and Chancellor Neighsay. Voiced by Colin Murdock.

characters.name: Vegemite
characters.description: Appears in The Gift of the Maud Pie as a passenger on the Friendship Express. Also appears in Buckball Season, The Parent Map, and Growing Up is Hard to Do. His cutie mark is a jar and butter knife. Not a Jim Miller OC.

characters.name: Vellum Codex
characters.description: Appears in School Daze - Part 1, School Daze - Part 2, the seventh version of the remastered opening sequence, Non-Compete Clause, Molt Down, Marks for Effort, A Matter of Principals, Friendship University, The End in Friend, Road to Friendship, A Rockhoof and a Hard Place, What Lies Beneath, School Raze - Part 1, School Raze - Part 2, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, The Beginning of the End - Part 2, She's All Yak, 2, 4, 6, Greaaat, The Summer Sun Setback, A Horse Shoe-In, The Ending of the End - Part 1, The Ending of the End - Part 2, Teacher of the Month, Starlight the Hypnotist, and MLP8_Promo_Image_with_Copyright as a student at the School of Friendship. Shares his design and coat color with S08E09 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1. His cutie mark is a scroll.

characters.name: Vermilion Spring
characters.description: Appears in A Royal Problem as one of three delegate ponies at Princess Luna's luncheon. Has the same body type and facial hair style as "Sprig Hooffield", the same body type as Chancellor Neighsay, and a similar body type to Trenderhoof, "Free Throw", "Natural Deduction", "Uptown Clover", "Mustafa Combe", and S06E17 Unnamed Earth Stallion #6.

characters.name: Wacky Hair Day and Spray
characters.description: A small portion of him appears in Rarity's show behind Spike in Suited For Success. Somewhat resembles Mayor Baltimare.

characters.name:
Bowling Pony
Walter
characters.description: Walter is a male Earth pony who appears in the episodes The Cutie Pox and Slice of Life, dressed differently in each, and in the IDW comics, with a speaking role in Ponyville Days. He is unnamed in the show, but he is named variously in merchandise and other media.

characters.name:
M.C. Pony
Waxton
characters.description: Appears in Manehattan in Made in Manehattan, sometimes as a unicorn in The Gift of the Maud Pie, and with a speaking role in The Saddle Row Review. His cutie mark is a microphone. His unicorn version is a character called "M.C. Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game, who serves as a boss battle helper during the "Rarity's Retro Revolution" evene.

characters.name: Welch / Cloudy Haze
characters.description: A pony who appears in Friendship is Magic, part 2, in the crowd at Applejack's prize pony ceremony in Applebuck Season, in Boast Busters, in Winter Wrap Up, in the crowd at the first fashion show in Suited For Success, in The Show Stoppers, in The Cutie Mark Chronicles, in The Mysterious Mare Do Well, singing in The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000, attending the funeral in Hearts and Hooves Day, in A Friend in Deed, in A Canterlot Wedding - Part 2, watching the Crystal Faire jousting match between Rainbow Dash and Fluttershy at the Crystal Empire in The Crystal Empire - Part 2, in Magic Duel, in Princess Twilight Sparkle - Part 2, in Simple Ways, in It Ain't Easy Being Breezies, in Leap of Faith, in Trade Ya!, in Equestria Games, and in Honest Apple. He shares his design with Crusoe Palm, Goldengrape, and Noteworthy. His cutie mark is two bunches of purple grapes.

characters.name: Wetzel
characters.description: Appears in Rarity Takes Manehattan as a food cart vendor. His cutie mark is three pretzels.

characters.name: White Marble
characters.description: Appears, cutie unmarked, in The Cutie Map - Part 1 and The Cutie Map - Part 2.

characters.name: Wisp
characters.description: Wisp is the placeholder name of a male Earth pony with a light yellow coat, light blue mane and tail, blue eyes, and sometimes a cutie mark usually of two bunches of green grapes. In Rarity Takes Manehattan, he appears as a Pegasus pony.

characters.name:
Caballeron's Thug
Withers
characters.description: Biff, Rogue, Withers, Pickpocket, and Rosy Thorn are five ponies who appear as henchponies to Dr. Caballeron. The former three first appear in Daring Don't, "Pickpocket" first appears in Stranger Than Fan Fiction, and Rosy Thorn appears in chapter books. "Pickpocket" is unnamed in the series, his name being a placeholder name, but Biff, Rogue, and Withers are named in Daring Doubt, chapter books, and Tails of Equestria, and Biff and Rogue are also named in merchandise.

characters.name:
Violist Pony
Wolfgang Canter
characters.description: Part of the orchestra in Sweet and Elite and after getting switched from S04E16 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1 in Inspiration Manifestation. He is named in the twenty-second wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards. The collector card states about Wolfgang Canter, "He listens to music with friends." He is a character called "Violist Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves as a boss battle helper during the "Rarity's Retro Revolution" event. The game's description of him states, "A recognized master of the alto clef: If music was cooking, then he'd be a great chef!" His cutie mark is a yellow double quaver.

characters.name: Wylin Slobinzki
characters.description: Appears in The Gift of the Maud Pie in an upper-story Manehattan window. Shares his body style and eye color with Rogue, "Real Article", and S05E16 Unnamed Earth Stallion #17.

characters.name: Mr. Zippy
characters.description: An apparently very short-sighted pony who is put in his place by "New Fluttershy" when he delivers the wrong mail to her cottage in Putting Your Hoof Down. He later appears without glasses in Magical Mystery Cure and on the IDW comics' Friendship is Magic Issue #30 page 6.

characters.name: Amethyst Star
characters.description: Amethyst Star is a female unicorn with a pink coat, a violet mane and tail with a floral lavender streak, amethyst eyes, and a cutie mark of three brilliant-cut diamonds. She shares her design with Lyra Heartstrings, Diamond Mint, and Lemony Gem, shares her mane and tail style with Rose and Silverspeed, and shares her tail style with Royal Ribbon. She has speaking roles in The Mysterious Mare Do Well, Slice of Life, and the German version of The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000.

characters.name: Apple Bloom
characters.description: Apple Bloom is a female school-age Earth pony and a member of the Apple family. She is the younger sister of Applejack and Big McIntosh and granddaughter of Granny Smith. Apple Bloom is one of the founding members of the Cutie Mark Crusaders, a club/"secret" society devoted to helping ponies earn their cutie marks, along with Sweetie Belle and Scootaloo. She is varyingly called Apple Blossom and Apple Boom in some other media and promotional material.

characters.name: Apple Rose
characters.description: Apple Rose is an elderly Earth pony and a member of the Apple family who first appears in the season three episode Apple Family Reunion. She is Granny Smith's favorite cousin.

characters.name: Aquamarine
characters.description: See "Aquamarine".

characters.name: Auntie Applesauce
characters.description: Auntie Applesauce is an elderly Earth pony and a member of the Apple family who first appears in the season three episode Apple Family Reunion. She is the great-grandaunt of Applejack and her siblings and Granny Smith's aunt.

characters.name: Blueberry Frosting
characters.description: See Blueberry Frosting.

characters.name: Boysenberry
characters.description: See "Boysenberry".

characters.name: Charm
characters.description: Charm is the placeholder name of a female unicorn with a lavender coat, violet mane and tail, and fuchsia pink eyes. Her cutie mark is unknown.

characters.name: Chelsea Porcelain
characters.description: Chelsea Porcelain is the placeholder name of an elderly female Earth pony with a pale purple coat, bluish gray mane and tail, purple eyes, and a cutie mark of a tea set.

characters.name: Cloud Kicker
characters.description: Cloud Kicker is a female Pegasus pony with a lavender blue coat, jasmine mane and tail with a lemon chiffon streak, orchid eyes and a cutie mark of a cloud covering a sun. She shares her design with Merry May, shares her mane style with Lily Valley, and bears a resemblance to "Cloudy Kicks", "Lavender Lace", and Lily Blossom. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Derpy
characters.description: Derpy, also known as Muffins and Ditzy Doo, is a female Pegasus pony who was given the name Derpy Hooves by the show's internet following due to her cross-eyed "derpy" expression in the first episode. The name has since been adopted by the crew and Hasbro. Starting with Feeling Pinkie Keen, the show's crew began giving the pony crossed eyes intentionally and later gave her "Where's Waldo" type cameo appearances as a nod to the fans. The character is addressed by Rainbow Dash in The Last Roundup as Derpy, where she speaks for the first time. The scene was later altered so Rainbow no longer names Derpy, in addition to her voice being altered and eyes being less crossed. She is called Bubbly Mare or Party Filly, among various others, in some merchandise, and she is called Lazy Fan in some other media. She shares her design with Sunshower Raindrops.

characters.name: Diamond Mint
characters.description: Diamond Mint, or Mint Jewelup, is a female unicorn pony with a light blue coat, an indigo mane and tail with a streak of pale purple, indigo eyes, and a cutie mark of three brilliant-cut diamonds. She is not named in the show, but she is named "Diamond Mint" with a trademark symbol and "Mint Jewelup" in different merchandise.

characters.name: Diamond Tiara
characters.description: Diamond Tiara is a female school-age Earth pony and minor antagonist who first appears in Call of the Cutie. She and Silver Spoon are classmates of the Cutie Mark Crusaders. She is called Diamond Dazzle Tiara in some merchandise.

characters.name: Drizzle
characters.description: Drizzle is the placeholder name of a female background Pegasus pony with a pale purple coat, sandy yellow mane and tail, pink eyes, and a cutie mark of three purple umbrellas. She has a brief speaking role in The Ticket Master.

characters.name: Fine Line
characters.description: Fine Line is a female background unicorn pony with a light yellow coat, brown mane and tail, and blue eyes. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Fluttershy
characters.description: Fluttershy is a female Pegasus pony and one of the main characters of My Little Pony Friendship is Magic. She lives in a small cottage near the Everfree Forest and takes care of animals, the most prominent of her charges being Angel the bunny. She represents the element of kindness.

characters.name: Goldie Delicious
characters.description: Goldie Delicious is a relative of the Apple family introduced in Pinkie Apple Pie. She keeps a number of cats and she is shown to be a hoarder of items and heirlooms.

characters.name: Granny Smith
characters.description: Granny Smith is an elderly Earth pony. She is Applejack, Apple Bloom, and Big McIntosh's paternal grandmother and a recurring character in the series. Like nearly all of the Apple family's cutie marks, hers is an apple based product, in this case a pie.

characters.name: Helia
characters.description: Helia is a female Pegasus pony with a light blue coat, a golden mane and tail with bright yellow highlights, blue eyes, and a cutie mark of a sunflower. She is not named in the show, but she is named in merchandise. In The Crystal Empire - Part 2, she appears as an Earth pony.

characters.name: Juniper Montage
characters.description: Juniper Montage is a female human who appears as the main antagonist of the Equestria Girls half-hour specials Movie Magic and Mirror Magic. She is an usher at the Canterlot Mall movie theater and a former gofer on her uncle Canter Zoom's movie studio set.

characters.name: Lavender Sunrise
characters.description: See Lavender Sunrise.

characters.name: Lemon Hearts
characters.description: Lemon Hearts is a female unicorn pony with a yellow coat, a cerulean mane and tail with a lighter tail streak, raspberry eyes, and a cutie mark of three hearts; two light blue and one light green. She has speaking roles in several episodes, beginning with Green Isn't Your Color, and in the IDW comics and chapter books.

characters.name: Lemony Gem
characters.description: Lemony Gem, or Lemony Gems, is a female unicorn pony with a yellow coat, an aqua mane and tail with a streak of darker aqua, cerulean eyes, and a cutie mark of three brilliant-cut diamonds. She is not named in the show, but she is named "Lemony Gem" sometimes with a trademark symbol and "Lemony Gems" in different merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Little Red
characters.description: See "Little Red".

characters.name: Love Sketch
characters.description: See Love Sketch.

characters.name: Lyra Heartstrings
characters.description: Lyra Heartstrings, occasionally called simply either Lyra or Heartstrings, is a female unicorn pony who frequently appears as a background character and occasionally in more prominent roles. She has a magic mint coat, brilliant cyan mane and tail with a white streak, sunglow eyes, and a cutie mark of a lyre. The word "heartstrings" refers to deep feelings of love or compassion and is commonly used in the phrase "tug at the heartstrings" which means to cause strong feelings of affection or sympathy.

characters.name: Merry May
characters.description: Merry May is a female Pegasus pony with a spring bud coat, plum mane and tail with a lavender pink streak, amaranth pink eyes, and a cutie mark of three suns. She has not been named in the show, but she has a name in merchandise. She is identical to Sunny Rays apart from her coat color, shares her design with Cloud Kicker, and shares her mane style with Lily Valley.

characters.name: Minuette
characters.description: Minuette is a female unicorn pony with a Maya blue coat, periwinkle mane and tail with a pigment blue streak, dark blue eyes, and a cutie mark of an hourglass. She has speaking roles in several episodes, beginning with A Canterlot Wedding - Part 1, and in the IDW comics and chapter books.

characters.name: Orange Swirl
characters.description: Orange Swirl, or Dizzy Twister, is a female Pegasus pony with a light khaki coat, a pink mane and tail with a light pink streak, fuchsia rose eyes, and a cutie mark of three tornadoes. She is unnamed in the show, but she is named in merchandise. She is identical to Sugar Twist apart from her mane colors, and shares her design with Rainbowshine. She has speaking roles in Lesson Zero and in Rainbow Falls.

characters.name: Parasol
characters.description: Parasol is a female Pegasus pony with a light yellow coat, wisteria mane and tail, web orange eyes, and a cutie mark of three purple umbrellas. She shares her design with Sassaflash. She is unnamed in the series, but she is named in other media.

characters.name: Peach Fuzz
characters.description: See "Peach Fuzz".

characters.name: Pearly Stitch
characters.description: Pearly Stitch is an elderly female Earth pony with a very pale blue coat, pink mane and tail, blue eyes with dark blue pupils, and a cutie mark of a ball of purple yarn. She is unnamed in the show, credited only as "Elderly Pony" in Made in Manehattan and as "Older Pony" in Discordant Harmony, but she is named in merchandise.

characters.name: Press Release
characters.description: Several paparazzi ponies appear in various episodes in the series, including Earth ponies Long Shot and Snappy Scoop, unicorn Press Release, and Pegasi Big Shot, Eff Stop, and Tracy Flash. They are unnamed in the show, "Tracy Flash" being a placeholder name, but some are named varyingly in merchandise and other depictions.

characters.name: Primrose​
characters.description: See Primrose.

characters.name: Rainbow Dash
characters.description: Rainbow Dash is a female Pegasus pony and one of the main characters in My Little Pony Friendship is Magic. She maintains the weather and clears the skies in Ponyville. As a huge fan of the Wonderbolts, she becomes a reservist member of the elite flying group in Testing Testing 1, 2, 3 and a full member in Newbie Dash. In Sonic Rainboom, Rarity and Princess Celestia both declare that she is the best flier in all of Equestria. Rainbow Dash has a pet tortoise named Tank, whom she chooses out of Fluttershy's offered animals in the episode May the Best Pet Win! She represents the element of loyalty.

characters.name: Rarity
characters.description: Rarity is a female unicorn pony and one of the main characters of My Little Pony Friendship is Magic. She is Sweetie Belle's older sister and the subject of Spike's long-term crush. Rarity works as both a fashion designer and as a seamstress at her own shop in Ponyville, the Carousel Boutique. She has a white Persian cat named Opalescence. She represents the element of generosity.

characters.name: Sassaflash
